title: Best Recipe App for All kinds of people
body: I love Yummly, I don‚Äôt remember how I found out about it. But it has been a lifesaver, it‚Äôs great to save recipes I find online that I want to look at later and not get lost in the bookmark section of my phone. It‚Äôs also good for a vegan like me to find recipes, but also serving size and nutrition facts.I scan look at all the  egan recipes in one place instead of looking them up online and finding out it isn‚Äôt vegan. Plus I can look for recipes using certain ingredients I have laying around. They have such a inclusive dietary preference all types of vegetarians, paleo, plus all kinds of allergies. They have now guided videos, I‚Äôll check those out soon and see what they‚Äôre like. I honestly can‚Äôt think of anything to complain about. It‚Äôs a useful tool for me and one of the must-have food apps on my phone.  All the other exclusively  vegan recipe apps , or just general apps are overpriced and don‚Äôt do half the things Yummly does or if they do you have to pay a ridiculous subscription fee. The best part it is all free! Not a free app with a lot limitations on certain recipes, but there‚Äôs a premium membership with access to over thousand of recipes and videos. Or it‚Äôs a free trial , it‚Äôs actually legitimately free, I mean it has prompted recipes from brand companies but its clearly labeled. Plus I mean the app has to be paid for somehow. If that‚Äôs the only ads I‚Äôve got to deal with, I‚Äôll take it!

title: Great source for wide variety of recipes!
body: My sister and I are fanatics for cooking and absolutely love to find new ideas to try out. Her and I have been using Yummly for probably, 5-7 years? It‚Äôs been a good long while! Some recipes still need a judgement call on them as they need to be edited some for errors - some are exact copies of others - and some are just completely far from a recipe (open can of soup, add water and cook on stove till warm). Then there are the majority that are good recipes and ideas. My sister and I have made countless recipes from this app and will for as long as there is this app probably just simply because it is a fun pass time of ours to just go recipe window licking and just make a weekly or monthly planner of meals from time to time...

title: I love this app!!!
body: The design of this app is awesome. It manages to pull recipes from many sources smoothly, and it‚Äôs great about searching specific ingredients/certain types of meals. It consolidates all the recipe info in a clean, straightforward way, so when you spot something you want to try you can quickly see nutritional info, ingredients, prep time etc. from the app, without having to scroll through the actual site the recipe was posted on trying to find all that information (if you choose to make the meal you will THEN go to the full recipe site for the directions, but it‚Äôs still from within the app). It lets you create different lists, which I really like, and you can even tell it to create shopping lists for you based on the recipe you‚Äôve picked. You can also tell it what ingredients you have on hand and it‚Äôll will give you recipes that you can make using those ingredients, or what time you plan on eating something. It will give you reminders on when to start prepping the meal if you give it a time. So cool.

title: Yummy Yummly
body: I‚Äôm a major Foodie. I have found so many incredible and interesting recipes on Yummly. Even ones I‚Äôve used over the years myself. I really enjoy the ability to research so easily. I try a lot of recipes that fall into several different categories. So it‚Äôs always a pleasure to come on to the app and be able to research in less time than books, especially when the recipes give you nutritional information that is accurate.

title: Awesome app! But always room for improvement
body: I love this app and use it just about every week depending on how busy the schedule is. There‚Äôs recipes for almost everything on here. Every recipe I‚Äôve found has detailed instructions for prep and cooking. I can almost guarantee you will find what you‚Äôre looking for here. Convenient meals available at your fingertips. Only spots for improvement in my opinion is not having pop ups to go to some blog every time you want instructions for a recipe. The instructions should be right on the app itself. Not that it‚Äôs a major hassle or anything but sometimes I don‚Äôt want to read about how much mom loves this recipe and wants to stroke it for ten minutes before she shares her secrets with us, who just want simple instructions so we can accomplish making the meal and enjoying it with family/friends. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, sometimes I really enjoy reading the blogs when they‚Äôre well written or I‚Äôm in an interested mood. It would just be cool to have the option of looking at plain instructions along with going to the blogs as well. Also an improvement would be being able to see the recipes my mom has saved or yum‚Äôd, and vice versa. Because cooking with mom is how most of us learned or started to learn!

title: Very good
body: Good app. Relatively easy to use. Great customize categories for ‚Äòfiling‚Äô recipes. Very good content. I will keep using. Could be a little more intuitive on tech side, esp when searching for recipes. It‚Äôs nice to search by ingredient/omit ingredient, & would be better if could just search categories of food by type of food or main ingredient or basic type of recipe name...in other words the equivalent of searching by subject at the library. Have found it hard to do that. When opening a traditional cookbook/recipe book, you can do so and it‚Äôs efficient, esp w/an index. It took me 45+ min to find a recipe the other day. Easier access to FULL recipes would be better/appreciated, although I understand why clicking to the recipe author‚Äôs scroll-thru-29-ads-and-other-misc-stuff-to-get-to-free-full-recipe-directions is necessary in the current pay-for-play-with-time/distraction/ads/broken up text-model of receiving ‚Äúfree‚Äù content via electronic media/apps. I‚Äôm not sure if there is a paid version of Yummly and even more important, I have my doubts that a paid version would eliminate the above mentioned scroll-thru-15pages to get to full recipes/instructions.

title: Yummly in my tummly
body: I‚Äôve been using the Yummly app for a few years now.  I can find every recipe I am searching for, and believe me it has come in handy.  In the last year I‚Äôve switched diets from Mediterranean to Vegan to Keto, now I‚Äôm low carb.  All the while I‚Äôm gluten free.  The app makes it easy to obtain allergy free recipes and recipes geared toward my diet.  I also receive emails from Yummly.  Just before Christmas I receive cool kitchen recommendations.  I may put some items on my Christmas list for me or buy items for my friends and family.  I am an avid gardener and sometimes need fresh new ideas for an over abundance of vegetables or fruits.  With Yummly I can search the vegetables name and find all sorts of recipes.  This year I canned my very own tomato sauce with a Yummly recipe!   I also learned how to cut a whole chicken in half and roast it!  The amount of ‚ÄúYums‚Äù on each recipe make it simple for me to chose what recipe I want to try if multiple recipes pop up under my search. I‚Äôm rating Yummly 5 stars because I can always find an outstanding recipe to suit my and my family‚Äôs needs.

title: Updated - lowered to 3 - plus it a couple of suggestions
body: I gave it 4 stars but I‚Äôm down to three right now.  I respect the right to have a paid/subscription service but if I‚Äôm not interested in that please let me know if I‚Äôm going to have an offer thrown in my face every-single-time I start the app.  I don‚Äôt mind periodic reviews but I am getting annoyed.  When I get annoyed I begin to look at alternatives.

title: Love this, but...
body: I love this app. My husband introduced me to it a couple years back and we both use it on a weekly basis. The layout makes it less intimidating when finding something new to cook. It has options to help with shopping and has videos from chefs to help with some recipes (you have to pay for that portion.) which is nice.

title: Cancel subscription
body: Yummly has too many ads, requires multiple clicks to get to the heart of a recipe, and profiles recipes for me that don‚Äôt fit my needs. But what is the most frustrating is trying to cancel my subscription. It‚Äôs a never ending do-loop of logging into website to access my account, then being sent an email that asks me to sign in. I have then gotten to the place to cancel my subscription, which I do, but then the website will not allow me to cancel my account until I have canceled my subscription, which I have already done (or think I‚Äôve done). But at each step, I have to log in to website where it again sends me an email with link to sign in and I have to start all over.  It just keeps repeating. This doesn‚Äôt make any sense, does it? No. I can‚Äôt even explain what is happening because it is utter nonsense. I want to cancel my subscription and delete my account. And it doesn‚Äôt appear that I can.  So, my advice is to avoid this app at all costs. It‚Äôs a trap and there are better cooking apps out there. And if I did successfully cancel my subscription, please cancel my account.  I have tried multiple times and it just keeps telling me that I need to cancel my subscription first.  Which I tried to do.  That‚Äôs how bad this is.

title: Amazing, so many good features
body: Yummly is a great app. I have found so many recipes on the app that I never would have found otherwise! If you aren‚Äôt sure about a recipe, just look at the reviews for the recipe. Reviewing recipes is honestly such a good idea, as most recipe-filled websites or apps don‚Äôt have such features, meaning that you have no idea if the food will turn out well. You can save the recipes, which is another great feature. Find a recipe you would like to try? Just save it so you don‚Äôt have to go back and find it later. If you are planning on making several different things at the same time, you can add the ingredients you need to the shopping list on Yummly, sorted by category of foods. When you first log on to Yummly, the user can choose what foods they dislike, what they are allergic to, if they are on any diets, and what kinds of dishes they enjoy preparing. This filters the recipes you see, and you can then find more recipes you would like. Yummly is my #1 choice as a baker and chef.

title: AWESOME...But just one thing...
body: Yummly is seriously so amazing and I'm surprised I haven't heard about it until now. It definitely inspires me to want to cook more often. Also, the way you can filter through recipes is so cool. I will usually look for different recipes on Pinterest, but this app just makes everything so much easier. You see something that looks good, and can instantly save it. Then you just tap the picture, and boom you have the recipe. Also the way you can filter your allergy/diet specifications is one the coolest things about the entire app! The only thing I wish it did have (and i understand this isn't very high demand compared to diet) is a weight GAIN filter. Thats one of the toughest things that I struggle with, with having such a high metabolism, is finding HEALTHIER meals that help you gain weight(more protein,calories) . If there was even just an option in the ‚ÄúNutrition‚Äù filter where you can select ‚Äúhigher calorie amount‚Äù or something like that, would be super awesome. Just my personal feedback and this is the ONLY negative thing that I have to say about Yummly! :-)

title: Best recipe app!!!
body: I‚Äôve tried pretty much all the recipe apps and this is by far the best. I use it nearly every day. I have food allergies. Yummly let‚Äôs me select foods I‚Äôm allergic to along with foods I don‚Äôt like. That‚Äôs nice because it allows me to expand my allergy list. I can pick a specific diet. In our case, pescatarian. I can also pick our favorite cuisines like Mediterranean, Greek, Indian, etc. I‚Äôve not found a lot of the other food apps to be so specific at narrowing down your searches. I don‚Äôt want to see foods I‚Äôm not interested in.

title: Almost There
body: This a review of the app only.

title: This app got me to start cooking!
body: I was telling myself that I will start cooking more for months... There were times where I would cook for a week and then it would wane for a couple weeks because I wasn‚Äôt really sure what I was capable of cooking. Looking at food blogs was becoming tiresome because I wasn‚Äôt really sure what I was looking for... Enter: Yummly. I downloaded the app after seeing an ad on Instagram and I was immediately hooked. The UI is super intuitive and and satisfying to use. I can simply just type in what I‚Äôm in the mood for (e.g., ‚Äúchicken breast‚Äù) and then I have a plethora of diverse recipe options to choose from. It is so simple to browse through recipes on the bus, find something I‚Äôm in the mood for, add the ingredients to my shopping list with the click of a button, and then use the app as I walk around the store to ensure I get everything. Highly recommend!!!

title: Can I ‚ÄúYum‚Äù Yummly?!
body: I have been using (and loving) Yummly for years. I love it for gathering and saving recipes. I also use it to meal plan and create my grocery list. I‚Äôve recommended it to many people when they ask where I find my recipes.

title: Great!
body: It‚Äôs the best free recipe app! You can save recipes to different categories. The app starts you off with some categories, but you can create your own categories that make sense to you so that you can easily find what you have a taste for. You can click on ingredients right from the recipe, & they go to your shopping list which is organized by type (produce, meat, etc.). You can check it off in the app as you buy it, but it doesn‚Äôt disappear. It just moves to a completed section of your list, then you delete it when you want. In the shopping list, it also tells you what recipe the ingredient is for, AND you can get to the recipe right from the specific ingredient in your shopping list. ü§ó There are SO many recipes too AND different recipes for (ways to make) the same dish. Some recipes for a dish may be easier or have a different twist. There is so much possibility.

title: Awesome!
body: I have made more meals in a week than I ever have! Meal planning was always so hard for me to do with a little one - never enough time to look up recipes, always forgetting something at the store, etc. but with Yummly, I have been able to get all my groceries in ONE trip to the store, and find the recipes easily! My favorite new find in this app is that you can set a schedule on your calendar that will remind you when you need to start prepping the ingredients & throwing it all together to have it done by the dinner time you‚Äôd want!! THAT is HUGE for me!! I am very bad at planning out the meal prep time, always causing our meals to run into the night, or having to throw some last minute dinner together that is below exceptional.

title: Worst Recipe App without a doubt
body: I hated their website and app several years ago when I tried to use. But one of my dear friend sent me a recipe ‚ÄúSuper Energy Kale Soup‚Äù via email I tried click the link and open it in my browser, ingredients comes up but when I click ‚Äúget directions‚Äù , that page never stop loading and nothing comes up. I‚Äôm kind of person who have insane amount patient!! So I go to App Store and download the app, and follow through the 10 minutes worth of crap to finish signing up, then even get the pro version. I searched for the kale soup recipe and and when it came up I clicked ‚Äú get directions‚Äù, same thing happened and it opens a blank page. Now most people would give up by then, but I decided to try one more recipe to see if only that one kale recipe soup has issue, but second and third recipe same thing. I use an IPhone XR and all the software are up to date. I don‚Äôt care what million other people say, after spending 25 minutes of my life I will never get back... this is the worst recipe app or to be honest any app I have ever used. Your incompetence is nothing short of unspeakable!!

title: Great App for Certain Uses
body: This is a great app to find new recipes, but it is not so friendly when you want to save and compile recipes that you already use. I was able to find many, but not all, of the recipes I like to use (from certain blogs/websites). I do not use any filters, so I am unsure why the search function does not recognize certain recipes that easily come u when I google search. To my knowledge, there is NO function to either import a missing recipe from another link or manually enter a recipe (that may not be online).

title: Love this app but needs a notes feature
body: I've been using this app for a week and it's already basically changed my life. I can much more easily find recipes to try, add all the ingredients to my shopping list, and schedule what night I want to cook each meal. I'm saving money because I'm not eating out, and my family is happy because they aren't getting the same three meals on constant rotation. HOWEVER. I have one quibble. It appears there is no way to leave yourself a note on a particular recipe (like "try this with half the sugar next time," or "this is my new favorite but the husband doesn't care for it, so make it when he's out"). I instead have to rely on leaving public reviews for each recipe that includes my notes, which isn't ideal. If they were to fix this issue to allow users to leave private notes on recipes, I would easily give this app five stars, as it is otherwise fantastic.

title: A M A Z I N G : a thorough review
body: Right away when you get the app it gives you a quiz about foods you prefer and don‚Äôt prefer, if you have any food allergies, or if you are on a diet. You can always change these in settings. There is a home page of foods the app thinks you would like and an explore page if you want to try new things. There is also a search bar. All of the recipes have the nutritional facts and tell you how long it takes to make. You can also set a reminder on the app of when you would like to start preparing your meal. You can give the recipes reviews and comments. You can also save the foods you want to make and there is even a way to organize your saved recipes.  You can even make a shopping list on the app and there is a spot on the app where it tells you of good cooking tools you can buy from different brands. Love this app!

title: Yummly is yum but...
body: I have recently noticed a deterioration in the simplicity of your app. Other sites are posting within your site and it‚Äôs becoming very frustrating. For example, If I want ‚ÄúAllrecipes‚Äù site, I would go there.  Unfortunately, now when I click on a recipe now it could take me to another site where there are unrelated recipes. Not only can I not find their version on the recipe, but there is no way too search for it within their app. This is wasting my time and forcing me to click multiple recipes just to find one that takes me directly to what I‚Äôm searching for. One of the things I loved about your app was the ability to go directly to the recipe that was posted and look at the overview of ingredients prior to viewing the recipe. I hope you can fix this issue. This is getting too hard!

title: Life changing app üôåüëè
body: I never agree to write reviews for apps but this one deserves it. I love this app! I use it every single day for at least one meal if not more ‚ò∫Ô∏èüòã Yummly has the most amazing options and filters. It coordinates how long the prep and cooking take and can even add a reminder to your phone calendar to notify you of when to begin your meal based off the time you want to serve it. It lets you select if you have a food allergy and will choose recipes without that. It lets you list foods or ingredients you dislike and will choose receives without those. It has an option to let you list what ingredients you might have laying in your refrigerator or pantry and will show you a recipe with those ingredients. And it even lets you take pictures of food/ingredients and will help you identify them to choose a recipe based off that. Great app. Thank you!!!

title: Great app, prompt support
body: The Yummly app is great because it compiles recipes from all over, which I would be too search-fatigued to track down myself. (At the end of the day, let‚Äôs all admit it: we want to spend less time on electronic devices and more time living.) I also really appreciate being able to tell it to exclude certain ingredients; for example, if you avoid soy, it can be excluded; and during Lent you can exclude meat and then reintroduce it later in settings.

title: Love this app
body: I have been using this app for probably around 7 years now. Definitely my go-to app for recipes. This app makes it super easy to find what you‚Äôre looking for by asking questions like what kind of protein you want in your dish, desired cooking time, number of ingredients, type of ingredients, dietary restrictions, etc. in order to filter the recipes. When you find recipes you want to save for later, you can create categories (I have one called ‚ÄúRecipes for Dad‚Äù where I save easy recipes that I know he can make) or use the ones that come with the app (breakfast, lunch, dinner) to sort them. The recipes always show a rating and written reviews from people who have made them. I find this extremely helpful in deciding which recipes to make and how to alter them based on reviews. Overall, this app is super bomb and I recommend it to everyone!

title: Huge variety of recipes, very useful
body: Yummly is a great app for finding, collecting and storing recipes. Yes, Google also works well for finding recipes, but Yummly gives you a virtual storage place to collect your recipes, sort by type, and each recipe has a shopping list function as well as detailed instructions.

title: Can‚Äôt find what I want ‚Äî impossible you say, right?
body: It is an anomaly ‚Äî what with the hundreds of recipes ‚Äî there are times when I have searched for something so simple that, instead of simple, I get everything but. Take just a basic beets-from-a-can recipe, for example. All I wanted was how to jazz this veggie up, especially since now ‚Äúcanned‚Äù almost everything is safer than fresh. Try it yourself: you will get a page that gets stuck, literally, on ‚Äúmarinated‚Äù beets that you practically need to power off to get to another page ‚Äî going to the back button won‚Äôt do. Or you get exotic recipes for ‚Äúfresh‚Äù beet dishes. What I needed were some herbs and spices that go well with beets ‚Äúfrom a can.‚Äù Who has the time to plow through every fancy recipe to find one or two ‚Äúherb/spice‚Äù suggestions? A section on what basic herbs and spices go with each category (canned or fresh) ‚Äî like carrots, green beans, peas, broccoli, cauliflower, asparagus, corn etc. ‚Äî  would be a welcome addition.

title: Only recipe app I use.
body: I love this app. I can save recipes (and they make it so easy to do) and I can categorize them too. I love being able to customize my apps like that. This is pretty much the only app I use for recipes. I don‚Äôt even google that stuff anymore. Yummly has nearly everything I want when it comes searching for recipes.

title: My go to recipe site
body: Whenever I am trying to figure out what to cook today, I start with Yummly. Especially now that I am trying to use whatever I have in my refrigerator and pantry. I love that I can just put a few ingredients in my search query and a slew of recipes from sites all over the web pop up.

title: Nice app to find a variety of recipes
body: Love the app. There is one thing about it that I‚Äôm not 100% sold on: some (most) recipes link to an external website. But it doesn‚Äôt have to be a link. Users just have to put in the instructions which they don‚Äôt usually do. It would be nice to not have to go through a webpage within Yummly to get the directions of the recipe because the ingredients are listed on Yummly anyway (for nutrition facts on each recipe which I dig). At that point it‚Äôs not really a problem with the app if the users aren‚Äôt making use of the feature so no star taken off for that.

title: Pleasantly surprised
body: I was looking for recipes to make for thanksgiving and I needed fast and multiple food options. Yummly quickly sorted out the ones I wanted and the ones I didn‚Äôt want. It gives me a planning time to work with and lots of new food ideas! I would recommend it to people who have to make meals for special occasions like Christmas or thanksgiving but normal day to day uses are also very good.

title: Love it! With just a few exceptions...
body: It‚Äôs easy to use on the computer or app. I can quickly find recipes that interest me based on dietary preferences, specific ingredients, or other search filters. I love the shopping cart feature, it‚Äôs very helpful when I‚Äôm at the store because I can add everything I need and have it all in one place without taking the time to write it down.

title: Needs Improved Calendar Integration
body: After a week of using the Yummly app I would give it 3.5 stars out of 5. My biggest pet peeve is that it only wants to sync to my Apple calendar. I really only use the google calendar app on my phone and in my general life so that‚Äôs been one issue with the app. I would like it a lot better if the app gave me the option of choosing to schedule directly to the google calendar app.

title: Genius cooking
body: For anyone who has ever shopped in a supermarket while hungry, it is the worst - you buy everything you crave, and sometimes have nothing that actually ‚Äúgoes together‚Äù in a healthy fashion.  Yummly is FANTASTIC for breaking the process of cooking/preparing down to: being able to shop in your fridge/freezer/cabinets before you go to the supermarket.  You can get exactly what you need - look at nearby stores that have the ingredients - and basically shop before you even leave your kitchen.  Also, Yummly gives allows you to time all of the preparation and desired eat time that you would like - and all of this can change: to the day/time, which is wonderful.  I enjoy this application immensely - even doing recipes that sound so bizarre.

title: Yummily searches for me!
body: Yummily is awesome! Great recipes and great ideas for almost every occasion!! Love how the emails have a theme... and I can search any topic and find at least a dozen ideas to try!

title: Useful
body: Yummly aggregates recipes pretty well. It always gives me lots of options.

title: Yumly makes cooking a breeze!
body: A few years ago I was in a rut cooking the same recipes week after week.  My two kids would ask, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs for dinner mom?‚Äù If I said chicken, they would reply ‚ÄúNo! Not chicken again!‚Äù With the voice of agony that I never want to hear again! It made me realize how boring and routine my cooking had become.  Not wanting to disappoint again,  I quickly started looking for a solution to our problem.  I found yumly and my kids are now wondering what new and exiting recipe I will make each day!! I can‚Äôt thank yumly enough and I share about it with my friends every time I get a chance!! Thank you! From the bottom of my heart and the bottom of my kids bellies!!! My kids will never be bored with my cooking again!!!

title: Great App!
body: I love that Yummly has so many recipes when I‚Äôm hunting for a specific ingredient, cooking process, season, event, etc. I also appreciate Yummly including the number of people who have ‚Äúyummed‚Äù each recipe which tells me how popular the recipe is (tried & true) & that you can keep track of your preferred recipes by yumming them then filing them in an appropriate category for future ease in finding them again. This is a very stable website that I use multiple times a day & appreciate it for what it offers users. Thanks Yummly!!

title: Searching needs work!
body: I use the app because I like how it gathers from so many sources.  I don‚Äôt like a few things .  The search by ingredients function gives limited choices and no ability to customize the search.  Also, When typing into search, there is no spell check so for example, if you are looking for an exotic dish, you have to know EXACTLY how to spell it.  Or if you just can‚Äôt remember how to spell cauliflower, it doesn‚Äôt help you.  The MOST annoying thing is that there is no ‚ÄúHistory‚Äù function.  If you were just deciding between recipes and didn‚Äôt Yum all of them, you cant find them again without starting at the beginning. I also wish there was a way to save a recipe to a file before I decide to Yum it, or review it.  For example seeing that a recipe has been Yummed 39 times with one review, tells me little.

title: Amazing App that Has Really Supported Me Entering a Healthy 30s
body: I love this app - not kidding, but it has literally changed my life. I‚Äôve been trying to eat healthier for stomach/digestive reasons I've had my whole life and this app has made that so easy for me. I‚Äôm not a chef by any stretch of the imagination, but it allows me to customize my dietary restrictions and them sends me emails weekly or puts recipes on my feed that fit in those restrictions. They even will tell you what recipes are the fastest and easiest if you‚Äôre not the best cook, like me but getting there(!), or just want a snack. I even started the Whole30 and it suggests recipes that are Whole30 friendly. Without the support of this app, I wouldn‚Äôt be able to do it. Thanks guys! Good work!

title: Quick, fast, easy, simple
body: I work on average 45-50hrs a week. I have 2 jobs and 3 kids. Boy Scouts , extra curricular activities , meetings, clients. And then the dreaded phone call..... what‚Äôs for dinner? Ughh‚Äî- I haven‚Äôt even been home!! This app makes planning my month easier. I usually bulk shop for the month, and buy produce and dairy fresh when I need them. Being able to make my list directly from the app, choosing all ingredients I need and have it at my finger tips makes this busy mom look like she spent hours cooking !! Still get a great, healthy , customized meal!! Love it !! Wish it would sync to my calendar tho. Still struggling with trying to fix that. Not sure if it‚Äôs the app, or my calendar. Says it‚Äôs synchro but keeps giving me a Oops message

title: Love this
body: Yumly is great! I find so many dinner ideas on this app. I browse this everyday to see what is new and how I can keep my wife‚Äôs palette guessing.

title: Yummly turned me into a chef!
body: I‚Äôve always loved to bake sweets, but never enjoyed cooking, partially because I am not very creative, so coming up with ideas was difficult. Nor am I good at just throwing some ingredients together to make a dish. Since I started using Yummly, I now make the most delicious meals! My husband, who used to do the majority of the cooking, is thoroughly impressed by my new talent! Everything I‚Äôve made has turned out perfectly and has been revisited several times. We call it ‚Äúputting in on rotation.‚Äù üòä

title: Repeat Customer!!!!!!!!!
body: I have rated this application several times over the years!!!!! I am an avid application downloader!!!! I currently have 410 apps on my IPad and almost as many on my iPhone!!! This is one app that I have on both!!! AMAZING!!!! BY FAR the best cooking app that I‚Äôve found to date!!!! I rate most apps that truly deserve my praise!!!!! This is truthfully one of the best I‚Äôve ever seen!!! The reason I‚Äôm on here RIGHT NOW, is because I want some eggs for breakfast and I‚Äôm tired of the same old same old. This IS my FIRST GO TO app for cooking!!! If NOTHING LESS, I get inspiration for what I want to cook!!!! I love that I can select ingredients that I don‚Äôt want to use!!! I have a severe kiwi allergy, and thus it doesn‚Äôt show me any recipes with kiwi in it!!! A MUST FOR DOWNLOADS!!!!

title: Yummly Recipes
body: Yummly Recipes is a well designed application that can be personalized to the users tastes to better become a great assistant. The interface design pops off the screen with bright high quality images of foods. The app allows easy navigation to all categories whether articles, recipes or the shopping list. The app is resourceful in many ways. For example users can get suggestions for meals just by scanning an ingredient you have at home. The app also collects recipes from other popular food sources such as Epicurious reducing the need for other applications or sources you rely on. It also works with Apple Health making it easier for whose who rely on the platform to guideline their well being. Yummly is well worth a download for all home chefs whether the free or Premium Pro version.

title: The only reason I cook
body: Any time I try a dish that I love, I want to learn to make it myself. Before, I‚Äôd just use google, but it was difficult to keep things organized. Yummly has made it easy for me to search and save recipes that I want to attempt. I‚Äôve attempted a lot and the app lets me add all the ingredients to a shopping list too, which I love. With the added comments on recipes from the Yummly community, it helps me better understand what I‚Äôm in for when attempting a recipe (add more or less of an ingredient, cook longer/less, etc). I could go on and on about it. There are still features that I have yet to utilize. I just think it‚Äôs great and this app has single handedly fanned the flames of my passion for cooking at home.

title: amazing app
body: I have used this app for years. It has been my go to app for meal planning. Most of the things are great and it makes meal planning and cooking easier. It used to be really good for grocery shopping too.

title: The Food App I Use the Most
body: I have a number of food apps and most of them are decent. However, my most beloved one‚Äîhands down!‚Äîis Yummly. Nearly every dish for which I request recipes is instantly provided in multiple versions, from simple to more involved. Many of the recipes have built-in videos to make the preparation process even simpler. Since I love the Instant Pot so much, I often search for recipes specifically for cooking in that device. Yummly focuses on that type of recipe nearly as much as I do, and they never fail to provide me with ingenious and delicious options for that cooking genre.

title: Nut Allergy here! This is wonderful
body: I have had this on multiple phones. Just Googling recipes is fine for plenty of people, but when you have food allergies or dietary restrictions, it can become stressful. This is also the easiest way to filter by ingredients, the tool I use quite often. I even have recipes saved to try another day, gotta remember to buy some of those key ingredients! This does not eliminate my family resources for their recipes, it just lets me add something new to the rotation or plan for something interesting! About to make Salmon With Everything Bagel Seasoning from A Taste of Joy and Love for the second time this month. Not a paid review, just wanted to recommend it!!!

title: Does not say recipes for me.
body: I installed this app three months ago on my iPhone 7 Plus, I have updated my operating system‚Äôs to the most current update on the operating system for the iPhone. Ever since I downloaded this app, even today, it will not save recipes for me I keep getting the error message ‚Äúwe are experiencing problems saving your recipe right now please try again later‚Äù I press OK , try save it again and keep getting the same error message over and over and over. Seriously Yummly/Yum app developers, what‚Äôs up? I have even uninstalled this app and reinstalled it three times and it still keeps doing the same thing. Ugh! üëéüèº

title: Tell your friends!
body: I often say Yummly is the Pinterest of foodies. We all know how easy it is to get sucked into the massive abyss that is Pinterest (yes, I love that site/app too) but this is a great place to just look for dinner, cake, breakfast, all manner of tasty things! There are a lot of good features to explore. I don‚Äôt even know the extent of it yet. And it is worth telling your friend about! I know I do all the time!

title: Many, many recipes to choose from.
body: Maybe it is just me but I kind this site difficult to use. I am the first to admit I am anything but a computer expert but I can‚Äôt even make a recipe a favorite. I try to search for a recipe that I have seen before but it seems to be lost in the abyss of computer land! Now I just print it out as I see something interesting.

title: Great app!
body: Yummly has a ton of delicious recipes!! üòç

title: Robust Cooking app!
body: I love Yummly, in addition to having millions of recipes available from top chefs to cool bloggers, it allows you to filter your search by ingredients that you do or don‚Äôt like as well as by what ingredients you already have at home. Love the shopping list feature, you can creat 1 shopping list for multiple recipes for the 5 course meal  you plan to cook and it automatically sorts the items by grocery store depts (ex diary, meats, etc). Lastly the schedule feature is perfect, pick the day you plan to make receipe and when you want it to be ready and it will give you an alert/reminder on when to start prepping. I use this app more than I expected.

title: Great app, I use it a lot!
body: I use this app regularly to find new recipes. Its filters are super helpful, you can easily narrow down what you're looking for. Diet restrictions, ingredients on hand, time it takes to cook, methods of cooking, and so much more. It has quite a few options I haven't even tried yet, like pairing a smart thermometer with the app! I use it on a regular basis, and would absolutely recommend this app. The developers recently added a paid subscription option, but the free version is still super useful so they don't force you to pay for the subscription(they didn't throw in a bunch of adds when the premium version came out either!) So thats nice

title: Best cooking app there is
body: I never leave reviews.... but this is the best cooking app I‚Äôve ever found. I‚Äôve used it for a couple of years and love that it‚Äôs full of food bloggers recipes and linked directly to their websites. I used to just google for recipes, but never found as many quality recipes as I do on Yummly. There‚Äôs a massive variety of recipes in this app and that‚Äôs what makes it priceless. You can set food preferences to make sure that each recipe that pops up is something you‚Äôd actually eat. The grocery list feature is the best. Saves you time and effort and you can add in others items you need. I tell all of my friends about this app and they always love it too.

title: Best Cooking Database
body: Great app! This app is my favorite. It‚Äôs awesome for individuals either looking to follow a particular diet (keto, low sodium, etc.) or just have other parameters or restrictions they need to adhere to. As opposed to vaguely browsing a search engine for something that stands out, this app makes it easy for me to say, ‚ÄúHey! I want chicken with cilantro but I only have 30 minutes or less‚Äù. Furthermore, seeing how many people have liked the recipe and being able to easily adjust the serving size is another plus. And I can‚Äôt forget about the ability to easily save and organize recipes that have interested me. I recommend this app to everyone! There are even drink recipes as well.

title: Wonderful, Valuable, Educational
body: I downloaded this app at the start of COVID as my wife and I challenged ourselves to cook more. This app made it fun and easy to try new recipes and dishes. You can just type in pretty much anything you want into the search bar and have a number of different recipes to choose from. The ‚ÄúYum‚Äù function is awesome and I use it to save recipes and put them in ‚Äòlists‚Äô so I can go back and browse my past likes easily. For example, I have recipe lists for chicken, beef, (any other meats), sauces/marinades, desserts, holiday, etc. I‚Äôve really annoyed using this app (daily!) and recommend it to most everyone I meet that wants to get into cooking more. 5 stars all day.

title: Nice pictures, little else.
body: Sadly it‚Äôs either a very poorly designed site and series of apps or it‚Äôs simply incomplete.

title: Best app I‚Äôve used for recipes
body: I just downloaded this app and it honestly makes searching for healthy and delicious recipes SO easy. It‚Äôs fun and easy to use. Not only is there so much variety but I love that it caters specifically to your needs, from selecting your allergies to selecting what dietary plan you have in mind. I would however love to see more videos on how these recipes are made. I still enjoy reading the articles on how these meals are made step by step but it sometimes makes it more fun and feels easier to make the recipe when you follow a video. Other than that, I‚Äôm very excited to continue to use this app to make some delicious meals.

title: Best app !
body: The only part I wish was improved is that a premium version be made to allow me to import or type in family recipes and a menu planning area. . Otherwise it‚Äôs wonderful!!!! Lets you Organize your recipes the way you wish . Shopping lists easily made ... I can sigh. In from any device and use in the store as I shop ... I can find a recipe online and search for it by name and site then find it on Yummly as well to save it. I rate , review and add any notes to help me next time and even a picture if I feel like it. You can choose foods you want or to eliminate in searches such as allergy foods too! Can‚Äôt say enough about the App!

title: Fantastic!
body: My wife and I started keto a few weeks ago, and Yummly has been an extremely helpful resource. It's easy to search for recipes, and I like how I can save recipes in different collections so if I want to make breakfast I can just click on my "Breakfast" collection and check out my options. For a long time I couldn't find the "Yum" Safari button to add recipes that aren't in the app, but I finally got it working so now I can even save recipes I find online. And I love how Yummly includes reviews, so I can see what other users thought about that recipe. This is a well-implemented app and I honestly can't think of anything it's missing.

title: Finding good foods to eat finally!!
body: I am probably the worlds pickiest eater. Because of that I have a hard time finding new foods to eat and I get sick of the same things over and over. I decided to take some chances on internet sights and YUM is the best place I‚Äôve found so far! I love the potato, ham, corn chowder! It‚Äôs so good! And the ground beef minestrone soup and stuffed cabbage, truly yummy!!! I make meals a couple of months in advance and freeze them. It is so nice to just pull the out, heat them in the microwave, add a salad or fruit, or a muffin or some kind of bread ‚Äî try the banana bread with the streusel, it is to die for!! Everything I have made has frozen nicely and tasted just as good after thawed and reheated! Love this site!

title: Amazing but under explained
body: This app has been my go to to make some truly amazing meals for my family, but functionally tends to be hidden away unless you have an idea what to look for!

title: Try it and love it
body: I‚Äôm the type person who never does reviews, always clicks ‚Äúlater‚Äù when the app keeps asking lol. But Yummly has been very patient with me so I said ‚Äúwhy not?‚Äù I‚Äôve been using this thing for years. It‚Äôs a great app. You can filter for certain ingredients you (don‚Äôt) want, cooking methods and cooking times. Dietary restrictions. You looking for a crock pot meal? They got it. Want dinner to be done in ten minutes? They got that too.

title: Difficult to learn and filters don‚Äôt work
body: I‚Äôve been using Allrecipes for many years. Recently, their app stopped working on my phone so I‚Äôm looking for a replacement. Reviews seemed to point towards this app.

title: Generally Good
body: But there are several very annoying aspects to the app. Complaint #1‚Äì While having folders to organize your favorite recipes is a great concept, these folders can‚Äôt be ‚Äúlocked‚Äù into place. It is SUCH A PAIN, to have my folders constantly resorted, even within the same session. Even having the folders alphabetized would be a better option. Complaint #2‚Äî I wish it was possible to organize my folders as I see fit. If so, I would organize the meat dishes together, the vegetable dishes together, etc. Complaint #3‚Äî It is such a time-waster to have to ‚Äúclick‚Äù on a recipe in order to save it in a folder. Complaint #4‚Äî I wish it was possible to add our own (personal) recipes.

title: Used to love it, but now it‚Äôs a chore.
body: I loved how quick, easy, and reliable Yummly used to be as how I used it, a recipe box and gatherer.

title: Liking app less
body: I have used many recipes that I have found on Yummly with mixed results. They are not all complete and leave out such details and the size of pan or temperature of Oven or length of time in oven.  This week I was looking for a traditional sugar cookie, like we made when I was a little girl many many many years ago.  I had to search through a lot of gluten-free, sugar-free and Ingredients I had never heard of to find anything close to what I wanted.  I am all for healthier diet but if you Yummly is becoming more health and less comfort foods, I‚Äôm finished.

title: It could be so much better.  Lots of potential, but falls short.
body: Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I LOVE Yummly.  I use it a lot for recipe searching.  But, I kind of have a love hate relationship with Yummly.  From the standpoint of tons of great recipes, 5 stars.  From the standpoint of ease of use and navigation, Yummly coulda kept huge improvements.  For example, if I want a seasonal appetizer, there is no way to easily find it.  I can search their appetizers, but I can‚Äôt filter their seasonal category down to appetizers.  Instead, I select seasonal and have to look through everything trying to find any appetizer.  With a database as massive as what Yummly has, they have done kind of a poor job with navigation.  Give the ability to do deeper and multilevel filters and it would be perfect.

title: The BEST Cooking App..PERIOD
body: I have tried the AllRecipes Dinner app, Tasty, and Evernote‚Äôs Recipe keeper app. NOTHING compares to this app. I love how in-depth the initial questionnaire is, to automatically weed through recipes you won‚Äôt want. The flip side is that it highlights recipes that are awesome and new. So far I‚Äôve tried 3 different dinner recipes that impressed my house of picky eaters! I am from the Southern US and my style of cooking has been soul food. My husband has more creative tastes in food, and I‚Äôve been wanting to experiment with middle eastern and Mediterranean flavors. This app has a wealth of recipes from all different parts of the globe. I rarely review apps, but I had to give this one 2 thumbs up!!

title: Fabulous app for the busy family!
body: I use Yumly several times/week to plan our meals, organize our shopping etc.  I love that I can filter through all the ingredients I do and don't want to include - we have family members who are vegetarian as well as those who don't eat shellfish.  I also am excited to try the new feature of recognizing ingredients and suggesting recipes.  That could make this a home run!! The only reason I didn't do 4 stars is because the layout is a little less than perfect.  Many recipes, you have to weed through an entire blog post to find the actual directions.  When I have time though, some of these posts offer good insight into the recipes.

title: No Independent Recipes or Online Profile Security/Protection
body: I‚Äôm came here for specific recipes.... not to be redirected to skinnygirl49s or piggypigsfatshacks or anyone else‚Äôs online blog, their useless filler content or their pop-up ads.

title: Would have given it more buuuut
body: I normally don‚Äôt review apps, but Yummly literally did not give me the option not to. No matter how many times I said I didn‚Äôt want to rate it, don‚Äôt show me this message again, it would. Not. Go. Away. Besides that, I like the app rather well. The recipes are normally pretty bland, but I mostly just need new ideas. I‚Äôm a recent vegetarian, and this app has been very helpful with finding new things to cook! There does need to be an easier way to mark meals you‚Äôve liked or made and didn‚Äôt like besides the ‚Äúyumm‚Äôd‚Äù think you can click or adding the recipe to a collection. My favorite thing about the whole app is the grocery list, though. If Yummly didn‚Äôt have that feature, I don‚Äôt think the app would be worth it.

title: Great for Beginners
body: I LOVE THIS APP! I‚Äôm new to cooking and Yummly couldn‚Äôt be anymore perfect. It gives reviews and pictures of others cooking the recipes and even helpful tips from other who have already tried the dish. Each dish list the ingredients AND It will even put it on a shopping list for you so you can mark it off as you grocery shop! The list even put the ingredients in order so you‚Äôre not running all over the grocery store (like myself). Not to mention all the food I‚Äôve made so far has been soooo good! I could go on and on but if you‚Äôre thinking about getting the APP‚Ä¶ do yourself a favor and download it!!

title: I love it almost everything
body: I‚Äôve had this app for years and years and love it so much! There are so many recipes, so many search options and ways to cater what you are looking for! I love how your recipes are saved right there and can be organized how you‚Äôd like. The only complaint is when you search the recipes in your Yummly box it can be hard to find the recipe you are looking for...since I have hundreds of recipes saved I hate going through them individually to find the one...time consuming! I feel like it‚Äôs gotten better recently, but I still find myself scrolling more than I‚Äôd like.

title: Use to love, now it freezes... UPDATED AND UPRATED!
body: I use to love, love LOVE this app, now it drives me crazy! Ever since the last upgrade, it constantly tells me I need to upgrade, reboots the page, then freezes. On rare occasions (like today), I actually still get to use my recipes. Please, please, please fix this so I can continue to tell everyone I know how awesome this app is.

title: Recipes Galore!
body: This is the first place I go too, when I‚Äôm looking for a delicious satisfying recipe. And the best part is the variety and quantity of recipes available. It‚Äôs a veritable pantheon of recipes just waiting

title: Learning to love this app!
body: I‚Äôve been playing around with the shopping list feature while attempting to use my crockpot more often. I haven‚Äôt figured out how to schedule meals on the calendar and then view my calendar - I can schedule something for a certain day, but have to click on the recipe to see when I scheduled it- I just need to remember to write them on my personal calendar I guess. So far I‚Äôve like most of the recipes (General Tso‚Äôs crockpot chicken was especially enjoyed by all!) and have been using this app a lot! I love how the shopping list will organize items by isle at your favorite store - impressive!

title: I love Yummly
body: This app is my go-to when looking for something to try.  It's great when you are looking for a specific recipe, but also if you are just browsing for new ideas. I like how you can sort recipes by categories, and one recipe can belong to many folders. Makes it easier to find recipes after you have +100's of "yums".

title: Huge disappointment
body: One of the first steps to this app is inputting our dietary preferences- I am a vegetarian although I choose to eat seafood (pescatarian). In my dislikes, I  was offered to mention I don‚Äôt like beef or pork (as is it wasn‚Äôt obvious.. unnecessary step)‚Äî so I did.

title: Great for Adults & Budding Julia Childs Alike
body: Most of the recipes that show in my feed are relevant - I asked about oatmeal cookie once and get recommendations regularly.  Although they offer filters for ‚Äúfad‚Äù diets like Paleo and the like, types of vegetarian & vegan and ethnicity, I would like the filter to include something for athletes.  Our daughters - a competitive rower and a competitive gymnast, respectively - have needs specific to their lengthy and demanding practices.  I‚Äôve tried to piece together Paleo and regular recipes, but it is a chore to constantly substitute ingredients.  Yummly has sone a great job otherwise and I‚Äôm having trouble locating an app that would resolve this in family meal recipes.  Regardless, we have found great recipes and enter the modifications into another app for serving nutritional value.

title: A Bit Undercooked
body: I love the variety of recipes, the helpful search suggestions, and the ability to add ingredients to Instacart is just great!

title: Amazing App!
body: I was so happy to come across this app! It has reinvigorated my love of cooking by making the planning and shopping steps so easy! This is the smartest cooking app I have ever used‚Äî it coordinates food preference, allergies, nutrition, cooking time, recipe organization and beautiful visual representations of the food all in one place. For the home cook with a busy family schedule, this has been a life changer!

title: Revolutionized my meal planning
body: I‚Äôve been using Yummly for about a month now, and it has seriously changed my life. I‚Äôm a working mom with two littles and used to feel so overwhelmed my meal planning. Yummly to the rescue! It‚Äôs SO easy to plan and schedule meals! Craving Mexican cuisine? Yummly‚Äôs got you. Starting a keto diet? No problem! There are tons of recipes. I love that the app alerts you when prep needs to start. This helps keep me on track. And the integration with Instacart? Game changer! I seriously had meals planned and groceries delivered to my house within two hours last weekend- all while still spending time with my baby. Thanks for all you do, Yummly!

title: Love Yummly!
body: We have four people in our family. With Yummly we can all share one calendar on our phones and my two teens can plan their one family dinner where we can check up on their groceries or that they‚Äôve planned it out. I‚Äôve loved it for years.

title: Delicious Fun
body: I have never had so much fun finding new dishes to try and enjoy. First of all, Yummly really works at getting you recipes that may be of interest to you based on your previous searches and saves. Then be ready to look all these gorgeous pictures of deliciousness lined up for you to peruse, salivate and eventually try out. If these were not enough, I would simply enter a couple of words in the search box and BAM!... more recipes!  I am new to vegan cooking and the selections here make me wonder why it took me so long to figure out what I've been missing all along. My body is thanking me for the healthier meals. And I thank Yummly.

title: Chock full of advertisements and links
body: Unless I am delusional, Yummly used to be much better.  Today, my wife sent me a link via text and it wouldn‚Äôt even load.  I searched for it and found it manually.  Then, I had to work my way around advertisements and unrelated images like a knight dangerously navigating the evil gauntlet of death.  Eventually, I made it to the recipe and had to read far to much fluff to get to the details.  Why does this have to be so difficult?   Is armor and weapons really necessary?   Can we just get a cooking / recipe app that is easy to use, has great relative pictures without all the linking and scrolling to circumvent the advertisements I‚Äôm  not going to pay one ounce of attention to anyway.  I‚Äôd pay for an app like that. A reasonable monthly fee that is shared across a single family would be appealing.  Much unlike this current app.

title: Yum Yum Yummlyyy
body: This app has inspired some of my best meals with family and great intimate meals with my girlfriend.

title: Amazing. Best app ever.
body: I usually don‚Äôt write reviews but I absolutely had to, this app is great. It gives you thousands of recipes for any situation and give you so many options, it gives you a clean interface and gives you the ingredients and the directions to make whatever you want. It gives you all the calories, preparation time, and the amount of ingredients as soon as you click the  item with the amazing photos with them. It gives you all of the nutritional information right below the title. Absolutely love the app and is the only app I would use for recipes. 11/10. Amazing.

title: Love it!
body: This is the best recipe app I have ever used. It allows a lot of flexibility through search criteria and allows for diet considerations. I also like the shopping list for ingredients which is easy to use along with favorite tracking. Also, with questions, it suggests recipes. U can even find recipes based on ingredients. A few things I would like to see is the ability to customize what information is shown at-a-glance since I track carbs and not calories, user-friendly ‚Äò.‚Äô added when hitting space bar twice 4 comments,and mk the app upside-down compatible. Thanks for this great app!

title: Best App for organizing recipes
body: I love to cook. I labeled folders based on the meal or type of dish (sides, desserts, breakfast, etc). These are the recipes I‚Äôd like to try. Then I have folders with all the same labels with the words ‚Äútried and true‚Äù. For example sides tried and true, desserts tried and true, breakfast tried and true, etc.  I also added a folder ‚Äúgross‚Äù. I put recipes that we didn‚Äôt enjoy, recipes that were not successful or something that we found a different recipe for the same thing we liked better. Even if it wasn‚Äôt gross, I would put it in there to know we don‚Äôt need to make that again.

title: Good
body: I use Yummly often, it‚Äôs a great app that I have been using for years & recommending to friends and family! It has great recipes with a wide variety, probably anything you could want to make! I didn‚Äôt give it five stars because it shows me pictures of a great sounding/looking meal but then, when I try to click for the recipe it won‚Äôt show me because you have to pay for it.... I just want the ingredients and the recipe, not the video... the premium recipes and regular recipes should be kept separate if there is no way to see without buying. I didn‚Äôt even watch the videos when they used to be free, I always just went to the recipe. I wonder what other changes will be made to this app :(

title: Started off great but crashing now
body: I got the app a few months ago and really liked it! It has all kinds of recipes from different types of traditional and fusion recipes. I liked that you could look recipes up based on ingredients or even events.

title: Yummly Review
body: I love the use of Yummly! It allows me to search for any recipe that I want, as well as giving me a lot of different recipes to choose from in different genres of food. It also tells me the calorie count as well as how long it would take to fix the food, which I find really helpful. It is also very user-friendly and easy to navigate. I also appreciate that I get emails of different recipes that I could try

title: It has saved my sanity!
body: I love this app, but I will say more so initially than now. Initially, I was finding many recipes that appealed to me and many more than when I simply do an Internet search for specific recipes. After just one weekend of downloading the app, I had already tried 3 new recipes. That‚Äôs a record for me!  Not by choice, I have many dietary restrictions. This app has made it so much easier for me to find recipes that work for me; many of them are simple yet very tasty! More recently, though, I haven‚Äôt been able to find quite as many recipes that catch my eye. That‚Äôs why 4 stars instead of 5. But I still appreciate this app very much!

title: soSo
body: With a previous update some months ago an upgrade occurred that installed a new version of the yummly app. Because I cannot migrate or export my saved Yummlies to the new app I have to use both the obsolete Yummly app & the new app instead of just  one. & with the last update of the new Yummly app some of the recipes I receive(d) in my email do not link to Yummly app. One or two of these recipes I could not find in the app itself only linking to the website. Adding Yummlies from website does not add them to the app. The directions links also has way too many popups that hinder reading the recipes.

title: Best Recipe App  Ever!!
body: This recipe app is the most useful and well

title: yummily review
body: Yummily has some fabulous recipes, but I no longer will research your site. I have an impossible  time getting a full recipe that can either be placed in my recipe file or sent to my printer for future use. Also I will be in the middle of hand copying the recipe myself, which I honestly hate, and everything freezes. It is a shame that your recipes create so many roadblocks that someone like me just won‚Äôt even use it. I am sorry to write such a negative report, but it is a shame to see a website with so much potential be so useless. I even got the app hoping that would help, but no such luck. Hope something can be done to straighten out the bugs. I keep trying, but to no avail.

title: My thoughts and a suggestion
body: Very good app. I often find myself grazing through the recipes in awe. Everything looks so good. I noticed that in the app, there is an option to ‚Äúbuy groceries‚Äù, and as useful as that is. I believe that, if i were able to take a stockpile list of saved recipes and get a composed grocery list of the items i would need to make each one of those meals (like a weekly meal planner), that would put this app over the top for me. I save many recipes, and its very time consuming to make this list as well as go through each recipe. But overall, very good and very helpful.

title: Makes Dinner Easy!
body: What to make for dinner has been a struggle for as long as I can remember due to a demanding job, small children, and not having Martha Stewart‚Äôs cooking skills. A friend introduced me to this app and I LOVE it! I have it customized to my cooking skills level (intermediate) so I don‚Äôt get recipes that are too complex. I also was able to set ingredient requirements‚Äîwe have a kid with a food allergy and I‚Äôve set my preferences so that I will not receive any recipe suggestions with the problem ingredient...amazing! It‚Äôs easy to search for recipe ideas and to organize the recipes you‚Äôve tried or want to try. Great app!

title: Latest ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù
body: This app has several annoying ‚Äúfeatures‚Äù and a development staff who makes changes without sufficient testing or involvement of the customer‚Äôs desires. Make no mistake, we users are Yummly‚Äôs testing team.

title: I loved this app until recent updates
body: I absolutely love this app! It has amazing recipes, however what‚Äôs really starting to make me frustrated is the recent updates. Whenever I go to the shop section to see the recipes I plan to cook it won‚Äôt actually take me the recipe I want if I were to click on the picture. Instead it will take me to another recipe that has absolutely nothing to do with the recipe I‚Äôm currently trying to view. So now I have to search for the recipe which can be frustrating when I need to cook, also the constant pop up asking me to buy the pro version is very annoying and frustrating.

title: Won‚Äôt save my login information anymore
body: I updated recently and seems like there were two more updates back to back right after but since then every single time I launch the app it makes me log in again. It‚Äôs becoming really annoying. I really like this app and have been using it for quite some time now but I‚Äôm not sure how much more I can take of the persistent login screen. Hopefully this is just some sort of bug or was just overlooked by a developer and that they will find it soon and fix it. üòâ

title: Great app
body: As a professional cook, I love this app.  It lets me find, compare and plan dishes.   Easy to use, and find some recipes I wouldn‚Äôt have known to search for.  One thing I will say, is the ‚ÄúPRO‚Äù version seems a bit high priced at $5/m($60/year?).  Cooking is a catch 22... either you love food, so cooking is part of you, and you learn along the way.... or you don‚Äôt cook good often... so why pay for an app?   I would probably pay $1.99/mo($24/yr) to watch an educational video occasionally.  Just my $.02.   Like I said, free version is already great.   Paying just seems like a wast to many people.  Thanks YUMMLY!

user_name: Awesome game I love it roar
title: So helpful
body: Ever since using this app meal prep and planning has gotten so much easier. Not only can you find amazing recipes (and trust me there‚Äôs alot) but you can add them to a shopping list with one click and have it all organized for you. I was hesitant to use this app as I figured you would have to pay to make it good but that‚Äôs not the case. Paying only unlocks a few special recipes and features so you don‚Äôt it for the app to work. I‚Äôve tried so many recipe apps but I deleted all of them once I got Yummly. Also organizing recipes becomes so easy with this app as well

title: Reignited my love for food
body: Yummly has been one of the best apps I‚Äôve downloaded. It works flawlessly and updates frequently. Whether I have a few ingredients and I‚Äôm trying to figure out what to make, or I‚Äôm looking for something specific, Yummly has been there for me. I used to love cooking a few items. That got old and boring. Now, I enjoy cooking everything, and my family will eat my cooking now too! üôÉ One of the best features has been the grocery list. I plan out a week of meals and go through the list to see what we need to get from the store. It‚Äôs so convenient!

title: Pretty Good App
body: I‚Äôm usually fairly pleased with Yummly. The two reasons I give it 4 stars are: (1) sometimes the variety of recipes is limited and I find better options simply by googling my ingredients; and (2) it is a hassle to habe the ingredients page separate from the directions page. Many of the directions pages do not have the ingredients on them or do not have the measurements for the ingredients on them and you cannot switch back and forth between the ingredients and directions pages within the app without losing your place. Otherwise, the app looks great, is user friendly, and I use it often.

title: Yummly‚Äôs must try
body: Yummly is very interesting. It is very interesting to see the types of recipes and ideas that people have come up with. Love the many many options including vegetarian vegan and recipes for people with allergies. Love that you can add or subtract things from a meal when using the grocery list section of the app. Love it that you can adapt the recipe based upon how many servings you are intending on. Love the pictures many of which make me hungry already. On the downside the ads can be a little disrupting when trying to get the recipe. A warning for blind people not the most blind friendly app can be a little screwy with screen readers.

title: Help! It Stopped!!
body: I love Yummly. It's my go to app for all things food. But recently, it's stopped working. Like, nothing opens at all. I click my app icon and all I see are brownies in the background, a gray circle with "you" in it, and six dots at the top that appear to represent pages.  I can't scroll up or down. I can't scroll side to side. I tried to uninstall and reinstall a few times and always the same thing.

title: Happy Wife
body: After cooking the same dishes for the past 23 years I had become bored and many nights resorted to fast food or takeout, in the 10 days since I downloaded this I have tried 4 new recipes and repeated two, my family is thrilled. The recipes are easy to organize, easy to follow, I can easily make simple adaptations if needed and I am having fun cooking again. I love the feature to add the ingredients to a shopping list, I feel happy to be back in my kitchen and having everyone asking "what's that smell?" & "can I have that too" thank you for this app. Happy Mom & Wife.

title: The one app everybody needs
body: This app has helped me so much because I meal prep and like having a variety of options with only a few ingredients tailored to our tastes. Yummly has done all that for me in just a few min setting up my profile. What took me 10 min of my time would have taken me hours in google searches and I get emails with new ideas. Thank you so much for taking the stress out of finding great recipes so I can get back to the fun of cooking! And I love being able to give back by leaving reviews and photos so others can feel confident trying a new recipe.

title: Fantastic!
body: This is the greatest recipe and cooking app I have found yet! I have found so many recipes easily categorized. I can use the search to find a recipe and once I found it if I choose I can push a button and all of the ingredients will be added to my shopping list. There‚Äôs even a function that will put a recipe that I‚Äôm planning to make on my calendar and send me alerts as to when to begin prepping it, when to cook it and when to check on it. This app is so personable and easy to use and I recommend it highly to anyone- beginner or expert-who likes to cook.

title: So many recipes, so little time
body: Have been looking for an app to help plan our family meals for a while, and I finally found it! So many recipes with easy instructions and great way to add to grocery list for when we go to the store. The only two features I would like to see is the ability to edit and print the recipes once we save straight from the appt but this is not a huge deal; and maybe adding sales adds for major stores so we can pick recipes based on what's on sale. Anyway, love it and have been using it weekly- such a huge help.

title: Resourceful!
body: Not only does this app give you recipes and give you suggestions based on what you have already liked, it has the recipes organized from dinner to drinks. It allows you to add the ingredients needed from the recipe of your choice, to a grocery list which is convenient and you can easily check off. You rate the recipe and write your own review and even follow people if you like their recipes. This app is well-organized and convenient, but mostly resourceful since it also suggests some kitchen instruments to help you with the recipe. I recommend 100%!

title: Easy to use
body: Love this app. I have used it a lot in the past 2 years and my husband loves that my meals have become more varied. Definitely makes it easier to try new things! The shopping list has always been my favorite feature, but I‚Äôm not a fan of how the new shopping list looks and works since the most recent app update. Doesn‚Äôt seem quite as visually ‚Äúeasy‚Äù and I‚Äôve had items or whole recipe ingredient lists disappear from my shopping list and I can‚Äôt figure out how to get them back without adding the whole recipe back in which is a pain when you are in the middle of a shopping trip.

title: Eharmony for cooking
body: Love this app. It allows you to customize your taste profile with foods you like and want to avoid, etc. When I search for recipes, I typically find a ton I would like to try. It is like EHarmony for cooking. Just not enough time to try all the recipes! You can also customize folders to save the recipes to.

title: Love my new YUM App‚ù§Ô∏èüòãüëç
body: This foodie app is just the berries for my heart friendly meal plans. I love the fact that it comes up with recipes according to my food choices. Build your own grocery list too. There are so many great recipe apps at my finger tips but this is the only one so far that I can find recipes that are little-no fat, low-no sodium, a sugar alternative, make my ‚Äúheart happy‚Äù recipes. There‚Äôs a whole world out there of heart friendly meals & I believe I‚Äôve finally found the jackpot of food choices for my meal plans. I definitely would recommend this YUM App. I give it ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è & a üëç!

title: Not So good
body: Difficult to work with. Search feature needs

title: Great App!
body: My wife and I are so pleased with this app. Before we were just eating the same old stuff every week and it was getting old but now that we use Yummly I feel like we can eat a wide variety of foods every week and it never gets old. We like how you can see how many ingredients are in each recipe so you can choose ones that don‚Äôt have a lot of ingredients. We yum the recipes we like and it saves them to our favorites and we make our grocery lists based on the ingredients. It makes meal planning easy and more proficient. We absolutely love it!

title: Amazing App and Amazing Team
body: I love to cook new things and can never think of a menu for the week. This app lets me pick from so many recipients while filtering out allergies, dietary restrictions, and even customized personal taste! Once you find the recipe you can add it to your calendar and if you don‚Äôt have the ingredients add them to your shopping cart.

title: Very considerate
body: They ask you questions about what you want first then bring you to the homepage and they find stuff related to what you liked on the homepage like instagram or Pinterest. Then when you search up something like cake they ask you if you want an ingredient left out or time and dietary preferences to limit it to what you might like. Now it isn‚Äôt all perfect ‚Äòcause no app is but I definitely love this app and how organized. They also let you change your dietary preference if you need to. Thank you so much Yummly for this free app to help me out.

title: Great app, no longer freezes - bur can‚Äôt leave reviews
body: Yummly used to freeze literally every thirty seconds ‚Äî but that glitch has been fixed. Now there‚Äôs another: I can‚Äôt leave reviews. I always get a ‚Äúcould not connect to server‚Äù message.

title: A Total Must Have!
body: I‚Äôve used Yummly for several years and have often recommended it to friends and family! I love the ease of adding ingredients to my shopping list and then having those items listed by department makes grocery shopping a breeze. If I find or am given a recipe from another source like Pinterest I search for it on Yummly and usually find it, so I can keep all of my recipes in one place. The Home page recommendations are great, the more you Yum, the better the suggestions are to fit your personal tastes and cooking style. Love this app!

title: A Modern Recipe Book
body: Yummly is a godsend for people learning to cook. As someone who doesn‚Äôt know much about flavours, it‚Äôs wonderful to have recipes from around the world with detailed instructions at the tip of your fingertips. The explore feature is a great way to get ideas of things you didn‚Äôt even know existed, and in my experience they‚Äôve generally turned out quite well.

title: Great thermometer until....
body: Great thermometer until the update came out. Now it will not connect to my iPhone 11. So I checked my iOS and that too was updated. So I called the 800 number and after being on hold for 5 minutes they told me that they couldn‚Äôt help me over the phone and that I had to email tech support. I asked them aren‚Äôt you tech support and they said yes but for my situation I have to email them. So I emailed them and after waiting a day for a response they had me troubleshoot the same procedure that‚Äôs on the app and to email them back if that didn‚Äôt work. So guess what IT DIDNT WORK!! So I emailed them back to tell them that it didn‚Äôt work and still to this day I have not got a response back. Very disappointed.

title: Way more than what I expected
body: This app was way more than what I expected. As a somewhat novice cook, I loved how I was able to create an order directly through Instacart. I love love that the recipes can be changed for number of servings. The best part was actually being able to schedule the meal on my calendar to know when to start to get to the best time to serve the dinner. A+

title: THE PICTURES ALONE......
body: would be enough to make you LOVE this app, but every other aspect is just as wonderful! I am an avid Pinterest user - for everything including recipes, but after having found Yummly, I rarely get any recipes off of Pinterest! Believe this or not, my HUSBAND even loves Yummly, looks at it almost daily and I do ALL of the cooking - of course now I have MANY, MANY suggestions üòú‚ÄºÔ∏èI ‚ÄúTRY‚Äù and introduce my husband to 2-3 apps per month, none of which he is at all interested in, and only maybe uses 2-3 of those apps PER YEAR! So you see....that makes YUMMLY very special!

title: Total game changer
body: I love this app. You can choose what kinds of food/ingredients you like and which you don‚Äôt, so it doesn‚Äôt recommend a recipe with an allergen or something you just don‚Äôt like (like mayo...yuck!). My favorite part though is that you can add all ingredients to a shopping list, remove the things you don‚Äôt need to buy, and send the list to Walmart/target/other partner stores and order the groceries in one click! I can plan my whole week and grocery shop from my phone or computer. It really makes me excited to plan my week!

title: Incredible recipe/cooking app for all experience levels!
body: I discovered Yummly a few years ago and it's been the most amazing addition to my love for cooking and great food. It's been so wonderful finding these amazing, delicious meals that have become an instant favorite in my house. I use this app at least once a week to find new recipes and continue broadening out my cooking experience ! It's great how it Aggregates all these different recipes from different sites and blogs and puts them all in one app that's really easy to use and really well organized. Thank you Yummly !

title: Love this site!
body: Not only do they provide very clear recipes and directions, I can search by what type of dish I want to make like most sites, however, I can put in ‚Äòdesserts that go with tacos ‚Äò and it will show me things that go with tacos then provides you with a shopping list. You can pick what ingredients you need and it makes you a shopping list and will even tell you where you can find it cheapest. In addition, you tell them when your meal needs to be done and it‚Äôll send you an alarm to get started.

title: Thank You!!
body: I use this app to find vegan recipes to actually cook for myself rather than eating garbage food all of the time, I love that it allows me to filter out recipes that aren't vegan! I use the shopping list when I'm at the grocery store and mark it as bought when I add it to my cart so that I don't have to stop and scroll :') I was, however, wondering if it might at all be possible to add a reminder to throw out fresh produce when it's likely about gone bad! (I suppose I could do this myself as well but again, new to the cooking thing)

title: Yummly recipes
body: Yummly has a variety of recipes for each recipe title. For example, there are several recipes for something as simple as a bacon-wrapped filet mignon. I reviewed all of them to see if I could learn from them and pick up any hints. I followed one of them and the filets came out perfectly.

title: Spinning wheels after update
