body: Update: I received a timely and kind response and was able to fix the problem by deleting and reloading the app as recommended. So happy that I‚Äôm able to access the app as designed. Thank you so much!!

title: Helpful App
body: Yummly is a very helpful app when you‚Äôre looking for recipes based on what you already have in your fridge and pantry. Most recipes have tips on cooking variations and substitutions and comments from others that have made the recipe before and photos. I‚Äôm able to save the recipes in categories to remake later. I don‚Äôt like all the pop-up ads that block the recipe and occasionally recipes are no longer available. Then there‚Äôs a fee for guided (video) recipes if you want to go Pro Yummly. Other than these 2 annoying issues I really like this app and have used it for years.

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS APP
body: I used to use the paid app, emeals, however once I found the Yummly app, I cancelled my other membership.

title: Accommodating to food allergies
body: I have several severe food allergies (milk, eggs, all nuts and shellfish) that make finding recipes extremely difficult. Yumly allowed me to put in my food allergies to find things I can eat. Before this app I was stuck with vegan cooking apps that had ingredients I had never heard of plus really complicated recipes, yumly has instructions that are easy to follow plus ingredients that you probably already have. I usually never write reviews but if you have food allergies this will change your diet for the better!

title: Loves to cook
body: Cooking has been my second favorite hobby (after eating) for almost 47 years. A coworker turned me on to Yummly several years ago, and it quickly became one of my most used applications. Sometimes, I use this for ideas, sometimes I need recipes, sometimes I‚Äôm just reading for entertainment. The ability to just look up recipes ranging from simple to complex is great. The ability to filter on ingredients is even better. I‚Äôve been using this at least 8 years and plan on using it for many more years.

title: So close to the perfect food app!
body: I am very impressed with so many features on this app. I love being able to choose my dietary plan, and watch as the app only filters out those recipes  I‚Äôm allowed to have, then add it to a meal calendar, which syncs to all my devices, and then how it puts together a shopping list is genius. My only complaint is that I would love to be able to import the info into other apps (for weight tracking), or if there were a premium feature that allowed me to set health goals, and import the food data (macros and such) into my daily limit.

title: Was great before...
body: Used to love this, but it‚Äôs becoming a pain to use and harder to find recipes. I find myself going to Pinterest because this just doesn‚Äôt do it for me. If i don‚Äôt search something exactly like it wants me to or mess with filters a million time, it usually ends saying there are ‚Äòno results‚Äô. I feel that I need to come here knowing exactly what I want to make, rather than finding suggestions based on ingredients, because if I‚Äôm not specific I get something very, very basic. Also finding recipes using the ingredients on hand feature would be great if it didn‚Äôt search recipes that ONLY have those ingredients and included recipes that might be missing one or two on the list...

title: Wow
body: This app is truly amazing. I never rate anything, ever, but I had to with this one. Grocery shopping, buying the correct ingredients, making shopping lists, even figuring out what you want to make in the first place, this app does ALL of it. Everything I just mentioned gives me extreme anxiety, so much so that I rarely grocery shop anymore. This app has simplified the process and makes t easier to eat well too! I have already recommended this to friends because of how much i dig it. And it‚Äôs free! Do yourself a favor and get this app ASAP!

title: Best and worst- videos have no cc nor ingredients
body: This is the most amazing app w an incredible filter system for likes, allergies, dinner bfast drinks desserts, add foods you dislike, scroll, watch videos, and more I havent even learned yet. However!!  The videos dont have cc so I have no idea what theyre adding bc hey dont even post a line or show recipe ingredients!!  Reallllllllllllly needs to be amended for those who are not able to hear. If you fixed that then 5üå†. But for this day and age you need closed caption, or words showing what is happening, what ingredients are added, what to do, how long to wait, rest, cook, knead, etc.

title: Great app for finding a recipe for anything!
body: I have really enjoyed using this app! I will just get a thought in my head of something I might want to try to make and all I have to do is type in what it is and hundreds of recipes will pop up. I find that it is convenient that it shows you right up front how many ingredients are in the recipe so I can know which ones are a little bit easier to make. I also appreciate that they post pictures of each dish so I have an idea of what it looks like.

title: Love it, use it all the time
body: I can filter for vegetarian which I love. Can easily save recipes in pre-made categories or my own. I've found tons of great recipes on here and lots left still to try. I want to add some of my ownüíú The only annoying thing is when going back out of a recipe collection to the ‚Äúmy Yums‚Äù it automatically goes back to the beginning and it can take awhile to scroll back to where you left off. I recommend immediately categorizing your recipes into a collection for this reason.

title: Awesome recipe app!
body: Only had it a few days but this is my FAVORITE recipe app! Some recipes are only available with a paid upgrade ( which I plan to get soon) but there are tons of great recipes available on this free version. I love that you can choose special diets as I am focusing on keto or low carb now. You can also search recipes based on ingredients you have on hand by simply snapping a pic of your ingredients! You can save recipes you like in categories, such as ‚Äúbreakfast‚Äù or ‚Äúdrinks‚Äù, and create your own custom categories! Trust me, you need this app!

title: Perfect for my 1/2 & 1/2 family üòÇ
body: I have been using the app for more than two years now. Just a few months ago my son change his diet to vegetarian for health reasons. I love that I can organize my recipes on there own folder.

title: It‚Äôs the best...Honest!
body: Okay, here‚Äôs there deal, I‚Äôm a great cook, I have a recipe for just about everything I‚Äôve ever eaten, and I‚Äôm also gluten free. If this app had bad recipes, I‚Äôd delete it. It doesn‚Äôt. (At least not that I‚Äôve found) It‚Äôs basically Google for recipes. You simply look for a recipe and it has thousands complied from different websites in one app. No adds, No required subscriptions, just straight up good food. Whatever level you are, whatever diet you follow, and whatever food you enjoy, try this app. You won‚Äôt regret it!

title: I use it often but could use some upgrades
body: I switched over from Epicurious over a year ago because their app was always down.  Yummly is good, doesn‚Äôt have as many good recipes as Epicurious, I had over one thousand saved but the app always works.  Some suggestions would be instead of just ‚Äúyumm‚Äù a recipe to be able to put it right in your recipe box category like dinner or breakfast would be best for organization.  Also changing the home page daily of suggested recipes and or emailing recipes highlighting a theme or topic will draw ppl back to the app to save recipes.

title: Yum
body: I absolutely love this app. I appreciate that you can select dietary requirements as well as request not to been shown any recipes that contain certain ingredients. I enjoy the grocery list option, I wish it could transfer over to the grocery order online and I have tried to schedule meals but there always seems to be an error. Also I wish when you saved a recipe it would categorize it for you or at least ask what folder you would like it in. Other than that great app

title: Best
body: Best app I can find. I‚Äôm detail oriented and schedule obsessive. I tell my friends, family, and their friends to download this app. The filters on here make my life better (allergies, diet trends, preferences, cuisines, etc, etc). The calendar abilities make my world better. This app takes everything overwhelming about self-care through meals and does it for me. The minute groceries start delivering to ‚Äúmy area‚Äù half of my entire enterprise as an adult human will be complete. This app encourages me to reach for better, lends hope that I can become better.

title: Super helpful app
body: I love this app, it‚Äôs a great way to get recipes. I like that you can search by ingredients and specify any dietary restrictions or preferences. I also find the shopping list feature very useful for recipes with a lot of ingredients.

title: Great!
body: There are many times, especially lately, but I found myself freaking out because I did not have any ideas! I‚Äôm able to use this app and go online and check out some of the different recipes which have been great. I just used a Tuscan shrimp recipe that my family really liked. There are a ton of recipes, it‚Äôs easy to use and I‚Äôm able to then print them out and put them in my recipe book for later! Even having the list of ingredients and directions and then being able to also print out the recipe is very helpful. Thanks!

title: Love you Yummly
body: My Yummly app is my go-to!  We have a cabin we go to every weekend and having recipes handy at both homes is almost impossible but Yummly makes it easy!  I always have my phone with me.  Having a list of ingredients at my fingertips is a huge plus at the grocery store. And I have found tons of recipes that are fabulous- and I‚Äôm picky!  Just now I googled recipes using Mango Patron and found a sight with 10 to choose from. Went to click and what do you know - Yummly site!  Now you know why I live Yummly!  You will too!

title: Easy to use but difficult selection process
body: Easy to use and good recipients. My only negative is that there are too many recipes that show up in the search results and often times some are similar, so it ends up being g more of a pain to select a recipe because I have to select each one, which takes me to another site.

title: Life saver
body: I love to cook and now during the pandemic this app saved my sanity. My family and I are lucky for not having to eat the same thing every day. Lots of amazing dishes, easy to follow recipes, easy to navigate and an option to save your favorites, for a repeat meal. I love the fact that I‚Äôm able to see multiple recipes for the same thing and take ingredients from each to create my own version of deliciousness.

title: Wide variety of recipes
body: There are a ton of recipes in this app and we have really enjoyed the majority that we have tried (been using this app for over 5 years).

title: Much better than Allrecipes
body: This app is great. It has vivid precise photos of each recipe. The recipes can be shown by ingredient. I like the shopping list feature however the cart function is cumbersome. It picks the item for your cart but doesn‚Äôt provide many options when you try to change to a brand you like or a lower priced brand. I was spending $300 for groceries when I would never choose those high priced options. Otherwise it‚Äôs pretty good. Yummly app has a lot of glitches that make you have to restart the app frequently very frustrating

title: Best until Update
body: Update: This app is once again the best recipe app. I use it several times a week. This is my go to on Sundays especially when my daughter and I decide what to make. I love I can add the recipes to my meal planner calendar and shopping list app. I‚Äôm really happy with the update and it it works with my iPadOS 13, at first I had problems but not anymore. I‚Äôve upped my stars to 5 stars. Thanks for that !

title: Great until now
body: Previously I would have rated Yummly 5 stars- it‚Äôs free and has countless fantastic recipes in a really easy to use app. Unfortunately, with this new update it lost the feature for me to schedule meals and add them to my calendar app; being replaced by the new ‚Äúmeal plan‚Äù option that must be paid for and is not even available in my region. I don‚Äôt understand why they‚Äôve gone and made that a paid charge, I just want to be able to schedule my meals again. It‚Äôs actually become less convenient now than it was when I first got the app.

title: yum on Yummly!!!
body: I am loving Yummly. I have a teenage son who is very into weightlifting and physical fitness. Fitness is important to me as well. This app has made it very easy for me to find recipes that are different than the usual stuff and I can cater to whatever eating pattern my kid decides he wants to try. To be honest, I am the same way though, I get on kicks where I want to eat a certain way for awhile and Yummly helps tremendously. I LOVE the shopping list feature. I know I am enjoying an app when I start telling all my fitness friends about it!

title: Really good, sometimes outdated
body: This app is really useful for finding a recipe if you want to use a certain technique, use a certain ingredient, have a craving for something specific, or are just looking for cooking inspiration. The only downside is that it uses third party websites and blogs so if the third party deletes the recipe or blog post you can‚Äôt see the instructions on the app. Unfortunately while it doesn‚Äôt happen on every single recipe that I find enticing it has happened multiple times and doesn‚Äôt seem to be something that the app developers have noticed.

title: My Fav go to
body: I love picking recipes and planning my weekly meals. I also love the things that I dislike and are allergic too removed from things that I see. I‚Äô Gladys give 5 stars, but would love to see a few things added.

title: This app is great but..
body: I love using this app. It‚Äôs where I find my recipes to cook dinner! I just updated the app today and it seems like it hasn‚Äôt fixed anything. The last few weeks I‚Äôll be looking at a recipe I love and then the app will freeze and then close itself. So it‚Äôs so frustrating liking something and then the app closes and can‚Äôt find it again.. It‚Äôs also really glitchy and slow? When scrolling it lags. It wasn‚Äôt like this when I first downloaded it about 8-9 months ago. So yeah love the app tremendously but something needs to be fixed

title: Measures up...
body: About a year ago I wanted to find an app that consolidated my eating needs & wants.  Still in my infancy of practicing cooking I neglected the site and just recently re‚Äùdiscovered‚Äù what a phenomenal site/app Yummly is.  The diverse tools: selecting diet type, eliminating unwanted foods/spices, curating a grocery list direct from the recipes selected, building a recipe book and NOW the  grocery list comparison tool for shopping at local grocers is a win for me.  MIND.  BLOWN!

title: Glitchy
body: I‚Äôve used and loved this app for years, but the last couple months have been frustrating. When searching through my Yummed recipes it will show a few lines of recipes but when you scroll to see more recipes, the page will go blank. Forcing me to go back and try again, hoping that I‚Äôm fast enough to see more recipes before it glitches again. Also‚Ä¶ When I want to pull up the shopping list it always starts off Plan, which is a Pro service and seems to be trying to get you to pay for Pro. Just let me use the shopping list. If I want to pay fro pro I would‚Äôve, but pro is useless to me. Besides all that‚Ä¶ love the app! Deuces!

title: This app taught me to cook!
body: During the 2020 Covid quarantines, I desperately sought a new pastime.  I‚Äôve never been much of a cook in the past, but I decided to try to improve my skills.  This app gave me seemingly endless recipes, from all over the world.  I have had a blast trying new things, and have become quite bold in my culinary adventures!  Most are successes, a few have been failures, of course, but there are limitless cooking opportunities available on Yummly that have really changed how I think about food.  It‚Äôs my favorite app!

title: Great App
body: I‚Äôve been using Yummly for years , even before they even had an app. ( It‚Äôs been that long) Anyhow, so many recipes to chose from. T love how you can save recipes into diff categories. The only thing I‚Äôve noticed lately is when in search within my recipes rather than scroll through every single one nothing comes up when I know that recipe exists or something that is NOT in my saved recipes randomly comes up. It‚Äôs quite annoying. Pls fix bc it was fine before

title: Longtime user
body: I‚Äôve found and stored so many great recipes on Yummly. I love the way I can add ingredients easily to a shopping list and can filter my search results. I respect that it respects the original blog poster but sometimes it‚Äôs a bit of an effort to get to the actual recipe. Also wish you could rearrange the order and automatic sorting of the shopping list (for instance I enter my grocery store at the produce section so it‚Äôd be great if I could put items on my list in the order I know I‚Äôm going to encounter them in my store).

title: Great recipes, annoying pop-ups
body: This is an awesome discovery tool for new recipes and even different takes on things I make all the time. You can find everything from appetizers to deserts and at least three variations of each dish from other end users or professional chefs. The variety is awesome and the UI is easy to use, which makes the experience even better. The one thing that drives me crazy are the CONSTANT pop-ups to rate the app and enable notifications. I‚Äôve said I don‚Äôt want push notifications on once, and that should be the end of the conversation. Stop asking me every time I open the app.

title: Great!
body: I love Yummly. I‚Äôve been using it for a few years and I have discovered so many new recipes. The best part is the scheduling so you know when to start prepping.

title: Switched from recipe keeper
body: Can‚Äôt believe I just now found this app! Such a clean look and feel. You can add meals right into your calendar and it sends a reminder to start prepping so dinner will be done at the time you choose. Love the ability to add to the shopping list right from the recipe. Another great feature is being able to print/share your shopping list.

title: Awesome
body: I can truly say that I have liked every recipe I have made so far.  I love the ability to tailor the selections to my preferences ( healthy eating) and this app can filter out common food allergens.  I like the shopping list feature, you can create a list of foods needed for your recipes but can also add other items, not needed for your recipes, to the list.  The shopping list also classifies your items by type; dairy, meats, etc. to make it easier to shop.  I highly recommend this app.

title: Best app I‚Äôve ever downloaded ever
body: I usually don‚Äôt write reviews but I have to take the time to write this review this is the best app ever downloaded When I transition to become pescatarian I had a very hard time with figuring out recipes to cook if it were not because of this app I would have never been successful at it I sincerely appreciate whoever took the time to create this magnificent o app!!! I have shared it with so many of my friends and they feel the same way thank you so much again for changing my life!!!

title: Fantastic for any recipe you need!!
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for years and it keep getting better and better with every upgrade. I love the selection of cuisines, dietary choices, directional videos, etc. I love that I can choose how many servings I‚Äôm making and how the ingredients adjust to those servings.i love that it shows nutritional values and reviews.  This recipe app has always been by favorite. It never gets old and even though I check out other recipe sites, you can‚Äôt beat this one. Love it!

title: Good ideas
body: I‚Äôm not a good cook, I don‚Äôt know the first thing about cooking but a friend recommended this app so I downloaded and looked up some dishes I liked and things I wanted to try for dinner and its awesome! Because of covid I have been home while my girlfriend is at work so every day I look up a new recipe and go down to the grocery store for the ingredients I need and cook it for her when she gets home and they have turned out so good! I am amazed that I can make those things by following the directions on the app.

title: Love this app, use it daily !!
body: I love the app Yummly, I found it about 5years ago, it is my go to now. I don't even pull out any cookbooks anymore. All I do is type in a specific ingredient and or produce that I have, and search for whatever receipts pop up and our family is in the mood for that night. It's so easy !! They have a variety of very healthy versions and other traditional and classic versions of of many variations of recipes. Everything is right where I need it. Great App and always recommend !!

title: Use it weekly- actually it has replaced most of my cookbooks
body: And a way to store ideas you see for later- my fav part, and always have new ideas.

title: Why change it?
body: I have been using this app for years and absolutely love it until recently.  When I search for something there are no pictures!  I‚Äôm a visual cooker and this change is terrible for me.  I see pictures if I go to my saved recipes and if I brows through the suggestions but when I search for something specific there aren‚Äôt any and it asks me a million questions before giving me a suggestion. I loved this app for its ease of use and quick suggestions not happening anymore. Very frustrating and this has caused me to not use it as frequently.  Disappointed.

title: Why I love Yummly
body: I love Yummly!  I can always find a great recipe - every one of them have been delicious. I love that Yummly will create my shopping list, it will increase the quantum of servings and I can save the recipe and shopping list to my phone for easy access while grocery shopping!!!!

title: Awesome! One thing to add...
body: I love how this app, unlike other recipe apps, asks you for allergies, diets, and all about what you eat instead of just giving you random recipes. Everything looks so good and yummy. The one thing I would like for it to have is a choice in the beginning for pollotarians. There is a question that asks what are you? Vegan, Vegetarian, Ovo Vegetarian, Keto, and such. I‚Äôm a pollotarian, which means I don‚Äôt eat red meat, but can eat everything else like dairy, eggs, chicken, fish, etc. I just can‚Äôt eat pork, beef, and other red meats. I home the creator of this app adds this feature. Thank you!

title: Almost Useless...
body: Recently, I was getting more interested in making food for my family (I‚Äôm 13), and I came across Yummly. I was immediately greeted by a pleasant design and a smooth interface. However, when I found a recipe I wanted to read, I got an ‚ÄúAccess Restricted‚Äù page instead. My mother restricted all websites because she doesn‚Äôt want me to browse the internet, and Yummly only uses the website that the recipes come from, thus, Yummly was useless. I‚Äôd easily make this a 5 star review if the developers can find a way to import the recipes to the app, rather than relying on the source website. I don‚Äôt mind too much, so I won‚Äôt bother you any longer, and have a great day.

title: Easy!
body: Love it! I was recently diagnosed with celiac disease, and needed to replace most of my recipes with gluten free options. My sister recommended Yummly, and I‚Äôm so glad I listened to her advice! I was able to indicate my preferences for gluten free, and the app has never shown me a recipe that isn‚Äôt able to become compliant. SO REFRESHING!

title: Great and easy recipes
body: I‚Äôve been using Yummly for a few years.  I love how I can search just recipes with chicken or with ground meet or whatever I‚Äôm craving.  I can search for healthy options and I can search for healthy and easy.  It‚Äôs so simple to use.  Some nights I don‚Äôt feel like cooking so I search for crockpot recipes.  Just about everything I‚Äôve tried has been fantastic from soups to appetizers, dinners to desserts.  I recommend this app to family and friends all the time.  Thank you Yummly!

title: Need help
body: My Yummly app was working fine and the update popped up. I had time so I updated the app with latest version and now my Yummly won‚Äôt even load. I click the app on my iPhone 7plus and I get to see a lemon and a lime on a wood board then it goes back to my main screen on my phone ‚òπÔ∏è I am worried if I delete the app I will lose so many awesome recipes that has taken yrs to save. I am at a loss, I really don‚Äôt know what to do üßê I love Yummly and I wish I would have never went to the latest version!!!!

title: Redundant and pointless
body: Why is it that I need to get the app to read the recipes and directions when I am on the web browser, but when I use the app some of the directions for some dishes just re-direct me back to the web browser. Its a terrible experience because then I get autoplay videos and ads that cant be blocked. This slows down the experience and makes it harder to follow on that crappy browser we are put through. Terrible user experience whenever I need to be redirected to the web. Either let us use the web version without having to use the app, or have ALL the directions and recipes accessible natively in the app.

title: Love this app
body: I use this app regularly and find it helpful to feed multiple children with varied eating (one gluten free, one vegetarian, one 13 year old foodie).  I quickly find recipes to meet the needs of all and based on what I have in my pantry.  Has been great during Covid-19 with college students at home and cooking for more people.  I usually add additional spices and vegetables to recipes to suit our tastes and always start out my search with words ‚Äòeasy or quick‚Äô, knowing I can add to it if I want!

title: My go-to cooking app
body: Love, love, love!  I use this frequently!  I usually have an idea of what I want to do, but will check to see if the ingredients I have on hand will work, based on recipes I find on Yummly.  (I'm tweaking things and not always using the recipes as they are written.). I don't require strict guidelines for searching and organizing what I find, so I've been really pleased (but please note, that I have been able to organize recipes that I have wanted to reference again, very easily on the app)!

title: System is slower - update
body: I was using Yummly regularly and had all my favs in my Yum list... with the upgrade... I lost them all. Thanks for that!

title: its an amazing app BUT‚Ä¶
body: I love Yummly, and would‚Äôve easily rated it 5 stars, but this latest update is just terrible. The UI changes are great, but so much now is locked behind a subscription. Many people use the app for free as it‚Äôs the best free recipes app there is. But putting things behind paywalls can drastically reduce the number of people who use this app. Nutrition information should not be locked behind a subscription. i‚Äôm perfectly fine and agreeable with having certain recipes (i.e. pro recipes) behind a subscription, but nutrition information is crossing a line.

title: My Go To!!
body: Yummly is one of my favorite apps and I‚Äôve been using it for several years. I love it!!! I‚Äôve recommended it to many and actually ditched the last of cookbooks when I started using this. I love the variety of recipes available but then there are other features like the shopping list, and changing the portion size. The most fabulous feature is putting in some ingredients you have (not knowing what to do with them) and it generates recipes with those ingredients.

title: Good variety
body: The app has a lot of recipes so far (I‚Äôve only been using it about 2 weeks). Some are great, some are so-so, but that‚Äôs to be expected with crowdsourced recipes.

title: Good recipes
body: It‚Äôs a good app what I like about it, is that it is very detailed on the recipes and reasonable at times. The measure are for the most part accurate just recommend to read the recipe before actually attempting it   I have not had anything to complain so far and it even has a vegetarian option so it won‚Äôt give you recipes with meat, as well as vegan dishes. Just keep in mind while reading the recipes it will say the tools you need just make sure you have them.

title: Marci M.
body: I use this app every single week without fail! I can‚Äôt think of one recipe my family hasn‚Äôt loved. This app is helpful in so many ways whether it‚Äôs to look up a specific recipe or to get a long list of ideas just by giving the ingredients I have on hand. If I had to pick one thing that I would change it would be to remove the long drawn out stories you have to read just to get to the ingredients or directions on some of the recipes.

title: Love this app!
body: What I love: every recipe has a picture!!; app combs the internet for recipes so you have tons of variations of a dish to choose from; you can save your favorite recipes and organize them in folders if you want; you can see reviews from others who‚Äôve made the recipe and often get great tips in those reviews; easy search feature so I can always find what I‚Äôm looking for; my fav all time find: raw cookie dough for pregnancy! I still make it even though my youngest is 9!!

title: Amazing cooking app
body: This app is crazy good. The free version is probably the best free app of any kind I‚Äôve ever seen. Haven‚Äôt signed up for the subscription but most likely I will. The app is basically an aggregator of recipes you could google search for but having everything categorized and at your finger tips is awesome, plus of course you can save favorite recipes by category. The photos are great and the interface is super slick and easy to navigate. Check it out if you love to cook. Kudos to the developers!

title: Not fed enough variety, cumbersome navigation
body: Yummly is my go-to for recipes. Love the visual representation and the scroll down main screen. I would like to see more variety in my suggested recipes, though. I picked a lot of different food interests during set up, but I feel like Yummly bombards me with multiple recipes of a very similar (or same) kind, and focuses on what I‚Äôve ‚Äúyummed‚Äù recently. There could definitely be more variety presented. Also, I find it somewhat cumbersome to navigate through the menu items - doesn‚Äôt feel intuitive enough. Don‚Äôt lose heart, though, you‚Äôve got a good thing goingüòä

title: Great Recipe App
body: The only reason this app isn‚Äôt 5 stars is because the you have to exit the app to get directions for the recipes.. I‚Äôve noticed some recipes have begun to have the directions directly within the app, which is amazing. It gets frustrating having to exit the app every time I make something.. The app‚Äôs benefits are you can save recipes to make again, it makes recommendations based on what you‚Äôve made in the past and you can specialize what you‚Äôre looking for (chicken entree, broccoli side, appetizers, etc.) all in one app.

title: Great recipes, but too many pop-up ads :(
body: We love the recipes we‚Äôve found on Yummly!  However it‚Äôs often difficult to read the directions because there are so many pop-up ads.  When working on a phone, the ads take up almost the entire screen and are difficult to remove; the close buttons are so small, you inadvertently end up opening the advertisement, usually while in the middle of cooking!  So it can be frustrating.  I would have given 5 stars but for all the ads.

title: Great recipes
body: I love using Yummly when I need a good recipe to make for my family. I gave it 5 stars because, there has not been a time when I was unable to find a recipe that I was looking to make. I love the fact that there are the same recipes by so many different people, that make their recipe a little different from others. Yummly is my go to recipe site. My family loves when I make a variety of different things for them to try, and I have Yummly to thank for that.

title: Better than a cookbook
body: I love the recipes. There‚Äôs always a variety of ways to prepare a dish whether you want it to be quick and easy or want to spend time with a more detailed version. Often times I just pick a category or a major ingredient and start thumbing through recipes. I‚Äôm never disappointed and always find something to prepare. I recommend Yummly a lot. When I find a great recipe I often will forward it to one of my cooking friends as well.

title: One of my favorite apps of all time
body: Yummly connects me with so many recipes from so many different sources. One of the things I now look forward to during the week is getting Yummly emails with recommendations. As a college student, I‚Äôm always on the go, however I‚Äôve found so much comfort and happiness in setting aside time for myself and preparing a lovely meal whether that be quick and easy 5 minute tacos or a creamy risotto. And Yummly make it SO easy....it‚Äôs almost too good to be true. Almost üòÅ

title: My favorite cooking app
body: I have several cooking apps, but I find myself using this one most often.  I like having a place to save recipes that I find and want to try.  It is so easy to save recipes from other websites and organize them into folders.  Almost all recipes appear as a picture with the name.  The app is always suggesting other cooking websites I might like.  I can browse Yummly for recipe ideas.  The app allows some customization, too, in the settings.

title: Life changing!!
body: We have eaten at home every night this week which we NEVER do and I credit this app for helping us.  Everything you need is all there.  Assemble the recipes you like, pick which ones you want for the week and put them onto your list.   Send the list to be compiled and it adds everything up to tell you totals of all ingredients to buy and then you pick which store you want to send your list to!!!  I LOVE this app!!!  My favorite one honestly!

title: Love this app
body: Not sure how I stumbled onto this little gem but it is the best food app I have found in a long time.  Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I love Tasty, but this one has so much more to offer.

title: Great for beginner adults
body: For someone that‚Äôs new to living on their own and essentially not really having very many recipes passed down from family members, this app is great for trying new recipes and saving money! Things have been really tight for my boyfriend and I and he‚Äôs a very picky eater so it‚Äôs hard to find recipes that we both enjoy. This app has provided so much of that and gives really great detailed information, like if a recipe is easy, quick and affordable!

title: Good but needs work
body: I love this app when searching for new recipes, I like that I can creat my own folders/tabs to sort my recipes by breakfast, dinner, soups and ect. Within recent weeks the app hasn‚Äôt been loading, I‚Äôll only see 4 recipes I have saved out of 60 I have in ‚Äúdinner‚Äù tab, or I‚Äôll see a blank screen because nothing is loading. There‚Äôs an option to pay for access to other areas of the app but with these glitches I would be upset to pay for something that isn‚Äôt working properly.

title: I love this app.
body: I am always looking for inspiration for something new and this app lets me do that. I look through it and see something I like and I sometimes make it like that or change it up a little bit. A couple of Thanksgivings ago I made a seafood dip from one of the recipes on here and it was a hit! I doubled the amount of seafood but other than that it was the same and it was the first thing that was completely gone. I highly recommend this app.

title: User friendly and enlightening
body: I thought Yummly was going to be a run of the mill recipe apps: not easily accessible to variety of recipes, small selection of off shoot recipes and poor UI. I was very wrong. It‚Äôs the google of recipes and can be narrowed to fit specific dietary plans. They also had the heart to put in a ‚Äòskip to recipe‚Äô button rather than making you scroll through the authors life story before getting to the recipe. Excellent app, highly recommend it.

title: To The Rescue
body: I‚Äôm not much of a cook these days!  However, anytime I need to prepare a dish for a church event or a full meal for a family gathering it‚Äôs ‚ÄúYummy‚Äù to the rescue!

title: Great App - love how it channels recipes from various blogs
body: Yummly is my go-to app for finding recipes. I love to cook and explore new ingredients and diets. Yummly makes it easy and streamlined to discover recipes that utilize a specific ingredient with dietary requirements or restrictions. For example: I can search sugar-free, gluten-free, vegan cookie and many options are generated. Often, I research many recipes and then alter the recipe to fit my needs/dietary requirement. Yummly makes it easy to categorize recipes so that I can reference them again. I love Yummly!

title: It's nice :)
body: It's a really lovely application!

title: One of the best recipe apps
body: Finally, an app where I‚Äôm not forced to sit through a cooking video before they give me the recipe (looking at you, Genius Kitchen). The app is easy to navigate. Sometimes the pop ups are annoying but they don‚Äôt happen often. The only thing I don‚Äôt like is that you usually have to scroll all the way down the page to get the directions. I don‚Äôt need an 8 paragraph backstory on how you obtained the recipe. But, overall, one of the best recipe apps.

title: Useful recipe app
body: Yummly helps find new recipes to try from many different websites.   The Search function has a variety of filters that can search for recipes by ingredients, special diets, allergens, cuisines,  difficulty,  preparation time, etc.   The app also makes suggestions based on previous input.

title: Helpful
body: I absolutely love this site. The recipes are fantastic. I have hundreds of them saved, and it can't wait to try them all. I recommend this site for everyone who loves to cook,  or who, like me, got tired of fixing the same old dishes. If you're looking to spice up your meals, try the vast amount of recipes on his site. The only negative thing is that I wanted to make a meal I found on the site. I clicked on the directions and it no longer existed. I was very disappointed.

title: üòÉTHE WAIT IS FINALLY OVER !!üëç
body: Being an early adopter, I purchased a Whirlpool smart range as soon as it became available. After seeing its capability at CES 2018, I was hooked. Although certain app revisions created problems for me, I must say the app now functions as promised. Love the guided ‚Äùconnected‚Äù cooking as well as the newest ‚Äùfood recognition‚Äù capabilities. Keep up the good work Yummly, the future is looking bright. Now if I could only get Alexa to recognize my oven, we would be in some serious business.

title: Great recipe app
body: If you have a weird family like mine, it‚Äôs hard to find a source for gluten-free, nut-free, dairy-free, non-spicy, picky-eater cuisine. There have been times I‚Äôve wanted to tell my crew to just eat air. But not anymore! Thanks to Yummly‚Äôs preferences, I can find wonderful recipes and make more than bland cardboard-esque concoctions. There‚Äôs a fantastic grocery list feature in which I can choose which items to add, in case I already have some of them in the pantry, and even add my own items. Brilliant!

title: Generally really good
body: The app has ingredients for recipes but when you click into the instructions it takes you to any old webpage you can do a web search for that shares a lot of ads and some story about how the recipe is something the author makes on rainy days, yadda yadda and you have to close the ads and scroll past the junk to see the instructions.

title: Loooooove
body: I love using this app!! I use it when I have certain ingredients I want to use but no idea what to use them for! This app gives me so many ideas

title: Awesome app for those with food ALLERGIES!!!
body: I‚Äôve been using Yummly for a few years now. It has become my go-to recipe book because I have a gluten allergy, my dad is lactose intolerant and my mother in law is dairy free. My grandmother is also diabetic. When I‚Äôm cooking for the family I can change the search parameters and only get recipes that work for everyone‚Äôs special diet. Some recipes are kinda nuts but many are very easy and ‚Äúnormal‚Äù to people who are not used to the substitution of special diets.

title: My Go-To Recipe Book
body: If I ever need a recipe for anything, I come to Yummly now! I used to use my recipe books, but now I find the recipes are more diverse and I can always find something I will save. My daughter is vegetarian & her family is not, so when I make meals when we go to Louisiana, I don‚Äôt need to bring a cookbook with me, I rely on Yummly for all my cooking! I choose my meals on the ingredients in the recipes and I have expanded our menus!! I have also discovered so many delicious desserts!!!

title: Almost perfect but. . .
body: I wish there was a way to add links from the internet when browsing. I‚Äôd like to transfer over my many recipes from Pinterest bc this app has better organization for recipes quite frankly but I‚Äôm unable to do it. The ability to do this would make life much simpler. That‚Äôs honestly the one up Pinterest has on you. Anyway just a suggestion. If I‚Äôm wrong and there‚Äôs an easy way to do this, please let me know! If this is ever integrated into the app, it‚Äôll be a definite 5 stars from me. Thanks!

title: Excellent!
body: This app is really amazing. There are so many recipes! They are really good,too. You can enter the ingredients you have and say how much time you want to spend prepping the meal and it will give you recipes that meet those specifications. You can save them in categorized lists. I have recommended Yummly to everyone I know. From new to seasoned chefs, there is something for everyone.I use this every day and have several recipes saved for Thanksgiving this year. :)

title: Good recipes, but
body: I think the recipes are great. However, the website isnt as easy as the app. The app makes it hard.  You can create categories to save your ‚ÄúYums‚Äù, but the categories are not alphabetical and you can‚Äôt make them alphabetical. Because of this flaw, you have to scroll up and down to find what you‚Äôre looking for.    Every other recipe app allows for your categories to be alphabetical.    I scroll past what I‚Äôm looking for and have to rescroll.  Time wasted and annoying.  Otherwise, I love it

title: Too many people too full of themselves
body: There are a lot of recipes and many are good. But there at times are TOO many and it is overwhelming to try and sort through all them with their minor variations. But the worst part are the pseudobloggers who think I want to read through 20 pages of their thoughts or their experiences before I get to the actual recipe (and most that I have seen do not have the Jump to Recipe button). I don‚Äôt care about you, your kids, your dog, or whether you had spaghetti three times last week. I just want the recipe.

title: Too good to be true
body: I love this app. I was struggling to plan meals to make so we ate out a lot which is so expensive and not really a great idea these days anymore. I had Yummly in my phone but hadn‚Äôt really used it. When I started using it though it turned meals into  an exciting time of discovery for the whole family. Expanding flavor profiles and new discoveries. The family uses dinner time as a time to show off and sharpen cooking skills and trying new things. Thank you.

title: Excellent organizing resource!
body: Yummily goes beyond categorizing; It not only takes the breadth of internet sources and organizes them, it allows you to see what others think of recipes and gives you a place to create your own folders for anything. It‚Äôs seriously like the Pinterest of recipes but more functional in terms of cooking as it even gives you a shopping list, serving size help, and again the rating which I really appreciate. Thank you YUMMLY!

title: Directions Please
body: I chose this app because I thought it would be helpful, but lately I am not sure about that.  On numerous occasions I have seen a recipe I wanted to try in your email.  It opens in the app but when directions are requested I am met with ‚ÄúThe page you are looking for no longer exists or can't be found on our site.  Be sure to double check the link URL for any typos. Perhaps you can return back to the site's homepage and see if you can find what you are looking for. Or, you can try finding it by using the search form below.‚Äù  I have tried searching to no avail.  Perhaps you need make sure directions are available before posting in email.

title: I‚Äôm sticking to Epicurious App for now
body: Sorry Yummly. I‚Äôve tried your app and I want to like you, but I‚Äôm sort of ‚Äúmeh‚Äù.

title: Cheesy Potatoes
body: I needed a directions because I knew in my head or maybe my mouth what I wanted to eat. Yes use Yacon potatoes but peeled and parboiled in salt. I also saut√©ed onions before layering, heavy cream more oz than called for (because that‚Äôs what the store had) and I melted a sharp and white blended cheese (because that‚Äôs what I had) mixed  with a little garlic powder. It was so tasty, I can‚Äôt wait to eat it again for leftovers!!!  And easy... use a good SAFE mandolin, slice, layer potatoes and onions, pour the warm cheese mixture , put it in the oven and your done.

title: Changed my life
body: This is the most incredible app! Amazing recipes. it doesn‚Äôt redirect you to safari if you open the directions, it has an internal server. The user interface is equal parts intuitive and beautiful. It‚Äôs is completely customizable as well! You can categorize recipes, search by ingredient, and even set what time you want to eat and it will tell you when you need to start cooking! I would highly recommend this app to anyone!

title: Just what I needed in a recipe app
body: The visuals in this app are great. It is also very easy to use. I appreciate that the shopping list feature is well integrated to add items right from the recipe. I also like the options to exclude things you are allergic to, however, I wish the options could be expanded in that category, as well as, a category of ‚Äúdon‚Äôt like‚Äù Ingredients. Overall it is aesthetically pleasing and easy to use with lots of recipe options. Love it!

title: Such a helpful app!
body: I use Yumly daily! This is a fantastic international cookbook with helpful features like grocery list generation, shopping assistance integration down to what aisle to seek in your local store, and scheduling. I‚Äôve saved money using this app by shopping sales and planning meals around them; additionally, I can pinpoint common ingredients between recipes and shop smarter that way, too. The best part is, I‚Äôm using mostly fresh ingredients (with no waste) now with this app‚Äôs organization.

title: Good resource for recipes of all kinds
body: I have been using Yummly for a few years.  I have found a wide variety of recipe options and I love being able to see reviews and stars about how others feel about a recipe.  If a recipe has lots of positive reviews I can use it with confidence.  Ididnt give 5 stars simply because sometimes I just can‚Äôt find what I need through this site but a general search turns up what I need.  The downside is however I‚Äôm never as confident as I am about trying new things with Yummly.

title: What the...?
body: Look, I love the app...I really do but it is off putting to scroll through recipe choices and see a freaking face....  It‚Äôs like what the...?  I came to this app to look for recipes not people as if they‚Äôre looking for dates?  I‚Äôm not even sure why you‚Äôd plaster your face on a recipe instead of a picture of the food?  Even if you‚Äôre a professional, that‚Äôs great but if I‚Äôm looking for recipes featuring eggs and salmon I don‚Äôt want to see a random face I‚Äôd like to see the potential dish first, hence the three stars and that‚Äôs not the first time I‚Äôve seen random ‚Äúchefs‚Äù appear in place of displays for dishes.

title: This is a game changer
body: As a mom of 4 and a husband who loves variety, I love the huge amount of recipes available on this app. It‚Äôs also so easy to add recipes from other websites. I create my weekly menu using their easy folder feature and I really enjoy how simple it is to sort recipes. It‚Äôs also so easy to quickly pull up recipe ingredients so I can add them to my grocery list. I can‚Äôt imagine switching to a different recipe and menu-planning app.

title: My go-to app!üëçüèΩ
body: I never write reviews about anything but I REALLY love this app. It‚Äôs always my go-to, first resource for finding new recipes. I have a lot of food allergies and Yummly is really the only app that I found at the time which lets you register foods that you can‚Äôt or don‚Äôt like to eat. This also sets you up for typing in ‚Äúdiet‚Äù plans you follow and the database is extensive! I hope someone else who‚Äôs got stricter eating habits will benefit from trying this app out, too!

title: Yummly Rocks!!
body: I love this app! It has thousands of recipes. It gives me a picture to go by. When I search, I love how many options I have! There‚Äôs the simple recipe, complex fancy one, quick one, I don‚Äôt have this ingredient, it literally has me covered in most scenarios. My favorites so far are the homemade taco seasoning and Italian meatballs! Better than my favorite Italian restaurants!! Seriously!! No matter what your looking for, they probably have several to choose from. Go for it!

title: Not bad, but needs work
body: I have been messing with this app and another for a few months now. The other app is much more user friendly but it does not have the recipe support that this one does. The other app can download recipes and videos from the internet for use which I have done for copycat recipes. But, those can be lost when a link changes, which has happened.  What I like here is that I can quickly get multiple recipes and look at them then see which one I have the ingredients for.  In the end I‚Äôll be continuing with both apps.

title: Not the same since the update
body: Don‚Äôt get me wrong. I LOVE Yummly!!! This app is a lifesaver and makes cooking at home (for ANY dietary restriction) easy and fun and different.

title: Love this app but...
body: I love this app a lot. I find so many recipes. But I don't like the set a time to what time you want to start the meal. I never use it and my it doesn't fit my life style. Also I wish there's a button for the recipes you are not interested in. It be nice to have a button like that so it will make the recipe not show up again. It be nice to be able to stop seeing recipes you won't use. So you can see more variety of recipes instead seeing the few recipes you don't like all the time.

title: Needs to tell the amount per serving!
body: I‚Äôve only used this app for my diet for a couple of days but so far it‚Äôs been great! but sometimes when I want to share a meal with the family and make 4 servings, we all want to know how much it is for one. On most of the recipes you can set it to one serving and it‚Äôs not a problem to figure out how many cups or whatever measurement of it you can eat,but when it comes to figuring out how many cups it is per serving it gets difficult since most of them don‚Äôt say.

title: Simple. Secure. Stacked with Recipes
body: The recipes I‚Äôve saved over the past four years are perfect. The Yummly app keeps me wanting to find more recipes. The fact that it is two clicks to any recipe is unbelievable. I‚Äôve cooked with it for a while and all I would ask for is the ability to have a text only version without basic ASCII art using only spoken languages. Would be perfect. Great app. Even better service. A free service that never stops giving.

title: Great, ‚Äúintuitive‚Äù service
body: Yummly delivers almost all the recipes one may want in various formats to suit different types of cooks. It lets users customize personal folders as well as track and rate those recipes they have prepared. One can type a list of ingredients at hand and a slew of suggestions will pop up- a very helpful feature! The only improvement I would suggest is that the app add foreign language searches to expand users‚Äô cooking adventures.

title: Yummly is pretty awesome
body: I really don‚Äôt know what else to say. I find EVERY recipe I look for. I get inspired to make other recipes every time I use Yummly. Fantastic app and website.

title: So many delicious foods to choose from!
body: I love this app! Anytime I want inspiration on what to make for dinner or for a dessert I turn to this app. Love the design of the app and love the vast amount of recipes to choose from. Super clear and easy to know the ingredients and follow the instructions and it even includes reviews from other users on the app rating how the recipes turned out! Would totally recommend this app! It makes cooking fun and something to look forward to.

title: Very happy with this app!!
body: Very, very happy with this app so far!! I work an average work well of 60+ hours as a deli manager and this has helped me make different Things for my family quickly and easily!!! Am really enjoying it and better than Pinterest because it‚Äôs just food lol nothing else to get distracted by! Well worth the money! My girls are 18,14, and 12 and they are all able to cook but this will help them to expand their knowledge in the kitchen.‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

title: So Helpful
body: As a former fast foodie desperate to make a change in the way my family and I eat, this app has been immensely helpful. It used to be so difficult for me to think about planning meals because I was trapped in a convenience mentality, thinking I didn‚Äôt have time for ‚Äúall that.‚Äù But Yummly helped me to think, plan, and execute without breaking the bank! I‚Äôm actually saving money and I feel so much better eating things I make myself. Thankful for this app!!

title: Worth the roll
body: Made these for a HS FB potluck.  It was the only dessert that was completely eaten!  (This could also be because the other desserts appeared to be store-bought. i.e. brownies, cupcakes & cookies).  I made two batches‚Ä¶ One filled with apple pie, and the other with cherries.

title: Amazing
body: Ok, I just got this app a few days ago, and I wish I could rate this more than 5 stars cuz this is so great and so much fun! At first, it was already perfect right when i opened the app, it asked me like what my diets are and what ‚ÄúYummly‚Äù should tell us when they enter like the names like ‚ÄúAlice, we had etc..‚Äù AND RIGHT WHEN I SIGNED IN, LET ME TELL YOU THE TRUTH, IT HAD SO MANY RECIPES AND WAS THE BEST. It had the ingredients and ‚Äúadd to cart‚Äù and where you could get it and how to make it. Honestly Yummly, I love you guys. GET THIS APP RIGHT NOW IF YOU HAVENT!

title: Love Yummly
body: Great way to look up favorite recipes or find new ones. You can organize them how ever you like. Really like being able to take all of my favorite recipes along with me where ever I go. Also helpful to see which other recipes are yummed, the more people like it the best yet chance it‚Äôs a good recipe. The screen with the directions will always stay on, so while your making the recipe you never have to worry about it turning off.

title: Awesome for a vegetarian diet
body: The recipes are great, easy to follow and inspirational. I just browsed through the app. Then while I was at the grocery store I kept referencing the new recipes to put together several dinners. Now we have all the ingredients we need to create unique meals. My only suggestion is that users could link their accounts so my boyfriend and I could select recipes together, and access them without having to message them to each other.

title: The recipes aren‚Äôt generic, like you find on Google.
body: I like that Yummly provides family recipes and originality! Plus there are hundreds of options. I also like the fact that the app will create a shopping Lia once you have liked a meal and allows you to check off the items you‚Äôve already placed in your cart instead of having to scroll through the entire list every time (plus they‚Äôre categorized by aisles!).

title: Best Recipe Organizer Ever!!!
body: I absolutely LOVE this app!  I like how my phone syncs well with it and when I‚Äôm on Facebook or Pinterest or any blog or webpage and I see a must try recipe, all I have to do is click and drop. I love how I can custom organize for main dish, breakfast, pastries, etc. to help me find what I am looking for faster. The grocery list is also helpful and I like scheduling my meals with the meal plan feature as well!  Please don‚Äôt ever go away or cooking/baking will cease to exist in our house!!! ;)

title: Great recipe site !
body: I get all my recipes from Yummly!!

title: An app for every diet type even those of us struggling with avoidance of Type2Diabities
body: Keto or Plant based diet u name it...and what I like most about it is the convenience to put only those ingredients you need on your shop list and those recipes your dying to try! I give it four outta fives stars! Only thing missing is a Diabetic suggestions section, though many of its recipes fall into this category you‚Äôll have to search for them.

title: Why does everything cost extra??
body: I‚Äôve been using Yummly for about 3 years and absolutely loved that I was able to easily access recipes that met my allergy and dietary restrictions. There are so many apps out there now but they all cost so much and it was great I could filter without additional cost.

title: Yummy
body: Good and easy to read. I truly appreciate the feature where I can place a grocery list if I don‚Äôt have the recipe ingredients, and the photo of the dishes outcome is a super big help along with the sectional breakdown for cuisine style. The overall profile set up is amazing and I can locate exactly what I need with ease. I would like if there were less advertising though. Other than that, I approve and look forward to continuing my service.

title: Search Criterion Don‚Äôt Work
body: At first this app was perfect; you could save recipes for later and it was awesome... the first issue I had with it was every time I would be in my saved recipes, if I selected one to look at, when I would go back to my main saved page, I have to start at the top of my list all over again, even if the recipe I was looking at was second to last. Then when u search they have questions they ask to narrow in your results; they seem to do the exact opposite of what you want... and that includes showing u recipes that have ingredients you specifically did NOT WANT.

title: Ends the what‚Äôs for ?
body: Yummly is great for trying to use up what you have on hand or coming up with ideas using the weeks grocery ads. Also, like that you can save recipes you find for the future or have come to use often. What keeps it from perfection is the fact you have to leave the app to see the recipe and having to go back and fourth until you‚Äôve found what you need can get old. Otherwise highly recommend and have found many new favorites.

title: Fabulous Way To Prepare Food!
body: Yummy has been arriving to me through my email for quite some time but the Yummly App is new to me and it is indeed exceptional! If you do not have the Yummly App and you enjoy cooking or at least preparing food then you must try it! It's a pleasure to find dishes you and your family will enjoy and its so user friendly. The review section is very helpful and the photos shoe the real thing! I have been impressed and I believe you will be as well!

title: Time saver & fun!
body: Fun to scroll through photos and great way to meal plan with scheduling feature and love the alert to remind you to start prepping before scheduled meal time. Most recipes fairly easy to adjust as needed also. Wish there was a feature to save all the scheduled meals for the week or somehow integrate or save a meal plan to use again instead of having to reschedule each individually, but love love this app have used for years and will continue to!

title: Absolutely amazing for vegans
body: One of my go to apps for finding recipes quickly and easily. You don‚Äôt even have to worry about filtering by vegan or looking for ‚Äúvegan versions‚Äù of food. Simply check ‚Äúvegan‚Äù as your diet when initially creating your account, and every recipe you ever see in the app will automatically be vegan! And it has everything. I‚Äôve never searched for a food and bad less than 20 or 30 different recipes to try.

title: Great
body: The app is absolutely wonderful, I just wish you could categorize and sort the recipes you like easier and if it had a way to make a readily accessible grocery list would be nice. Also a big issue I have is that the list of recipes always refreshes from the top of the list when you go back from selecting a recipe making it frustrating sometimes when browsing down the list

title: Terrible
body: Why would a recipe company put the actual recipes with ingredients and directions front and center when they can hide it behind 10 different things you need to click out of the way?

title: OverBoard
body: My only complaint is the sheer volume you get for options. And I suppose, diff groups pay to promote their recipes first as I see them several times when scrolling. I know the point is to find as many/all recipes but whoa. I‚Äôm not quite sure how to minimize the options.

title: How I learned to be a vegan cook!
body: I always fancied myself as a pretty good cook, but when I became a Vegan 8 years ago, I knew little to nothing about vegan cooking. I tried several online recipe apps. to help me get started including Yummly and soon found that to be my number one favorite go to app. What I like most about it is that it tracks my profile preferences and regularly sends me recommendations for new recipes based upon my previous selected recipes.

title: Go-to App for recipes
body: This is the only app I use these days.  I‚Äôve never had any technical issues. It has a variety of categories and multiple recipes of each thing; which I like to pull methods, combine and test.  The one thing that's a bit annoying is the navigation to the actual directions.  Makes it hard to scan quickly when looking for recipes to try.  But, it‚Äôs still my #1 pick.

title: This is my go to for quick dinners especially for my instant pot and air fryer!!
body: I just wish directions were easier to get to instead of clicking in separate link and then having to scroll down to find the recipe card....I use this for quick meals so I do not have time to read the blog part I just need the recipe...fast...‚ò∫Ô∏è a family of 6 is always not so patiently waiting...üòÇ

title: Needs improvement
body: Overall concept is great. But plenty of issues that make me avoid the app : the grocery feature doesn‚Äôt work right. Either it doesn‚Äôt load when I select Buy or i have to log into Instacart every single time. The recipes itself are not on the app, it‚Äôs redirected to a URL, which is annoying. The print feature doesn‚Äôt work when you want to print the recipe. Have to open in safari then print. Basically a bunch of simple fixes could make this the best app, but unfortunately it misses the mark.

title: Enjoy app
body: With vision issues, I use speech on my phone. It works pretty well. I wish that links such as add   items to shopping list  were all together so f I want to use this feature I could.   I do not like it at the beginning. I like to see ingredients so I can tell if I have every things

title: Ilove2eatalot
body: I love how the app has a lot recipes to choose from and how it allows you to add the recipe to your calendar for easy meal planning. What I love the most is it makes grocery shopping so much easier as your able to add the ingredients you‚Äôll need to your grocery list. When shopping your able to check off the ingredients as you go. I always forget something from the store so this was a plus!

title: Go-To App with an aside
body: This is my go to app. I only dislike that directions aren‚Äôt contained within the listings and take you to these bloggy articles. I don‚Äôt want more than the ingredients, method and maybe a video.

title: Game changer!
body: I was using Pinterest before to find recipes. I have to cook with several food allergies in mind (AIP paleo). While this app does cover all those allergies, it covers some major ones and shows those recipes on my feed. It‚Äôs amazing because I can tell it when I want to eat dinner and it will set reminders for me that I need to start cooking at a certain time. It will also find recipes for me when I only have a few ingredients!  Amazing.

title: I have a bit to say...
body: Yummly has every recipe I want and even some I have never heard of. It has a wide variety of food, Lots of sweet treats, salty snacks, and whole, healthy meals. I will say that they do not offer substitutes for some of the ingredients I do not have at home and that has always been an issue for me because I don‚Äôt always want to go to the store for ingredients. All in all, I think that Yummly is a really great app with lots of food options. I really recommend this app and hope you like it too!

title: Frequently frozen and full of ads
body: I don‚Äôt know what happened but recently Yummly has become very slow, and sometimes even just frozen there. Yes there are tons of recipes options there, but once you click to view the detailed directions/instructions, it will link you to an external website/original recipe websites, and those websites can be full of ads and hard to use.

title: YUMMLY REVIEW
body: I have always enjoyed using Yummly and would look at it several times a week. I had created quite a recipe box of my own on your site. However, following the last update, the site does not function as smoothly as it had in the past. The screen would freeze repearedly and recipes would not open. I have tried at various different times and there are still difficulties.

title: Great app! Pleasantly surprised.
body: Honestly, I really don't like getting more apps but this one totally works - even if you don't pay for the recommended subscriptions. They don‚Äôt even harass you about upgrading.

title: Good way to find a way to use what you have in the house.
body: I like Yummly to find recipes that use the items I have or the time I have. The downside is that it takes you to another person site and sometimes it's difficult to find the directions. Also sometimes there's a difference between what Emily Post says the ingredients and what the original poster list as ingredients. Overall though I have loved using Yummly to find new recipes that I wouldn't ordinarily try.

title: Life saver
body: In all of the ways, Yummly was introduced to me by a friend that inspired me to turn my life around in the nutrition area. Married and not sure what to cook, Yummly encourages you to type the items in your fridge and it will send you all the possibilities with those ingredients. It always turns out yummy!! Plus with the opportunity to personalize your profile with foods you enjoy and what you‚Äôd don‚Äôt, you never have to worry about yucky turn outs. I love Yummly and Yummly loves me.

title: Recommend this app to everyone I know
body: Yummly has helped me to expand my cooking repertoire beyond what I ever thought possible. I love searching recipes using just one or two ingredients or simply scrolling through suggestions. If I had to find a complaint, it would be that suggestions are often redundant (either within the list or with others I've "yummed."). But I love the ability to save recipes for later, too!

title: Must have
body: I use this app almost every day. I‚Äôm a busy mom with toddlers hanging off me all the time and Yummly is so user friendly o can find what I want right away. I can use it to quickly find last minute recipes using what ingredients I have on hand or make shopping lists for when I can actually make it the grocery store. I‚Äôve also found amazing food blogs and cooks through the recipe links. Highly recommend this app!

title: Very useful!
body: This app has really expanded my family‚Äôs ability to cook meals that are edible (mainly because we have no idea what goes well together). The search engine is perfect for using what you have in the house to create a meal.

title: My Go-To Cooking App
body: Yummly has been my Go-To cooking app for years!  There are so many options for finding a recipe that fits your requirements, whether that may be nutritional, skill level or ingredient availability. I love having the ability to create my own categories for saved recipes.  My wishlist for future releases is to have the ability to personalize a recipe in my Yums by making/saving notes.  I recommend this app to all my friends!

title: User review
body: I like that I can go to the app and find a recipe pretty quickly. I do prefer the old version of type in what I am looking for and get a group of recipes to choose from. Now there are so many questions and ingredient breakdowns i notice I become frustrated with the process before i even get a recipe and close the app. I am adding to my previous review, I struggle with the recipes and videos of the Chefs that in the middle of recipes I can use it wants me to pay for the video of the chefs. I find I do not use that as often as I used to.

title: Great resource!!
body: I love recipes. And I love these recipes. They are easy to understand. And it‚Äôs simple to add all of the items to a shopping list. This make dinner so much easier. And there are so many options. I also like that you can search by specific types of diets.  I also like the variety of drinks and kid friendly recipes. This app makes eating healthy very easy and convenient. I will definitely continue to use these recipes.

title: Folders
body: I really like that I can save the recipes in different folders. It does help to sort through. But I do not like that I can not add personal notes on what I might have changed in the recipe. The search section that lists ingredients that you want to use or have is kind of useless. Takes more time to find saved ingredients than to type in. Would be helpful if they were in alphabetical order. Now I am trying to post and it wants a nickname and everything is taken. No suggestions. I have already tried 8.

title: Great way to organize
body: It helps me stay on top of my weekly meals and still be creative. I set up meal weeks which also helps dinner budget not go out of control. It also helps with recipes that may not have gone over well with my family  by allowing me to created a never try again file.

title: Save your online recipes here!
body: What a wonderful app.  It‚Äôs a search engine for online recipes.  Very organized way of searching recipes by ingredients or by cooking method: Hit the ‚Äúyum‚Äù icon and it is saved. Then you can move your ‚ÄúYumed‚Äù recipes to a category (breakfast, dinner, desserts, etc.).  Easy way to find those online recipes that you love. I‚Äôm sure there is more it can do because I am just getting started.  I highly recommend it.

title: Couple issues
body: There are a couple issues with this app that drive me bonkers! First, our folders don‚Äôt get alphabetized so when I want to add a recipe to one, I have to scroll through my TONS of folders! Very aggravating when it should be so simple. I get maybe putting the last folder you used in top, but this is an organizational mess! Lastly and this is HUGE for me! When you open the app it silenced your music! WTH Yummly?!!!! I dance and jam to loud music when I cook and you make that really difficult with your taking over my music choices! FIX THAT!

title: Great access to so many recipes in one location!
body: I do love the Yummly app because it provides one place for me to look for a bunch of variations on one recipe. I also like that you can save your favorite recipes in the app because I go back to them very often instead of printing them all. Sometimes I don't always find a recipe I'm looking for so I have to go out of the app -that's my only critique. Other than that absolutely LOVE this app!

title: Best cooking helper!
body: This app is extremely helpful with everything when it comes to cooking. You‚Äôre able to find recipes when you have specific or limited ingredients. One of the cool features I like about it , is that you‚Äôre able to adjust the serving size of the recipe so for that day when you‚Äôre expecting to feed 8+ the app automatically changes the measurements for you. Cooking with Yummly is always seamless!

title: Yummly Reviw
body: I have used several recipe apps and this is the easiest and most versatile I‚Äôve found.  If you know the name of a dish you want to attempt, they nearly always have it, likely several.  If you just want to look at recipes for an ingredient, you can do that too.  And if you develop preferences for a particular blogger, you can view their recipe collections.  That‚Äôs just what I use Yummly for but there are a lot of other possibilities.

title: Good idea but hard to follow
body: I‚Äôm a foodie and quickly signed up for the app. Unfortunately, when I click on a recipe I receive via email, I‚Äôm EVENTUALLY provided recipes I don‚Äôt want to see and, for goodness sake, why do I have to go through so much drama to get directions?!

title: Love, love and more love!
body: I usually don‚Äôt review apps but I just had to take the time to for this little gem. Yummly has taken my cooking to a whole new level and I‚Äôm so grateful for all the amazingly delicious recipes right at my finger tips! Super easy to use, so many recipes and it‚Äôs COMPLETELY free. My kitchen has has definitely been getting since I found Yummly and I can‚Äôt thank them enough. My husbands tummy thanks you profusely, haha!

title: Love Yummly
body: I‚Äôve been using Yummly for a couple years and we‚Äôre very happy with the app and recipes. Many of them are keepers that we make on a regular basis.  Have only had one recipe not come out tasting good, but that‚Äôs bound to happen every now and then.  Everything else I‚Äôve made turned out terrific, and we‚Äôre super happy with it.  We like to choose 1 new recipe each week to try, and look forward to adding a new recipe to our repertoire.

title: This app is the first to actually get me cooking!!
body: This app is wonderful! I‚Äôve been trying to get motivated to cook at home more for years now, and everything in this app just looks so appetizing (and easy to find simple recipes) that I‚Äôve finally gotten excited to cook at home!! I love it. I‚Äôve done enchiladas, pork roast, and a few others now. I‚Äôve also recommended it to some family members and they love it too. Download it and get started!!

title: My Favorite Recipes
body: I began to follow Yummly last year while looking for recipes that did not consist of a long list of ingredients and involved cooking instructions. I LOVE to both bake and cook! So, I decided to try one of their recipes and, then, another and another and, very quickly, decided that Yummly was exactly what I was looking for.....I have never been disappointed! Yummly is at the top of my recipes list, along with my long time favorites!

title: Best app ever
body: I have use Yummly for ever. I love it. I have several hundred recipes saved. I love how the search engine works, search by cooking type like slow cooker, instant pot, BBQ, etc. the recipes are diverse and wonderful. I have multiple co-workers who I have gotten to use this app as well. Everybody loves it. I‚Äôll admit I do t know how I feel about having to pay now since it had always been free in the past. But for the money I believe it‚Äôs worth it.

title: Very good! But..
body: Great app! I like that there are ratings on recipes and that you can leave a review on them. I also like that you can search ingredients you have on hand for recipes that use those ingredients, but I wish it would find recipes that use those ingredients as something other than the main part of it. For example if I search ground beef, I would like a variety of options that include ground beef rather than just ones that use ground beef in the title.

title: Great!
body: Tons of recipes to choose from. I really like how it is compatible with myfitnesspal for importing recipes from websites. The only complaint I have is the same with every other app I have ever used.... No pinch / zoom functionality until it links you to a webpage that has it. Unfortunately there are still webpages that haven't figured out that people are accessing the web on mobile devices, but I digress.... Great app.

title: Mary McKnight Fsncher
body: I love this app. This is so convenient once you build up your Yummly Recipe box. If I get a specific request for dinner I just go to my Yummly box, click in search, type in the name of the Recipe and there it is.  Also, I love the feature that allows you to print the list of ingredients. I just take an inventory of what ingredients I may already have , and mark those off of my list. You save money with that feature.

title: Quick resource
body: For quick an easy ideas and recipes, this is a good app. However, not all recipes turn out as well. It's hit or miss, but that is not Yummly's fault; the app merely directs one to recipes. One of the biggest issues I have is trying to use the app while I am cooking. If my iPhone goes to sleep and I reopen to the app, it is not always on the recipe I was last on. Other than that, it is my go-to-app for recipes and cocktails.

title: Love the ease of it all!
body: I like to cook but I hate the organization of it all- the shopping for ingredients, making the list of

title: A great source for first time cooks
body: I‚Äôm a college student who had 0 experience cooking for herself prior to using this app. The variety of easy recipes is great even for a newbie like me and the video step-by-step recipes are especially helpful. The best feature I would say is the shopping list which allows you to add all the ingredients from a recipe or any other ingredient you want to get on the side as well - super helpful in the grocery store!

title: My Go To Recipe Sight
body: Yummly has a huge access to recipes. They tell you what to buy, they even set up a list to buy and where to get it & then give you complete directions with feedback on said recipe & don‚Äôt even get me started on options, they have tons of options that can be narrowed down to flavor, cooking styles & what you have in your kitchen right now. I would recommend to new & experienced cooks alike.

title: Annoying App
body: First, I love Yummly and routinely use their recipes that I find online. Today, I downloaded the app and it is so annoying, 8m going to remove it! When I tell you once that I‚Äôm not interested in Yummly Pro, it should not pop up every time I click on a recipe. When I click on a recipe, I just want to see that recipe. Period. This app seems to be trying to give me everything but the recipe I‚Äôm trying to get to. I can eventually get the recipe, but it takes persistence. Other recipe apps are much less cumbersome to use.
