You click directions and it opens the website to scroll forever to find instructions. It‚Äôs sooo close to being great...but useless in the same token. Like a car without wheels.

title: App of the year!!!
body: I absolutely love this app. If you want to have convenient recipes at your fingertips this app is for you!! Easy to use.. Visually spectacular!! Every time I want to try something new and healthy I use Yummly! Easy to store your favorite recipes for any part of a meal!!! HUGE FAN!!!!!

title: Filter usually means I don‚Äôt want to see those things
body: I put in the filter no spinach, but just to be safe no fresh spinach, baby spinach or chopped frozen spinach. What do I see spinach stuffed chicken breast, spinach Alfredo and chicken about 10% of the recipes I‚Äôm looking at have spinach in one form or another. Do I have to pay to get the filter to work? Does the filter work on the first row only? Well no that isn‚Äôt true that‚Äôs where the stuffed chicken breast with spinach lives. My luck with this app working for me is approaching 0.

title: Great recipe app
body: This is a great app for new recipes.  You can organize new recipes into customized categories.  The only thing I wish it had was the ability to add notes.  Also, I wouldn‚Äôt mind paying a small monthly fee to get rid of all the adds

title: Daily user
body: I love love love this app. I use it weekly to help with menu planning and daily to find quick solutions. We eat at home most nights and take our lunches to work so it's great to have an app that I can use filters to find what I need quickly.

title: Hello search feature???
body: Found it! I feel like the search function disappeared on me for a week or two but we‚Äôre back in business!! Thanks Yummly for being a great app and being responsive to your users.

title: I LOVE Yummly!
body: Access to all these recipes with a highly effective search engine to narrow the search is wonderful!  I am single and loved the ability to set smaller servings to get accurate measurements (math is not my strong suit!!). That ability is no longer available....please consider adding it back.  Thanks for this app

title: Easy to navigate and has a huge selection
body: This app does what it‚Äôs suppose to do and shows plenty of recipes to try out.  It‚Äôs also shows the details on the prep and cook time for each recipe along with the directions.

title: Love the recipes and everything else about Yummly!
body: The recipes are perfect regarding our dietary preferences and are all simple as well as really good! I also love the shopping list feature as well as the option to plan meals in my calendar. Five gold stars from me!

title: Yummly review
body: I have had this App for a few years and had many saved recipes. Last week when I attempted to open the App to check a saved recipe it locked up and wouldn‚Äôt open. A window popped up to download ‚Äúthe newest version ‚Äú which I did because I wanted to review the recipe. Once it was downloaded I opened the App and found no saved recipes. I lost all of them. This new App is not user friendly. I most likely will just google recipes if I can‚Äôt get this App to work.

title: Love this app!
body: This is my go-to for most all recipes I use. One of the most creative ways to use it is what I‚Äôd call ‚Äúreverse recipe engineering‚Äù. Essentially I find a local seasonal key ingredient at the farmers‚Äô market and then search Yummly for a way to use it to create a dish I‚Äôve never before made.

title: A Really Great Resource
body: Love this app!  When I need a recipe I can pull up a selection of quick, easy, healthy and delicious options.  Makes doing something different much easier.  Never been disappointed and I use the app quite a bit.  Cheers!

title: Great vegan recipes
body: This is the best site I ever used ! I like how I can plug in what I have on hand and it will create me a recipe ! I also like the selection of recipes and how that you can make folders and different categories to file your own recipes you have made!

title: Great app!
body: I love all the recipes on this app. I also love the how-to videos! There‚Äôs also an option when looking at the ingredients list to change how many servings you have and the app does the calculations for you! They really helped me make some very delicious meals!

title: A lot of everything
body: If you can think of a meal, any meal that seems to have ever existed in the last 1000 years you will probably find at least 20 different recipes for it. The grocery section is also very useful. Top notch Yummly!

title: Makes meal planning so easy!
body: I‚Äôve come to rely on Yummly so much for my family meal planning. Searching, filtering, categorizing, saving, making shopping lists, and scheduling cooking times that sinks with my calendar....all in one place. It‚Äôs become an essential part of being a mom.

title: Fabulous App
body: Fabulous app. Would‚Äôve gotten 5 stars except for the annoying pop-up ads and hard to print format. Otherwise Yummy has thousands of great recipes on just about everything. You‚Äôll surely find what your looking for.

title: Great app for suggestions when you have an ingredient you want to use or for variations on a theme
body: I use Yummly for my go to for ideas when I want to use specific items on hand. The variety of choices helps with ideas too!

title: Love it!
body: I love how easy it is to maneuver the website. I‚Äôve been able to find anything I‚Äôve wanted. The recipes are easy to follow and provide a lot of choices and the input from others that have tried the recipes is

title: Love love love Yummly!
body: This app is so easy and convenient to use. I‚Äôve used it for years and have become so dependent on it. I like that I can plug in a few ingredients and find a recipe to pull it all together. I also love that I can find a recipe online and can add it to my personal collection.

title: Great app
body: Great app has everything I am looking for the UI needs some help in terms of usability, may just be that I need more time to learn it. The fact that most recipes I found are links to what appears to be external sites instead of being on the native platform are why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.

title: Great app!
body: Was looking for some new meals that were easy, quick, and healthy. Found them easily with Yummly. Have tried about 10 different recipes and all were successful. Looking forward to the next 10 I already have tagged!

title: Love having this at my fingertips
body: Easy to use. Have had a few intense situations where I had to come up with a dish very little notice. This app comes in handy and meals are a hit. I like where you can see fb from others who have tried it

title: Great variety of recipes!
body: Love the variety of recipes available on this app as well as that the app takes you to the recipes which are on other websites. As a result, I am learning more about other sites that offer recipes. Great way of building community!

title: Great place to find recipes

title: Variety & User Friendly
body: I love the variety food plans, the ability to adjust based on serving size, the addition of the shopping list with needed quantities, articles and video tutorials make this the perfect all-in-one app single people or large families.

title: Delia Gray
body: Interesting recipes different from the same old, same old . Just tried the stuffing filled acorn squash along with scalloped apples and cornbread. A perfect introduction to Fall and easy to bake. My guests were very impressed. I am a finicky eater and are every last bit!  Love your site. Thank you.

title: My Go To
body: This app is great! I can always find a recipe I‚Äôm looking for and they‚Äôve all been great. I also use it for dinner ideas when I‚Äôm in a rut. I use it almost everyday. I recommend it to all my friends and family and I recommend you get it as well!

title: Yummly rating
body: This App by far it the best App I have. It‚Äôs used daily and brings both easy to cook meals as well as pure enjoyable ones to look at. What makes it so good it keeps track of your browsing then finds other recipes that are of your interests.

title: Love this!

title: Too cumbersome

body: I love Yummly, both app and website.  It has so many recipes to choose from based on your preferences.  However, I can‚Äôt yum interesting videos or articles even after I tried several times.

title: Beyond what I expected
body: I thought I'd find a handful of good ideas but I didn't expect to find do many delicious and simple recipes!

title: Nice
body: This app is incredible. Even though I have had a moment this last two weeks because the app keeps freezing and closing while reading the ingredients. This is a lovely site

title: Options for diets, cooking techniques, ingredients...

title: Any food you have in your pantry will make a meal.
body: I‚Äôve made some delicious meals from just what I have in the kitchen! Just put in a couple of ingredients and Yummly will give you several yummy options that are easy and quick.

title: My go-to app for recipes
body: I love this app! I recently went vegan and was able to filter recipes by dietary needs so that makes things easier. Plus it pulls from all over the web so the variety is wonderful.

title: Love
body: It‚Äôs rare that I can‚Äôt fine something on Yummly. I also love that I can adjust the setting to suit my needs being wheat intolerant makes it so hard but my recommendations on here is just what I need. I tell as many people as I can about Yummly.

title: Great app!
body: This app is one I use all the time for new recipes and cooking tips and tricks! The only thing I would recommend is that the recipes were all in the app and that you did not need safari to find the recipes. Overall great app!üòÑüòÑ

title: Needs a small tweak to alphabetize

title: Best Recipe App on the Market
body: I‚Äôve tried all kinds of recipe apps and Yummly provides the best features yet!  I can narrow down my ingredients on-hand, diet needs, cuisines, and so much more!! The collection of recipes are endless but can narrow down to what fits your palate. Easy to use!!

title: Love it!
body: Super easy for planning meals through the week based off time, and ingredients. Also allows you to change the amount of servings, and does the math for you updating ingredients. Definitely recommend!

title: Go to page

title: Interesting ideas
body: The ideas that come through are more than I will ever explore, but often one comes through that is a must try.  I like being able to look at the ratings for the recipes to help decide wether it‚Äôs worth trying.

title: Love it!
body: How did I live without this app before? So many things to love.....  If you are a menu maker, try the scheduler. Your recipes will pop up on your calendar. I love how much both the shopping list and scheduler have streamlined my meal planning.

title: Yummly
body: I am a simple home cook. I always enjoy finding recipes that use common simple ingredients that can be found in any grocery store. And doesn‚Äôt require the skills of Gordon Ramsey to prepare a dish. This app is perfect for me. I love it and the recipes that I have tried so far!

title: Love your recipes!!!
body: I‚Äôve loved every recipe I‚Äôve tried, and love the recipes that put a ‚Äúnew spin‚Äù on some traditional dishes.

title: Love this app!!
body: I am always looking for new ways to eat things. Yummly gives me tons of recipes at my fingertips. I can save the ones I like or look up tons of recipes in one place and pick the ones that cater toward the ingredients I have on hand. Awesome app!

title: Almost there
body: It takes awhile to print out a recipe & when I did there was no beautiful picture as was shown on the top as in the original recipe! I gave it 4 stars just because it‚Äôs a great recipe but geez... I like to keep beautiful looking recipes in my folders to go to, this one doesn‚Äôt cut the grade....

body: I really like how easy this app is to navigate. The recipes are so easy to find and so many different options to choose from. So much fun to spend many minutes of my day browsing this app!

title: ALWAYS Can find a good recipe
body: This app answers all my questions and helps me to find great recipes. Can change the portions. It never fails me I love it so much!!!! It is just the BEST!! Recipes are very good. Systems are wonderful. I have absolutely no complaints. I can find anything I want

Also dislike that you can‚Äôt copy and paste link into my recipe app without transferring to the directions which don‚Äôt always work. Finally, would like to save written directions for video recipes. Too sad. Love many of their recipes.

title: Lots of choices

title: My Go To!

body: I find more and more, I go to Yummly to get info on new recipes but also to learn how to prepare and cook something new.

This used to be my go-to app.  Now it‚Äôs my about-to-be-deleted useless app.  MANY more ads and no directions?  Congratulations, Yummly, you just destroyed your own product!! It‚Äôs so sad.....

title: Beginner Cook Turned Pro

title: Great App!

body: I would give this app a five star review, if it weren‚Äôt for the ads that are now stuck into the directions for the recipes. I love the recipes and I‚Äôve had this out for about a year. But lately, there are way too many ads stuck into the directions which makes it difficult to sift through the directions to make the recipe. I would not recommend this app anymore.

title: This is an amazing site and App

title: So many choices

title: Convenient

title: Bravo! Great design.

title: Poor transition from email

Instead, I am simply taken to the regular splash screen. I then have to search for the desired recipe within the app. Frustrating.

title: My Go to Recipe App

title: Easy and informational
body: Has lots of options where you can choose dietary restrictions or preferences. You can choose an item you have in your fridge and it will give you meal ideas. It gives nutritional information on the meals made (so helpful & awesome). So far I‚Äôm enjoying the app

body: Yummly has excellent customer support and a nice variety of recipes. No blogs or pages and pages to scroll through until finally you get the directions for the recipe.

title: I like the variety of recipes and how easy it is to use the app!

title: Very useful!
body: I use Yummly daily. It allows me to look at several recipes from many sources to compare ingredients and calories and choose the recipe that will accommodate me and my family. The shopping list is great too!

title: LOVE!!!
body: I absolutely love the recipes in this app. The only thing I wish is that when I organize them in my categories that they would leave the Yummly where they all go to when I choose them.

title: Love it!

title: Everybody could use this!

title: Roast beef eye of round.
body: Used crock pot. Low heat for 5 hours.   Browned meat in skillet first with all seasonings.   Used Lipton onion soup mix for liquid. Put veggies- potatoes, mix of red and gold fingerlings last hour.  Serve green salad with meal and feel satisfied you made a dinner for royalty.  To finish serve an Instapot cheesecake.    So good.  And only 26 mins to cook.  Refrigerate  4 hours before serving.

title: My go to place for all that‚Äôs ‚ÄúYummly.‚Äù
body: Although the title is a little bit cheesy, even when I am on one of the other sites like Pinterest exploring recipes, l usually pick one that is a Yummly recipe. Therefore, I just start with my Yummly App.

title: Great App! Easy to find recipes!
body: The app makes it easy to find recipes and save your favorite ones. I also like the variety of recipes and that you can search by category.

title: Awesome!!
body: This app is all i needed.. it has over 1 million recipes and they are all great ones. There are many varieties from drinks to desserts. the website works smoothly. Highly recommend getting this app!

title: Great to have
body: I love this app allows me to add items to shopping list. I especially like the variety of recipes. Good to have thumbs up!!! I‚Äôve even had the kids get this app it helps out a ton for dinner ideas.

title: One drawback
body: I love it and use it.  However, one drawback I ùôΩùöòùöùùöíùöåùöé is that when accessing a recipe on another site, it‚Äôs not always correct.  Either the info on the page referenced doesn‚Äôt match, or the page won‚Äôt load.  Thank you.

title: Yumly changes my life!
body: I don‚Äôt enjoy cooking. Any recipe with more than 5 ingredients is too much for me. Yumly lets me pick recipes based on my skill level. The reviews are fair and helpful and I‚Äôve enjoyed each recipe I have tried.

title: A go to for recipes
body: Easy but powerful for searching recipes especially when you have certain ingredients you want to use.

title: Love it!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
body: Yummly makes it easy for me to find new recipes and have a grocery list in hand at the store!! Plus I love the variety of re pies and can find just about anything, plus new things to try! Thx Yummly

title: Game changer
body: This app has literally turned me into an outstanding cook. If you want it. You can find it on here. The add to grocery list is just a bonus. Please don‚Äôt ever leave me or my family will starve ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Promising recipes but no directions
body: Recipe pictures looked good, ingredient list was present, but you have click a button to get to the recipe hosting website for details and directions. At least half of the recipes I looked at had broken links so lacked cooking instructions. Also pop ups with filter options were distracting and intrusive.

title: Love the filters
body: Love that you can find recipes easily to suit ANY diet because the filters are so plentiful and specific. I wish you could more easily add recipes to your account that aren‚Äôt already on Yum.

title: Love these recipes!!!
body: I always get such great recipes off of yummly!!! There are so many to choose from! Just type in what you want like chicken and it comes up with so many options of what to make! Love it!

title: Love it!
body: Yummly takes the guess work out of making a recipe by loading the ingredients right in to your shopping cart (store of your choice). Wish I knew of this app years ago

title: I‚Äôve been using Yummly for 4-5 years!
body: For last minute ideas or close approximations of something I‚Äôve made before, yummly always comes as close as possible. Also, the two times we‚Äôve done whole 30 diets...Yummly comes though.

title: Love the Recipes
body: Whenever I want an idea for a gathering or just dinner I always go to the website and find just the right ideas ..It‚Äôs my go too and have never been disappointed ..‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Yummly
body: I have been using Yummly recipes for a while now and loving them!  I just recently downloaded the app and it has become my favorite!  It is easy to use and beautifully presents the wonderful recipes!!

title: Yummly is yummy
body: This app makes it a breeze to whip up lunch or dinner, even a party!  I use it all the time, try things I‚Äôve never done before. No more boring meals. Easy to follow directions and even a shopping list!  Great choice!

title: Adequate app for my needs
body: I like Yummly, but I use it primarily for the shopping list. I find the functionality for this purpose to be less than impressive. The categories are not intuitive. The ability to edit is limited. So it‚Äôs fine but not stellar.

title: The best
body: Great recipe app!  Pulls all the internet recipes into one place and helps compare them all. Put how many guest and it calculates the ingredient amounts. Gets everything ready at the same time and makes grocery list!

title: Love it!!
body: I just love to explore all the possibilities, all the variations and all that I could do. If I can't figure out what to make for dinner I know I have the help I need to figure it out. From simple and quick to more complex and delicious!!

title: Old version better
body: Just updated newest version and I hate it.  It won‚Äôt let me see all my saved recipes before an annoying message telling me that I haven‚Äôt yummed anything in a while shows up and I can‚Äôt get rid of it.    Plus I can only scroll through so many recipes and then it doesn‚Äôt show anymore.  Wish I left it alone!!

title: Cooking made easy
body: This is the most understandably easy app to use  I have used it many times and will continue to use it.

title: Educational and the Results are Tasty
body: This is my go to app for all things food.  It‚Äôs so much more than just another ‚Äúrecipe a day‚Äù flooding your inbox.  You guide the app to provide recipes based on your interests or needs.  Love this app!

title: Great recipes but:
body: A member of my family is on a medically restricted diet and that‚Äôs not unusual. I would like to see recipe substitutions when ever possible. I realize that it‚Äôs a difficult task with the number of restrictions and allergies but it would be extremely helpful and make some recipes useable.

title: Great way to book mark recipes anywhere online
body: Sure, you still have to read the directions on  some mommy blog where someone drones on with some heartfelt story about garlic, but it‚Äôs still the fasted and beat way to organize recipes.

title: My best cooking resource!
body: I have faithfully used Yummly for several years now and can say, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the best recipe resource I know of!‚Äù Everything is in one place and I can create subjects that fit all my needs like ‚Äúcamping meals‚Äù and ‚Äúpickles.‚Äù I use it daily! ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Yummly is Yummy!!!
body: Great ideas for dishes I already love. Great new ideas and new recipes. Whenever I‚Äôm not sure what to do with a few ingredients, this app is a lifesaver. Everything I‚Äôve made with the recipes ha been delicious and a keeper for my long-term recipes book. Awesome app!!!

title: Great website!
body: Fussy eaters like me don‚Äôt usually have a site to find recipes that don‚Äôt use ingredients. I‚Äôve tried so many recipes and gotten so many compliments I keep coming back for more. Thank you.

title: Tremendous help!
body: I have specific dietary requirements that make meal planning a real chore... NOT anymore thanks to Yummly. This app has been a life saver, not to mention a real time saver. I‚Äôm able to easily plan meals within the restrictions I have; while providing a great variety... LOVE THIS APP!

title: Great resource! Best recipe site ever!
body: As a busy professional and mom, finding nutritious healthy recipes with ingredients on hand is soooo helpful! I love putting the ingredients I have available into the Yum search and having a choice of recipes that fit! Best recipe site ever!!!

title: Love It
body: I am a terrible, no good, very bad, cook. I have few to no recipes of my own and hate attempting to figure out a game plan for dinner time. Grocery visits are so exciting these days and my husband is so thankful for the smorgasbord of tasty meals. So happy I stumbled across this amazing app!

title: GREAT!!
body: I love this app so much because it is so easy to use. It‚Äôs is not confusing at all! It personalizes your feed so well! It lets you choose beginner or advanced. You can pick a time limit, dietary restrictions and preferred flavor! It‚Äôs amazing and simple!!

title: Great App!
body: Love this app! Whenever I run out of ideas to cook I come one here or if I just want to try anything out of the ordinary. There‚Äôs endless amount of recipes for almost anything you can or can‚Äôt think of!

title: What a life saver!
body: This is such a useful app. I have saved so much time meal planning especially with the diet features. I don't waste time looking through recipes that are irrelevant.  Thank you Yummly developers for such a comprehensive app.

title: Great blog full of fresh recipes for cooking for free!
body: I have tried at least 5 recipes from yummly and they‚Äôre are all easy to follow and they all turned out successful. I would definitely recommend this app!

title: Too annoying
body: If developers are going to insist upon delivering ads, at least make them easy to dismiss. Trying to press a super-tiny x in just the right spot makes the Annoying Factor too great when combined with other minor annoyances (extra tap to get to recipe directions, just the right swipe to get recipe instead of enlarged photo). I'll be sticking with Epicurious, I think.

title: Great app although it‚Äôs add too many ordering things
body: I liked it better when it was recipes... go back to recipes. Add some hard to find recipes and put a search under regional foods

title: Awesome Recipe App

title: Awesome

title: Makes cooking fun...!!!
body: After having supper on the table at 5:30 except during ball season for over 30yrs cooking had become a chore that I hated. I'm a very good southern cook and that includes fixing my share of fried foods, cornbread homemade biscuits gravy every week, we were all healthy, not overweight & took no meds for any medical conditions related to diet. Once my children were grown & gone I went through the "stop & pick something up" stage. Within 2-3 years my husband was on BP meds, I was on cholesterol meds & had gained weight along with other medical issues. Then I stumbled upon this App & I couldn't believe all the great recipes!! How good they looked & how easy they were to keep track of & how fixing them didn't feel like a chore!! I was not only enjoying cooking again but I was coming up with reasons to cook. Yes I'm still cooking southern food of course but also things I'd never made or even heard of before!! I didn't cook us a special meals for our medical issues or our weight gain but it didn't take long for the weight to come off & for the RXs to be discontinued. I believe it's because we were eating less preservatives & junks food. Yes I still fry, I make cobblers & bake all those wonderful southern dishes, cakes & pies. It's probably easier to say I cook whatever looks good. I keep a lot of folders. You'll figure out what works for you but I have 2-3 special folders I'd suggest. One for quick meals (some of those even go in the crockpot frozen). A "favorites" folder and a "don't make again" folder for the few we didn't like. Definitely give it a try. I really believe even if your kids are still home, cooking will not feel like a chore that you just dread. But you'll enjoy it again & hopefully will get your kids in there with you helping. I love when my grandchildren are here & ask to help me!! I just absolutely LOVE this App..!!! I wrote this review 2-3 years ago and I just wanted to say that I STILL love this app and I still love cooking!! I suggested that you use folders and still believe that‚Äôs the best way to go. I have several Favs, Crockpot Meats, Crockpot Meals, Holidays, Grilling, Tailgating etc. As my grandchildren got older and started cooking more, I made one for them that includes complete meals, sandwiches, snacks etc...

title: Updates are making the app worse not better
body: This app was wonderful and probably the best thing I ever used.  However I believe they are constantlyTrying to monetize it through the smart thermometer and the subscription service. Instead of making it better so you want to pay for it, it gets worse! The search feature has been destroyed.  IT was previously spot-on and returned exactly what you asked for.  Now, it‚Äôs never precise and gives you random recipes.   Also you could previously save your own recipes into your account but axed that feature too.   The latest update was that they had added a page but you know need to go look at it before you go to the main page. I do not mind paying money for a good product but please make it better and not worse for the user. Now, I am also worried that my recipes will start getting deleted with new updates so I plan to move away from Yummly.  Think about this Yummly.  Here are a few features that a user like me would gladly pay additional money for:

title: Favorite Recipe App... Couple improvements would make it PERFECT!
body: This app is great. Looks wonderful. You can add food directly to the shopping list... And it  automatically categorizes the foods so you're not walking all over the store! Recently the feature was added to sort recipes in to different categories (dinner, sides, breakfast, etc) with option to make your own! If 2 more features were added this app would be PERFECT!

title: Good idea, needs better execution
body: I love the idea of this app, however it is such a pain to work through.

title: Great app, with too many kinks.
body: 4/4/15 Love this app, but it is dreadfully, painstakingly slow on my iPhone. All of the hangups I've experienced with this app have been on my phone only.  It locks up, skips, and if I use it around 10/15 minutes, it shuts down. So annoying. I have to use this app on my computer or tablet for fluid usage.

title: Fantastic app, missing just one thing
body: I love this app! I was all excited to see the beautiful pics (I'm very visual) and it is so user friendly and easy to navigate. It quickly learns what foods you do and don't like and makes searching recipes a breeze. The list maker is super easy and how cool that it syncs across devices?!

title: Glitches should have been fixed by now but aren't
body: This seems to be a very popular app and for good reason: it's beautiful, sleek, and helps you enjoy cooking and eating. But as other reviewers have mentioned, there are two troubling problems. If your phone locks in the middle of cooking a recipe, the app reverts back to the home screen and you have to slowly navigate through several screens to get back to your place. Also, the favorites/Yums list does not refresh with newly added Yums until you log out (disconnect) and log back in again. In fact, this is the official advice I received when I contacted them for help. I will say their response was very fast. In fact you will notice the number of your Yums (favorites) is correct and if you happen to remember (I usually don't) the recipe name, you can get to it by searching within your Yums, but the title won't actually display in the overall list. For an app this popular and so often included in "best of" lists, I don't understand why they haven't fixed these glitches yet. I hope they do.

title: Love Yummly recipes!! My son requires lactose and whey free recipes
body: Thanks to apps like Yummly, I can quickly find peer reviewed yummy recipes for my son that has severe lactose intolerance which includes whey and powdered milks. He is essentially "allergic" to milk proteins, but can tolerate a few items. If we list milk as an allergy on his medical records he will be totally screwed for any future hospitalizations so we keep it at an intolerance so I could always cook for him at the Ronald mc Donald house and bring him food. The cafeteria isn't great about making diary free foods that are appealing to a 3 year old with eating issues that has Down Syndrome and Severe Down Syndrome.  This app is a lifesaver. Thanks.  You all rock. If anyone reads this and is in a similar boat, but is further along and could help me out. Or is just starting this journey and wants to get info like me, feel free to contact me at alienjenn at yahoo

title: Kinda like a Flipboard for cooks...!
body: This truly deserves to be an app essential. I've used it since its inception and the fact that the ui and ux nuts-n-bolts have remained more or less unchanged is proof of Yummly's staying power. I've gotten so many great recipes and been inspired to create new food memories thanks to Yummly! Love the upgrades and little tweaks that enhance the app without altering its simple elegant interface.

title: Good but want more simple & Options
body: I really like this app. I didn't give more than 3 stars because, I'm a picky simple eater and I did the beginner cooking skill & added foods to dislike because the allergies section didn't let me add my food allergies and the intolerance to foods like I am slightly lactose intolerant I'm allergic to mushrooms & I don't do low fat or sodium because it really doesn't do much your body needs these things you just don't over do the salt or over eat. I would likfe the dishes that are listed for me didn't have or list what I said I can't eat have or dislike. Or if they had other ingredients listed for substituting or omitting them all together.

title: So personalized!
body: I love Yummly. I've recommended it to classmates and family. When you get the app, it asks you about what food you like to eat, how many people you're cooking for, what foods you don't like, and your cooking level (I'm a beginner). This app makes it easy to save recipes so they're "yum'd" for later. It's also easy to organize them into categories such as breakfast, dinner, snacks, desserts, or your own personalized categories such as vegetarian or appetizers. This app has made me want to cook more and there are so many delicious recipes that are easy to access and retrieve when you need them. I also love how fast and easy it is to save something by clicking "yum."  Highly recommend this app. Please don't change. I do wish that I could save some of the videos though. I occasionally watch recipe videos and I can't always go back to find them. That's one request that I'd like to make. Good work and fantastic app!

title: Meh
body: Meh

title: Love this app!
body: I really like this app, and would give it 5 stars if it weren't for 2 minor, but fairly annoying things. I often search for multiple recipes at a time, so when I open the search bar I have to delete the last thing I searched for, no big deal except when you do that it sends you back to the home page and closes the search bar. Why would I delete a word in the search bar to close it? If I wanted to close it I would. Until I got used to that it resulted in me accidentally opening recipes I didn't want because I thought my keyboard was still open, and I was trying to type.

title: Customer service at its best
body: I had a slight issue that caused the app to crash when I attempted to login with my Google+ account. I sent a quick email to their support team and received a friendly and personal response within minutes (literally, 8 minutes). The fix was submitted to the App Store for approval and out to my phone in less than 2 days. I even got a follow-up email to let me know the fix was available.

title: Beautiful and very useful app
body: This app is like pandora for recipes. They'll suggest recipes based on past recipes that you've liked and they've been quiet accurate with their suggestions. The app is also very easy to navigate and has a beautiful interface. I've found some great recipes here with easy to follow instructions, an easy shopping list feature, and even nutrition facts. I'm giving the app 4 stars because they don't always have the recipes I'm looking for. Also other more established cooking websites have the advantage of thousands of users reviews for each recipe. So they'll automatically pull up the recipe people found easiest to use and best tasting. I find great recipes on yummly but I sometimes feel safer using a recipe I've found from a more established cooking website. That's just a matter of time and numbers that the other websites bring to the table that yummly can't as of now. However in terms of an app vs a website yummly is so far my favorite.

title: Love it!!
body: I've been using blue apron for a while because I was so busy with work, but decided to try meal planning on my own to allow more flexibility and for us to pick meals more suited to my family's dietary needs. I tried a couple different meal planning apps but they were either too limited in recipe finding or too structured and took too long to set up. I found yummly and love it!! It's UI is so intuitive and beautiful compared to other meal planning sites. Plus the recipe searching is second to none - you pick up food blogs, traditional food/recipe sites and all with very powerful filtering. Than you can create you shopping list and just buy what you need. The only feature I wish it had was a way to organize the meal plan for the week so you could put together the entrees and sides you pick, but I somewhat got around that by creating a new collection for the specific week.  Awesome app!!

title: Best collections & variety! Great app!
body: I love receiving my Yummly emails as they're always filled with scrumptious recipes from appetizers to desserts. The app is very user friendly and makes it easy to see the ingredient list as well as the directions and time involved. You can easily add any items to a shopping list that you can order for delivery (I've not done that but it has that feature) or you can just readily pull up the shopping list which automatically adds the quantity of the ingredients.

title: Wow
body: I'm updating this review because I have even more awesome to share! First-I rarely write reviews but this app deserves it. I've finally discovered the singular app that curates all of my favorite recipes, creates shopping lists and keeps the above organized for easy reference! Ahhh! I love this app so much! Can create as many "categories" (think "boards" on Pinterest) for my recipes and most important, like Pinterest, it's a visual based app! I scroll through PHOTOS of the recipes I've added! Score! I typically visit sites like TheKitchn or Martha Stewart or pioneer woman for tried and true excellent recipes- this app lets me search all of those AND recommends like recipes. I finally have my inspiration for cooking 3 meals at home again. When we can make your own biscuits, your own brisket tacos and your own ice cream and make everyone in your house happy-- why leave the house for food ever again?!? Xo

title: Awesome app, but...
body: Great app for discovering and maintaining a collection of recipes! But I do have three complaints. First, if I enter in a recipe of my own using the web interface, I haven‚Äôt been able to figure out how to refresh my list of recipes on my iPhone.  It eventually shows up, but not in a timely manner. Second, and this is really my biggest complaint. When I go to the trouble of entering in a recipe of my own, when I add the recipe to my shopping list I expect the ingredients to appear exactly as I have entered them.  For instance, if I enter ‚Äú2 spaghetti squashes‚Äù why does it appear just as ‚Äú2 squash‚Äù in my shopping list? Or if I enter an ingredient ‚Äú2 cups no-beef broth‚Äù, why does it appear as ‚Äú2 cup beef broth‚Äù? Sometimes the details matter! Third, why does my shopping list keep rearranging itself? It‚Äôs especially irritating when I‚Äôm checking off several items and the order of the list keeps changing! Fix these three things and I‚Äôll change my rating to 5 stars!

title: Love! -A Few Suggestions Though
body: Love this app. Seriously! It makes my life so much easier. I lack some major creativity in the kitchen and this makes that so much easier. Very much appreciate the categorization of recipes and that they can be added to multiple categories at once. Love that the shopping list isn't just a list but you can check things off as you go- so convenient! A couple suggestions:

title: Great App! Plus it's free!
body: I never write apps but I had to for this because it has had such a positive impact on me! I have tried many meal planning apps and this is by far my favorite. It asks your likes/dislikes any special diet you may be paleo, etc. Then it suggests recipes or you can search.  I have a hard time finding recipes that my kiddos will eat and this app has helped so much! They are trying new things and so are we! We are also eating healthier thanks to the healthy option of recipes!It has brought us all to the family table again. Another perk is that once you find a recipe you like you add it to your "yum" box and you can pick the ingredients you need to make the recipes and it adds it to a grocery list! Awesome! Hope you give it a try it really has taken lots of stress outta my life with the constant wondering what I am gong to fix for the week. This makes it so easy!

title: Solid app
body: I've already told many friends about it. Before I could form a request they added the option to search based on ingredients that I have on hand, but the effort needs improvement. Dump the pre-existing list. This actually took the app a bit backwards for me because mayonnaise began showing up as an ingredient in some of the recipes that I'd searched. Since I put that on my banned list it was surprising.

title: Great for party planning and everyday shopping
body: Just had a party and looked for meals. I knew some of my guests had food allergies and you can restrict your search so those ingredients don't show up. Also, I was able to add ingredients to a shopping list and then text or email it to my husband who was shopping with me.

title: üòòüòù‚ò∫üòãüòÜ
body: üòèI love this app!! My favorite in fact!! It has allll the recipes you need because it pulls from the vastness of almost every recipe app I love PLUS the Internet etc. I love the shopping list and scanner abilities and the fact that you can even scan an item and see what you can make with it since it shows you related recipes. It's gorgeous as well - I love the formatting. My only thing is that sometimes when rapidly yumming things üòé I sometimes wish that there was a quicker way to select the type of yum that it is ie: breakfast dinner drink side etc and I wish the order stayed the same everytime you go to do that or at least have a smart feature that does that for you?? Or maybe it's just perfect the way it is! üíõüíôüíúüíö‚ù§ I literally have never left this kind of comment/review on any app before ever. Good job Yummly !!!

title: YUM's got it
body: Seriously one of the best apps that I've downloaded. As an old guy that's been eating pretty much grilled everything this app brings new light to all the alternatives out there.  As I'm working to improve the 'ol diet as the metabolism isn't what it used to be this app has real appeal in that it shows you the calorie count as well as the ingredients and nutritional values.

title: Good App! Easy to use
body: I just started using this app and I gotta say it's pretty good. You can look up a ton of recipes ranging from quick and easy to full on pro dishes. I also like that you can search by ingredient, diet (paleo, vegan, etc,) and you can enter ingredients u don't want or are allergic to into your profile. You can also make sub categories and put recipes into categories such as sides, dessert or make your own and separate your chicken, beef, and fish dishes. The best thing about the app is that you can tap on the ingredient and add it to your shopping list to have handy next time you go to he grocery store. It also links up to your health app on the new iPhone 6 and tracks your intake. Good app overall.... Didn't give it 5 stars because there is always room for improvement... Although I haven't found a flaw yet. Do recommend!!!!!

title: Beautiful, delicious, inspirational
body: I love this app and have been using it to plan my weekly meals.  I love the emphasis on the pics - i.e. scrolling through pics to choose the recipe you'd like.  I love the shopping list, which I just used for the first time this weekend.  It is very easy to use.  I saw a comment once where someone thought it was difficult to go through your "yums" once you have a large amount, but that is easily manageable if you just categorize things as you "yum" them - ex. label something as dinner, lunch, drink, etc.  They also let you create your own labels which is nice.  I've created a label called "this week".  I put all of my meals for the week in that category so it's easy to add them to the shopping list and also easy to find them once you are ready to cook them!   Love this app!!

title: Great app for those who love to cook
body: This app is really fantastic. As a young person who is just beginning to enjoy the love of cooking, I use this a lot. I am constantly using this all to find new recipes. Or if I pick something up at the store that is on sale, I immediately use this app to find a recipe to use it in. Also, as a vegetarian it is great for finding recipes that contain items that contain item necessary for a vegetarian diet such as eggs, beans, etc. I usually get bored with food quickly so I use this app to try 1 or 2 new recipes a week. I also enjoy the "pantry" feature which tells me exactly what to shop for when shopping for new recipes to try. In general, this app is fun, easy to navigate, great for nutritionalists, or those who are just looking for an easier way to cook. Definitely get this if you like to cook.

title: Time, Space & Money-saving
body: Yummly is my very own, ever-expanding, lightweight, recipe 'book' that I carry everywhere to explore & create healthy family meals at a moment's notice!  I now have an entire pantry shelf available for food/storage items instead of a massive, 55-year, international collection of cooking & recipe books (I've donated them all to Christian school-charity garage sales, Goodwill & Salvation Army).  The Search Feature for a broad range of recipes that contain the item(s) you already have in the fridge is The Best Feature of Yummly (besides the fact that it's a Free app); followed closely by the Shopping List Feature that saves time in quickly checking off the items you need, against what you already have at home; and, helps you keep focus off of costly 'snack-attack' extras strategically placed in the store.  In short, Yummly is a Great Blessing to me.

title: Love it but could use some improvements
body: I love the app and I use it weekly! It helps me try new things and it helps me stay on top of what I'm actually intaking. I love how you find new recipes but I'm finding some recipes' ingredient lists are not the same as they are once you click 'get directions.' Also the interface of using the app to then have to go to a blog to get the full recipe is troubling. Often there will be ads or a lot of stuff crowding up the page and making it hard to read on a phone. There should be a feature added to the grocery list that acts as a "preparing this week" type list so you can compile both the ingredients you need and which recipes you're using that week to make it easier on you once you go back to the app to make the dish. Overall, love it but it can be tweaked.

title: My Favorite App!
body: Even if cooking is not your forte, this app will draw you in with its simplicity and beautiful pictures. In the beginning you'll set up your own personal profile and let Yummly know if you have certain food allergies, what foods you like, what foods you don't like. They also have all the categories..,.Mexican, Japanese, Mediterranean, vegan, it's all there. You can also choose your recipes depending on how difficult they are to make. If needed, you can choose recipes which are more simple to make, or try intermediate or more difficult recipes for a challenge. I love that you can add all the items to a shopping list, too. I had a a couple of issues with my account (which were totally my fault!) and their customer service was so nice and quickly fixed my problem!

title: Holy convenience
body: I used the app for a couple of days, thought it was pretty sweet that you can make a shopping list from your saved recipes, but wished I could hide recipes with high sodium/millions of calories... So I send support some feedback thinking maybe if enough people suggested it they might change things in the future. Turns out I'm just an idiot. They emailed me back the same day and told me where the filters were, right under the search function. I says to myself, "well that's nice, but I'll bet you don't have one for slow cookers, or prep time..." Open up the app and check it out, shazam; filter by fat, cholesterol, calories, cooking methods, prep time, carbs, salt, bitterness, sweetness, meal course, what tv show it pairs with, you get the idea. They've thought of it all. Just quit reading this and get the app already. It's good.

title: Great start!
body: As a single father raising three tikes I do all the cooking and what a pain it has been to finally find something that is not overwhelming or bogged down with design saturation. Something that is clean and immediate is a great find. App is great so far. UI is good, architecture seems well thought out and overall design is approachable. Love the ability to simply add ingredients to your shopping lists from a selected recipe so please look at the process of leveraging those lists off the websites/blogs/posts you get option recipes from because I'm coming across a lot of broken or missing items on the lists. That part is a little cumbersome as you have to go back and forth to double check to make sure you got everything on your shopping list to create the meal.

title: Bye Bye, EPICURIOUS!
body: Epicurious was my go to recipe site for years, but I find Yummly to be one of the most robust applications for finding recipes around. It seems to pull recipes from all over the web. It allows me to save and categorize them the way I want to.

title: Easy, Breezy!
body: I HATE TO COOK!!  That said, I HAVE to do it because I have a family.  Since getting the Yummly app never have I been more excited and and willing to get in my kitchen and start stirrin' up the goods.  There is something for every palate on Yummly and as an added bonus, my kids love to go through the various recipes and "yum" the meals, snacks and desserts that are most appealing to them.  That's a huge plus for me because I don't have to guess about what they do or don't like, I can simply look at their selections.  My husband uses it for grilling ideas and useful tips.  So in one app I've gotten over my fear and resentment of cooking and have replaced it with with the joy of togetherness in creating a great, nutritious meal with my family.

user_name: Can't wait to go to DL
title: Sad sad day üò∞üò∞üò∞üò∞
body: This app WAS Great I absolutely loved it and would use it to or three times a day to find new recipes for things to make meals I've never even thought of almost 100% of the time the meals turned out great, I love that you can make your own categories and choose specific ingredients that you do not want included in your recipes. I have recently game to a grain free sugar free dairy free diet and it has not been easy to say the least to find things to eat, so I appreciate the amount of recipes I am able to find on the Yummly but and this is a big but Since the update it consistently crashes it's very frustrating to be in the middle of making a recipe and having the app crash. I have to re-open the app and find the meal that I was in the middle of cooking and scroll past the bloggers commentaries to find where I was most of the time this involves washing my hands before and after I use the phone again it's a sad sad day üò≠üò≠

title: Crappy built-in browser
body: I love the access to various recipes-let me say that right off the bat.

title: Wonderful App/Glitch Work-Around
body: This App is the best Cooking App, bar none. It's intuitive, user-friendly, easily navagated, includes pics, and you're able to filter any way you wish.

title: Yummly is to cooking as Pinterest is to crafting
body: I love this app. I can put in all the ingredients I don't eat and suggested recipes come up that don't have those ingredients. I just wish that I could select multiple ingredients that I don't use at one time. For example, I don't use sugar, when I type in sugar a very long list of different sugars appears. Unfortunately I can only pick one sugar at a time. Then I have to repeat the search to select the next type of sugar I don't use and on and on and on. Brown sugar, light brown sugar, caster sugar, maple sugar, cane sugar, dark brown sugar, beet sugar, confectioners sugar, super fine sugar, raw sugar... And you can't just select multiple sugars in one go. So that bit is time consuming, but once that's done the recipes are spot on as to what I am looking for.

title: Yummly is the foodie's app!
body: Yummly is simply the best app I've ever used for finding literally any recipe you're looking for and it provides for any dietary need you may have whether it's vegan, paleo, low carb, vegetarian, diabetic, whole 30, etc. You'll find thousands upon thousands of great recipes for ethnic foods, too. I've found that I love to make Greek dishes and there's no shortage of delightful Greek recipes for anything that I want to cook. It also gives nutrition information, an option to add items needed to your grocery list, and a whole bunch of other options that are super useful. It makes creating a gourmet meal as easy as making a family friendly, easy weeknight meal. I highly recommend this app to anyone who loves to cook classic favorites as well as new things!

title: Best Recipe App!!!!!
body: Love this app!! It's very easy to use and is helpful for cooks at all levels. Every recipe I have found so far has been simple and easy to make. I love the fact that I can add only specific ingredients that I need to my shopping list, and then from the shopping list I can go back and find out if I forgot something!! Great job Yummly! Thank you for giving us something that is easy and fun to use!

title: How can you not like this app!?
body: I love that I discovered this app! I have to avoid very specific foods in my diet right now and the "dietary" setting feature is wonderful so I don't have to filter through items I can't eat. It's quick and easy. I use this to meal plan for at least 4-5 days out of the week and I LOVE that it's syncs to my calendar and tells me when to get started. I've discovered some preferred resources and I frequent their recipes. When I've only had a few things in the fridge I can whip something together by using this app. Love it!!

title: Tied to the kitchen.
body: Great app. There are so many recipes that everyone can find something they will like. Furthermore you can scale up or down the recipe according to your needs. Really, who wants to do math when already under a time crunch.

title: Just Perfect!
body: With this simple and elegant recipe app you'll be sure to get excited to start cooking. With lots of different recipes to choose from, even the ones where you haven't herd of before and ask yourself, what is that? It looks delicious. Photos of recipes look sharp and taken from a professional, log into to your Facebook or Google account to save your favorite recipes by tapping the 'yum' icon, search a recipe that you've been wanting to make for a really long time and make your grocery list of the ingredients you need. All in one app! Yummly, the app you gotta have to walk into the kitchen, cook what your cooking and say "mmmmm! I just have to eat that!".

title: My new best friend.
body: I seriously love this app and use it all the time. It is essentially a collection of every recipe available on the internet in one place, except that unlike just googling it, you can filter by taste, calorie, course, prep time, and you can add recipes to your list and if you hit add to shopping list, it automatically adds ingredients to a shopping list by section. I use it all the time when I'm looking for new recipes and love it's convenience. My only complaint would be that sometimes it's hard to use the recipes while you're cooking, because it is on the iPhone and scrolling with oily or chickeny hands is hard.

title: Life Saver!
body: I am at the beginning stages of learning how to cook. All I can say is this app is a life saver! I love the fact that I can search recipes based on nutrition guidelines I apply and also change in regards to what I want to make. I added a category to my Yumms that is "Today's Dish" so I can quickly find the recipe, add items I need to get to the Shopping List, and finally make. The shopping list is crucial for me personally. I'm the kind of person that walks into a grocery store with a few thugs in mind (not written down) and walk out with almost everything except those items. All I can say a negativity is sometimes I wish I could have this app on my Kindle Fire. Absolutely amazing and beautiful app.

title: So helpful
body: I am a beginner cook, and before I downloaded this app I literally was cooking the same things every week. I wanted to diversify my cooking, especially since I'm newly married, but I needed it to work with my schedule. I went to the App Store and I ran across Yum ü§ó. Not only do they give you easy step by step directions, but you can also click on the ingredients and know exactly what to shop for. Now I try a different meal at least 2x a week. My first meal didn't come out correctly, but once I kept trying it got better. Had this app for about 3 weeks now and I tell other ppl about it. Great for versatility and beginners like myself. Gave me more confidence in the kitchen!!!!

title: Great for Planning Meals... Except No Meal Planner
body: I wanted to be more involved in what I was eating, wanted to eat healthier food, wanted to eat it with my fianc√©.

title: Great App for novice cooks!
body: I'm not a great cook, in fact I hate it!  But it is less expensive than going out to eat every night, plus I have a family of four to feed.  I hate the planning part even worse than the cooking part, but Yummly has made that easier for me.  I love getting email notifications with suggestions for meals, it gives me great ideas that are customized for our taste in food.   I love that you don't even have to leave your house for the ingredients.  In my area, we have the ability to shop the grocery list that is automatically generated based on the recipes you choose, and it is delivered right to your door!  It really can't get easier than that! Amazing app in my opinion!

title: Yum to Yumly
body: I love this app for new & exciting recipes. Being a housewife/mom, I cook often. One thing I wanted to do in the new year was try new and unique cuisines. This is perfect for that. However, my rating has went from a 4 to a 3 not only because they don't have some sort of button where you can make the recipes you don't like or don't want to see disappear. It's annoying to see soo many smoothies when I didn't select that as one of the things I was really into. Plus they really are not taking into account the foods that I specifically said I disliked. They show sooooo many vegan recipes and guess what I'm far far far from vegan or vegetarian. I do hope this is fixed because I'm sure I miss out on a lot of the recipes I would cook because I'm seeing so many useless unwanted recipes!

title: my absolute favorite recipes app!
body: Being the only vegan in my family is tough, and I have to say this app has made a world of a difference. I'm able to tailor the recipes so that only vegan recipes are shown and I am astonished at all the possibilities available to me through this wonderful app! I would highly recommend this to anyone with dietary needs that still wants a large variety of food options. Another great thing is the nutritional facts shown on every recipe, and the ability to categorize your favorites. Also, the shopping cart feature is incredibly useful, and i can say it has saved me both time and money on my grocery shopping. I use this nearly every day!

title: Love this app
body: This is a great app with so many selections. Highly recommend. One thing I would like to see added is the ability to mark when you have tried a recipe. I save many recipes to my "yums". I would like to be able to distinguish the ones I have tried from the ones I haven't tried and organize them as such. And maybe give them my own ranking(not something that would be published to others, just something so I could know how my family liked them. Also the ability to add notes would be great. (something like , "added a little more garlic". Or "substituted this ingredient".) It would be great to have the ability to do that. But overall a great app!!

title: Would like this app more if...
body: Just switched to this app from the Shopping List app because it no longer functions properly. I love the recipes section and especially how I'm able to tailor my search with nutrition filters and dietary preferences. Went grocery shopping for the first time with the list feature yesterday. The only downsides are that I'm unable to create my own shopping categories, edit the category after I've added an item, sometimes it won't let me add an item if it's not on their pop up list of items, there's no ability to add multiple lists, and there's no function to add prices to each item to estimate the total cost. If these were fixed or added, I would give five stars.

title: Love app hate the ads/redirecting
body: Love this app I just hate when it redirects you to random apps/ads. This is the only reason I give it 4 instead of 5 stars. It's annoying when you are trying to read the directions and it takes you to download apps. Otherwise this app has been so great to have. I cook for 4 kids on a budget and this app allows me to mix it up every week and the best part of this app is if you allow it to know your location it can show you which ingredients are on sale at your nearest grocery store from the recipe you are using. Also you can change the serving sizes and of course I appreciate the "drinks" search option üòÅüç∑üçπüç∏üç¥

title: Great except for a few problems.
body: Love the personalized recipes and folders. I have almost minimum food waste now due to this app. Great for meal planning. Two problems though. The listed ingredients and measurements are not always the same as the ones on the actual recipe site and some really strange numbers or items pop up. Second and most important--a very fickle shopping list that syncs when it feels like it. I use my iPad at home to browse and plan meals on Yummly. When I whip out my iPhone for the shopping list at the grocery store, I have to cross my fingers that it synced and I'm not left browsing through all the recipes I plan to cook that week and adding them back on my shopping list. No Bueno!

title: Makes me an innovative cook
body: I love this app! I've had it for a long time but just started using it regularly. The best thing about this app that is you can adjust the settings to filter out what you like and don't like or other food preferences. That makes looking for a recipe with something you want to use SO much easier because it'll only show you what's relevant to you. You can also pick your cooking level. And I'm constantly finding new things to cook with the ingredients I use most.

title: my most used resource for cooking!
body: I love cooking and have a supply of cookbooks, recipes, and favorite websites, but I use Yummly most of all. On days when I need inspiration or am curious about some dish someone has made I turn to this app first.

title: Good app for finding  delicious food recipes
body: After buying this app and trying it out for the first time and scrolling through the recipes all I can say is that I really like/ love this app with what recipes they have and I like how they even have videos of how to make/ cook the recipe and how they display what ingredients you need also love how the app has a way to organize certain recipes or food categories this app really makes it easier for me to find a recipe for when I'm either really hungry for a certain dish or sweet or casserole or just simply a recipe to satisfy my craving for when I even don't know what I want to eat

title: Flawless
body: First review I've ever done, and I owed it to the creator of this app. You, my friend, are the real MVP! I clap my hands for your greatness. If there was an award for awesomeness....it would be named after Yummly. Unfortunately, for every other participant, everytime I open this app...you again would win the Yummly Awesomeness Award, Yummly, and leave the others competing for second. This may seem a bit much, but this is an understatement of how great this app is. Sometimes I want to open this app, lay my phone down and throw money at it like a stripper. This app is simply magnificent. If I were famous, I'd have to be the face of its advertisement. Simply put...this app is dope...and at intergalactic potency!!! üòä

title: My favorite app!
body: Yummly has to be my favorite app on my phone. It's probably the one I use the most. As a person who is now gluten free, it is so essential that this app allowed me to set my preferences and needs for my account based on food allergies, etc. All of the recommended recipes for me are gluten free every time I access my app. I don't have to filter the recipes each time I log in, which is extremely convenient. It's also great how I can categorize my recipes that I've "Yummed" by breakfast, lunch, etc. I don't have to search the internet for good recipes anymore. Yummly is my go-to recipe box for sure! Love, love, love it! Oh and it's free! üòÉ

title: Love it!
body: I am so happy to have found this app! I feel like it literally saves my life. I had been spending so much of my time clueless about cooking and agonizing about what to feed myself, so frustrated that this dilemma never ends, and then just giving up and ordering takeout, which had such a negative effect on my body and my wallet. And then came Yummly. It is amazing. I'm actually doing a cleanse right now with pretty specific exclusions. Yummly makes it so easy to set your criteria and then find tons of recipes that will fit. I am so grateful. And my hope is that the bank of recipes will just keep expanding. This is genius. Please don't ever take this away!

title: A few of my favorite things...
body: I love that Yummly gives a preview to the ingredients without having to open another page. I love that you can build a menu by adding recipes to your Yum folder and create sub folders (I keep a weekly menu folder that I can easily move recipients in and out of without deleting them). I love that you can click and add ingredients to create a shopping list and share with others (I forward mine to my husband so he can shop on his way home). It is also great that you can share recipes directly with friends through text or email. Keep up the good work Yummly!

title: Great App! Some thoughts...
body: I waited a while to review the app so I could see all the features. I LOVE the design and layout, the ability to create a shopping list and categorize recipes. This app has really inspired me to cook. Improvements to be made: the list of ingredients doesn't always match the actual recipe, so I spent a little extra money on that glitch. The directions section just takes you to the website of the blogger, which is fine but it never loads so I always go straight to my computer when it's time to cook. If the recipe feed refreshed a bit more with new ideas as well I would have zero complaints. Will continue to use!!!

title: The best so far
body: Every time I want a new twist on an old favorite , or something brand newI have found that the other cooking apps either assume I am a rank amateur or a professional chef. Neither is true. Yummly gives me plenty of options by meal, course, or ingredients. In less time than it takes me to gather my utensils, I have located just what I was searching for.

title: Currently my favorite recipe app
body: There are lots of recipe apps. And I keep trying new ones, looking for the perfect one. But currently this one has been very reliable for me.  My only gripe would be that it doesn't ingest the recipes into a common format, instead it requires you often times to follow a link to the original website. This means that some recipes aren't actually "in the app" which just means the formatting, and page layout can be difficult on smaller screens.

title: NEEDS 1 OPTION TO GET 5 STARS
body: I recently downloaded this app & so far I LOVE IT!!  The one thing I thought would be great was the likes/dislikes at the beginning to "explore" recipes. Unfortunately, it doesn't allow you to get specific. For example: Seafood & Fish categories. I ABHOR oysters, clams, mussels, anchovies, sardines, smelts, & mackerel. But, I LOVE shrimp, scallops, lobster, salmon, swordfish, flounder & haddock. You get the idea. Currently, this app only lets you select a type of food with an all or nothing approach. If this were changed to a dropdown screen, so that when you tap on a category such as seafood (or fish) you could eliminate foods you hate from being suggested, I would definitely give it 5 stars!!!

title: Love it! Just please get rid of...
body: Great app for recipes! Easy to navigate and save favorite recipes and categorize them at the same time. However, when clicking the directions to a recipe, the bar stating "Tap to rate on Yummly" is a bit annoying and obstructing, it takes away screen real estate. I know the developers of Yummly are trying to encourage their new function of posting user (or rather, chef/baker) reviews, but I feel as if the function were prominent enough that there is no need for the bar near the bottom of the screen. The app crashes only occasionally after browsing for a looong time, but overall it's one of the best recipe apps I've seen!

title: Nice App
body: I really do like this app. It's good for looking up, and sharing recipes. You can chose what kinds of foods you do or do not like. The app will show you only the recipes that appeal to you, and your taste. You can also review the recipes to let others know how they turned out. Whether you like them, or not. Also, you can add ingredients from the recipes to a shopping list in the app. It allows you to check off the list. There is also an option to order these ingredients. However, there isn't a grocery delivery service in my area. But it does have the feature for those who do.

title: Missing 2 Features
body: Yummly needs to introduce an easier way to organize favorite recipes in "All Yums" into collections after the user has clicked the Yum/Like button on a recipe page. I have hundreds of Yums and no way to organize them other than to enter each individual recipe page and Add To List. Maybe a multi-select feature that would allow moving multiple Yums into categories? This would make the custom collection feature more attractive too as I could more easily build a menu from favorite recipes that I've tried in the past.

title: Great!
body: I've never used such a convenient recipe app before. Two things that can improve out of the millions of things I love is when getting an item on your grocery list it should know that I need a specific amount of a thing when more than one recipe is calling for it. Instead of having seven "jasmine rice" items to click. The second is instead of taking me to the website and needing to scroll through the bs of a lady talking about her day and how funny it was making it last time I want to just see the directions I don't care for the extra stuff.

title: Adventurous Cuisine
body: The app helps alleviate the doldrums of coming up with a menu every week.  Just enter your food preferences and bingo a new adventure in cuisine is at your fingertips if you want to try something new.  Shopping list feature is a plus but could use some cross referencing functionality for similar ingredients across different recipes.  Also infrequently the preparation instructions are not immediately apparent with a speed video. Having to hit pause more than a couple of times when my hands are deep six in preparing the dish does not work for me.   I was an unimaginative zombie dinner preparer and this app opened me up to other possibilities.

title: Pretty good, not perfect
body: I've used Yummly now for over a year. I like that my recipe box is so accessible and you can search for recipes so easily. My biggest gripe with the app is that to view the recipe directions it takes you to the website where there are tons of ads or other junk on the websites that can make it difficult to actually get to the recipe. Thank goodness for food bloggers, really, but c'mon please don't make me scroll for 3 full minutes, X out of 6 ads and get redirected inadvertently trying to access the wonderful goodness that is the recipe's directions. If Yummly could figure that out, I for one would be especially happy.

title: Use it everyday!
body: The app functions very well, and it includes many recipe and cooking blogs I already love! I really like this app, and use it all the time. I also like the categories you can choose, and make yourself, to save the recipes you like. Overall, I'm very pleased with the app, with both performance, and the information available. It only makes it easier to find recipes online, but it is my go to. I think people expect too much from apps, it's not yummlys job to make sure Every cook has all the nutritional info for every recipe! Anyway I love it.

title: great app being ruined by ads
body: love this app. love that it lets me choose what kind of cuisine I want to see recipes for ‚Äì if I don't want to see dead animals in my recipes, I just tell the app that, and voil√†! ‚Äì no dead animals in my recipes. a beautiful and important function that all too few recipe apps and websites provide.

title: New update causes crashing
body: I was an avid user of the app and loved it. Then it upgraded to Version 2.0. That's when the problem started. And it didn't just happen to me. It happened to many people. The app would crash either upon opening or after several minutes of use. But now the have released an update to fix that bug. The only problem I have with the update is that it didn't fix the problem for me. The app still crashes upon opening. I upped my rating from 1 start to 2 stars because it's seemed to have helped others. But it hasn't helped me.

title: The BEST yet!!!
body: This app is the best for every cook, baker there is. Omg you can type in a recipe and it will search numerous web pages and let you select what ever one you desire. Plus one easy button allows you to save recipes quickly to your recipe box without refreshing the page. And I like the fact that I can have hundreds of recipes saved but when I go to my yums saved recipes instead of scrolling down the long list looking for a particular recipe, I can just type in a couple of letters at the top of the page and my save recipe pops up.

title: Lipstick on a pig
body: While the app is visually quite nice, the experience is frustrating. If your screen goes to sleep in the middle of cooking and you unlock your phone again, the app refreshes to the home screen, forcing you to click through many steps to get back to your recipe. When this is happening upwards of 10 times in the middle of cooking, you may as well not even use the app.

title: Great, but....
body: Okay, I'm giving this app 4 stars because it really is great, despite one major flaw, which I am counting on being fixed soon. That major flaw is the recipes not updating and displaying correctly in the yum categories. Countless others have commented on this as well. To the developers: please fix ASAP!

title: Yay for Yummly
body: I love using Yummly. It is convenient, easy to navigate, and always provides so much variety in the dishes it generates when you search something!

title: Use it every day
body: I really love this app. I am on it daily looking for new recipes to make for my husband. The only thing that is a little disappointing. People do not give reviews of the recipes. I love looking at how they liked the recipe. What did they do to make it better. I wished more people would take the time to review each recipe. I also do not like that you can't print off the recipe. You have to waste your phone or tablet batteries. Also when you get recipes in your email every time you want to save a recipe you have to log in. Drives me batty.

title: WHERE HAS THIS BEEN MY WHOLE LIFE
body: I just spent the last hour going through this app (which I happened upon looking at a recipe online) and I haven't found ONE thing I don't like. It does everything all the other grocery and recipe apps couldn't do combined! It groups your ingredients, it's sensitive to dietary restrictions only showing you recipes you can eat, and it's so freaking easy to make an exact list of what you need so you don't overspend. I'm literally dying of happiness right now.

title: Nearly Perfect but Needs 2 Improvements
body: Yummly is the recipe app I've always wanted. It's visual, intuitive and packed with useful features. Though, there are two improvements I would love to enhance my experience with this app:

title: Great for meal planning
body: I've been practicing a style of meal planning for a year now after failing to find an app that meets it. Finally I can across this app and I'm a very happy cook! It allows me to create a queue of meals based on what I selected and bought ingredients for. I can also easily find a recipe whenever I spot a good deal in the supermarket and know what items I still need to get. I like that I can adjust the serving in a snap, which helps while I'm shopping. I find it very easy to use as I'm not tied to a specific database or website. What an awesome app this one is!

title: Great pics, nutrition, and search abilities
body: Like using this app, but they need to update features. Unable to easily adjust your saved recipies, and once you have created a 'board' you are unable to delete it. Editing is not simple... even sometimes impossible. You can search within your recipies but only by words included in the title... Not by ingredients, which would prove EXTREMELY helpful especially when you are trying to clean out the fridge or only have a few ingredients on hand. If they changed that and allowed for the ability to edit and select more than one recipe at a time while doing so this would be the best app out there!!!

title: My Go To Cook Book
body: The Yummly App is the best free food recipe app that I've found. I've downloaded a few others but always used this app. You can basically search the ingredient you have and they give you so many recipes. Plus it give you the calories and ingredients needed for the recipe. It would be cool if there was another tab with what cooking / baking utensils and or equipment you will need. Sometimes that's the deal breaker for me that I may have all the ingredients but not have the equipment in my kitchen. Overall I love this app and I know others would too.

title: BEST recipe app BY FAR
body: I have tried many apps for recipes, but Yummly is the only one I continue to use. Each recipe I have made so far is simple and delicious! Tastiest recipes, simple to use, easy to remember the app. Easy to link multiple devices by logging in. The one criticism is that it was easy to lose which recipe I was making (a new screen showed up if I logged out then had to search through recipes to get back to the correct one - hopefully I remembered the exact name) until I realized I had to Yum and categorize it before getting started.

title: Needs share sheet or open in Safari
body: I mostly like the app, as it's a great resource. I like being able to search by ingredient, dietary preference, and prep time.

title: Amazing!
body: When I downloaded this app, I figured it was going to be similar to Pinterest. Definitely not!! The amount of recipes they offer are amazing! There are so many different ways to make one recipe that you'll never get bored! My family and I have found so many easy, delicious, and flavorful recipes that we have fallen in love with! The fact that I can make lists such as Dinners, Snacks, Liked, Not Liked, make it so easy to keep track and remember what I have saved and tried!

title: Really good app but...
