body: I find that I really enjoy this app. It's always getting new recipes, which is awesome. The only thing I have found an issue with is the nutrition category. There are many recipes on here that have outrageous calories counts. In most cases it for things that have simple ingredients that could never add up to the amount of calories listed. Unless they are considering the count for the entire dish. In which, they need to change the amount per serving tab as well. I'm always trying to eat healthy and when I find a good recipes and want it to stay in my calorie realm; I end up not using them. Due to this error in the app. Or at least what I perceive as an error.

title: So convenient!
body: It's so nice to have the internets worth of cookbooks and chef blogs all in one place. I have made so many recipes I found using this app and not one has let me down. I especially love the 'no sleep' feature when I'm looking at a recipe. It so convenient to not have to touch my phone or iPad to unlock the screen when I'm right in the middle of cooking and need to look at the next step or the amount of an ingredient I need. And the customizable categories make it easy to find recipes I've already saved to create the perfect meal.

title: Used to be good
body: tl;dr - this used to be a good app, but now it just wastes my time

title: Want to love this, but...
body: I have legitimate food sensitivities that lead to visible mouth sores among other things. I was thrilled to find and app, which would exclude specific food items. It does not. Recommended recipes consistently have the two foods I avoid. A second complaint: the app is not intuitive. I love the idea of the convenience of an app finding recipes with the foods I have on hand as advertised and have yet to be able to find it on the app. Blah.

title: I'm now a cook
body: I've never been one to cook, other than heating up frozen meals. Mostly it has been for lack of knowing what to cook or what ingredients to buy at the grocery store. Since I downloaded this app, I've found myself cooking a lot more and eating out less. It lets you browse suggested recipes, search and save for later.  The recipes have ingredient lists that you can use to add items to a shopping list. This is very helpful when planning meals and trips to the grocery store. This app has been a positive in my life.

title: Excellent app!
body: I would have given it a 5 star if it wasn't for one thing that makes it a little annoying when you are multitasking on you phone or if the phones locks, the issue is, sometimes if you unlock your phone you will find the recipe you were working on disappeared. It goes back to the main screen of the app. So if you didn't save the recipe you were cooking, it can be a little annoying trying to find it while you are cooking and your kids are screaming. But maybe that's an apple mistake, I don't know.

title: Not awful, not great.
body: Older versions seemed to work better for me. I agree with other reviewers regarding glitches such as not being able to see all of my saved yums and starting at the home screen after phone locks, but equally as aggravating is the app locking up when in the "directions" tab (too many ads or scripts running?), and that it asks repeatedly if you want to see what others in your area are cooking (no, still don't). I think it would be nicer to organize my saved yum categories alphabetically. Hopefully, they'll get some of the freeze-up bugs worked out (because nobody likes bugs in their kitchen).

title: In a pinch
body: I must say that I really do use this app more than searching the web or opening a cookbook.

title: Almost perfect
body: I am a very picky eater, so it has always been hard for me to find recipes that don't include ingredients I dislike. With Yummly and its great filters, I can finally browse endless recipes that only include the things I like!

title: Best food & recipe app EVER!!!
body: A must use- I recommend this app to all of my friends, family, co-workers. I love the shopping list feature that lets you add the ingredients for every recipe straight to a list that is editable! If you have the ingredient already, you just heck it off and it leaves everything else there. Make shopping a breeze and I can add my incidentals on there too and use it right in the store. It's also great for party planning--you can create a folder to save recipes for all your upcoming events. Get this now! You won't be sorry!

title: Pretty good...
body: I love the pictures and great variety of recipes. The only issue is that I have diet constraints and not all recipes properly list ingredients -- so even with the filter, there are a lot of things which come up that I cannot eat. I feel like this is very important to correct. I have changed them if I could or sent in a report that something needs correcting, but I'd rather Yummly staff just take care of this without my intervening, because if I do a web search for recipes, I rarely get things that I can't eat. I feel like this area of things could use serious improvement, especially with how many people have dietary restrictions.

title: Good, but was better
body: My most used recipe app. But the latest changes have ruined it somewhat. Fine to have a few articles & videos, but there are way to many. And they are often meaningless. I don't need a video to show me how to quickly peel an apple or how to cut bread for stuffing. What's next? A video showing how to pour milk on cereal? I'm really here for the recipes.

title: Great app and site
body: I've been using the Yummly site for approximately two years. It's efficient, allowing the user to search recipes based on ingredients you may have on hand, or by specific types of recipes (i.e., "pound cake," as an example). You can save your favorites, create a recipe box sorted however makes sense to you, and create shopping lists. Best of all, the database is exhaustive. A search for a recipe may pull up recipes from magazines, such as Martha Stewart or Southern Living, as well as from blogs throughout the internet. Well done, folks at Yummly!

title: Life Changer
body: Since I went vegan, I've really been forced to get my cooking skills on point. This app has been a major asset in that department. I love that I can set my dietary preferences in order to avoid digging through a bunch of recipes I'll never use. I'm only shown vegan recipes. I choose my recipe and put the ingredients that I need on my shopping list. I usually go for simple yet flavorful recipes, but you can go all out of you want; the variety is great. I really have  been cooking a lot more and have grown in confidence in the kitchen. This app is great!

title: Beautiful design. I love it.
body: This app is so beautifully designed! Everything moves the way you want it to: clicking a picture brings up its recipe with a list of ingredients quickly, and you can load directions if you want. It includes the calories right there too. Swipe right to pull up options for favoriting the recipes or not.

title: Keeps Crashing
body: I was about to give 4 * s, but it's such a good app I couldn't help myself. It won't open at the moment and keeps crashing, but when it's up it's awesome! I love selecting my meals each week, and making grocery lists. It had never crashed before today, I was telling my lil sister about it at dinner tonight, and it kept crashing. I rebooted my phone, and it kept crashing. I am going to try to re-install and hopefully that will help. I love it so much that I really don't mind so much if it wants to take a break. Amazing app!

title: Great, but ads are annoying
body: I love this app! It does everything I need and more. Search for specific recipes, or just type in broccoli to find recipes that use broccoli, then add ingredients to my shopping list, and send the list to my hubby, or shop with the check list in the app. Awesome! BUT the advertisements interfere with the cooking directions so often that I usually just go to the source of the recipe when it's time to cook. I'd pay money to make the ads go away but I haven't found that as an option, so I only gave the app 4 stars. But this app is DEFINITELY worth downloading.

title: Absolutely impressed
body: I seriously love this app so much and I never write reviews of that tells you anything. First of all it filters depending on food allergies, food you don't like, and what dietary preference you are -vegan, vegetarian, or paleo-, which is wonderful. Second, when signing up it first asks what gender you are, then it asks what you identify as. I got so so happy, I, myself, am not trans* but I'm very close to people who are and it's hard for them when they have to choose between male and female when asked. Oh, and the recipes are very very good! üòã

title: An ESSENTIAL
body: I have had this app for about 1 year. It has so many  recipes that have yums/likes on it showing how good it is. It has recipes for EVERY occasion. Breakfast, snack time, lunch, dinner, dessert, smoothies, and other drinks. In the app all the ingredients are listed, you can change the serving size and the ingredient amount will change to what the serving needs. If you don't have an ingredient you have a shopping list that reminds you what you need for a certain recipe. I haven't  looked on any other cooking website since I got this app! It is a must!

title: Good App, but glitchy
body: Love the app. Some glitches though... when I use it on my iPad, I find it very annoying that I always have to log-in. It should remember you. It's also slower on the iPad than on the iPhone. Sometimes it also just closes on its own. I also wish they would include FODMAP friendly foods as a choice in the filters for those of us who have fructose malabsorption. I know I'm nitpicking, but perhaps this will help make the app better!  Love the shopping list and tons of awesome recipes and the layout. Thumbs up.

title: Awesome!
body: I love yummly because it gives me tons of recipes that aren't too hard to make. I'm a vegetarian so when I started with the app, I could choose that I was a vegetarian and all of the meals now don't have meat.  It also had a list of food you could choose from that you didn't like or type in your own. I use it all the time to cook. I also like how the recipes are constantly being updated and new recipes coming in. I would definitely get this app if you're looking for new recipes or fun things to cook.

title: Convenient, but...
body: The app is easy to use, and focuses on recipes based on your food profile choices. But most of the recipes are links to other sites that sometime require signing up and logging into their site to view the recipes. About 50% of the recipes, even followed to a T, have been pretty terrible. I'm vegan, so I'm used to frequently bland food. But what I can't stand is vague recipes with instructions like "a few" or "some" quantity of an ingredient, and/or recipes that clearly the creator never actually tasted... undoubtedly a concept that sounded good in concept, but was terrible in execution.

title: Good service, sort of annoying interface.
body: The ability to set dietary restrictions so that you never have to see something you can't eat (thus avoiding the timesink of finding suitable recipes on Google or social media) is the reason I use this, and it does that job very well.

title: Amazing!!!
body: I absolutely love this app.  So many great ideas for every occasion. My family loves that I started using this app as well.  Quick, easy meals that break us out of our normal routine.  Additionally, my husband and I (as we are becoming older) have decided to eat healthier and live a healthier lifestyle.  This app really makes it easier to do this.  Best part is that my teen daughter and younger grade school daughter love these healthier food choices.  They taste so good they don't realize how good it is for them!  I use this app everyday; an absolute must!

title: Overall, good
body: Everything is nice, besides the fact that I only see the same types of food and recipes based on my "yum's" and I can never really find something totally different. For example, if I liked chocolate cake, all I see are a million different chocolate cake recipes. I no longer see random food recipes and it seems like I have to put in some/more effort to find other food. I'm not familiar with many recipes at all so this makes it difficult for me and I wonder if other people like me find that as a tiny problem as well. Otherwise, not bad at all.

title: I joy to use
body: I have tried a lot of recipe programs and nothing compares to Yummly.  It doesn't get any better than a search engine that goes to all of the other recipes sites and culls out the best recipes.

title: Love love love this app!!
body: This app is so helpful! I just search for anything and I can find a delicious, easy to organize recipe. I've only made 2 things I didn't absolutely love, and I've used this a lot already. The best thing is that it allows you to add the necessary ingredients to your shopping list, no papers and pens required :) Plus, it also suggests other recipes you might like based on previous group recipe choices. It has really helped me build my cooking repertoire, and my friends, family, and tummy thank you Yummly üòã

title: Culinary Delight
body: I. Love. This. App. Amazing. This app makes cooking fun. Being able to share and use people's own recipes makes for a truly unique experience. I've been able to tweak recipes to my own liking and have yet to have a bad dish. I love the grocery list option as well. The instructions on some of the recipes are a bit dodgy at times but otherwise it's put together well. Because of this app I've been cooking more and I have found myself excited to find my next culinary adventure.

title: What a great app!!!!
body: I looove the recipes, the shopping list, the way you can customize dietary needs. It is the best app I have tried for this kind of thing.  My 5 year old has a gluten sensitivity and it has been hard for me to find delicious recipes that the whole family would like, but thank God I found tons of ideas here.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I wish it had a meal planner calendar so I don't forget the name of the recipes I had planned and shopped for. :))).  I would totally recommend this app to friends and family.  I'm very happy with it.

title: Excellent!
body: This is the greatest app for recipes! Before you get started your asked to fill out how many people you cook for, what types of foods you like (Mexican, Italian, etc), what ingredients you don't like, and what kind of cook you are: beginner, intermediate, advanced. Then it gives you endless recipes with beautiful pictures, list of ingredients to print out for shopping and the recipe to print. So simple. It's super fun and addicting, like Pinterest!  Highly recommend!  I've already used several recipes and they were delish!!!

title: App Saved Thanksgiving
body: I love this app.  I procrastinated on getting my turkey day recipes together this year.  I had never used this app, but thought I would try.  It saved my families Thanksgiving.  The recipes I wanted were so easy to find and the shopping list was exactly what I needed to organize my last minute shopping trip.  I was able to text myself the list and I had one of the easiest Thanksgiving cooking days ever.  Plus my family raved over the new recipes I had made.  Thank you! I love the app!

title: Great for planning but not syncing
body: I love this app for meal planning and avoiding purchasing unnecessary items. It also takes the stress out of what's for dinner since I just scroll through my "yummed" recipes. I do not like how it seems impossible to sync my phone app to my online account - or even find items on one when easily located on the other, which means I "yum" less and have to use my phone during all meal prep. I've found some ways to work around those headaches and use the app several times a week as well as for all grocery trips.

title: Best recipe app.
body: This app has thousands (or more) of recipes. I can type in for example, avocado, and it gives me a bunch of recipes with avocados in it. It lets you save and categorize your favorite recipes. This app tells you the amount of servings per meal. It gives you the nutritional info. The app gives you the directions and sometimes additional pictures. The app also lets you customize you preferences, example, vegan, gluten free, allergic to tomato, dislike beets.

title: Not the best for grocery lists
body: Just got this and really struggling with the grocery list feature. It adds in the ingredients for recipes you find on the app, but when I want to add other things, it often glitches to where I can't see all of the things on my list. Not going to use it if I can't add more things to my grocery list without other things disappearing.

title: Love app, want reviews
body: I love the app and how it pulls recipes from everywhere.  All have been great so far.  But I wish yummly had their own reviews of recipes and a place to leave comments on it.  The only way I've been able to do that is through Facebook and I haven't been able to see anyone else's reviews.  And sometimes you are not able to see the reviews of the recipe on the site it was pulled from unless you leave yummly and some don't have reviews.  I would love yummly to have its own rating, reviews, comments aspect added.  Other than that LOVE it!

title: Love this app.
body: I love the UI in this app along with ease of use. By simply searching what you want to cook you get a vista of possibilities for that search. One suggestion I would make is that sometimes the ingredients aren't visible if the ingredient has a long name. Since there's no way to really see the entire ingredient because the app doesn't go into landscape mode. Please just make the ingredient more accessible so that there are no mistakes made in purchasing. Otherwise phenomenal app. Keep up the great work guys. You rock!!

title: yumm-O!
body: I use this app several times a day. I am a diabetic that is constantly looking for healthy meal choices. The nutritional values are listed and the suggestions made for me based on my searches is fantastic! The grocery list is a huge help when shopping. I always carry my phone, and I always forget the lists I write! Hehe Now it's always with me. The only thing I would change would be how some recipes are pages to navigate through to get to the "meat" of the recipe. Other than that? Perfection! üëç

title: I adore this app!!
body: Can't tell you how many food apps I went through prior to finding yummly! Others that claimed to do what yummly actually does paled in comparison. Their recipes were either way too involved, too basic, or just didn't taste good. I have yet to cook a recipe I've found on yummly that wasn't a hit with my family/friends. It is probably the most functional app I have on my phone. It's kind of obscene how often in a week I recommend it to others. Yummly, if you ever need a spokesperson, I'm your gal! üòÜ

title: Needs work
body: Yummly delivers on its promise of being a recipe aggregator. However, while it is a blessing towards variety, Yummly's dependance on web-posted recipes is a curse to its usability. Often recipe web sites are clunky and don't operate well in the embedded browser. Often the overhead of Yummly plus the web page it has loaded uses enough RAM that if I switch to a timer and back, Yummly can't remember where I was, leaving me stranded. Yummly doesn't actually make the process of cooking any smarter, it's just a glorified search engine, and if you are lucky that the web page it refers to won't be verbose to the point that you'll burn your food before you find your place again.

title: Love this app
body: I love this app, I use it to expand my recipe book and to try new things for my family. It's a great asset to my recipe box...I have already found several "Yums" that are keepers! The shopping list feature is AMAZING & BRILLIANT!! The only thing I wish was different on this app was that I could add in my own recipes for me to see. This would make shopping and weekly meal planning soooo much easier! I find myself trying 7 new recipes each week just to make the shopping and planning easier.

title: Intuitive, robust, easy to use.
body: Yummly is an easy, quick app to use for those, like me, who are frequently "on the go".  It pairs me with a variety of meals and technique levels that I can choose from based on my mood and timeframe. I can customize my feed based on ingredients either I or my family likes or dislikes, which is key. It helps me with meal planning for the upcoming week by giving me a shopping list as well. I am very choosy about which apps I subscribe to and this was a very good choice for me.

title: Great visual
body: Love the app.  I happened to find this by chance and have used it ever since.  I'm new to the cooking game and this app has been such a large help.  I also love that all the recipes have a visual to go along with them which makes my decision easier on whether to try that dish or not.   I also love how you can tailor made your preferences with food and allergies you have to where the app only gives you recipes excluding the items that are less than desirable to you.   Best food app ever!!!

title: Great for organizing and trying new recipes
body: Yummly is a great little app for finding new recipes, organizing recipes into categories, and making a shopping list from an entire menu plan. You can also add other recipes you find online to Yummly and easily print. My favorite feature is the shopping list, which organizes ingredients by category to make shopping easier and consolidates like items so you know how much you need of one ingredient that's called for multiple recipes.

title: Great app for Vegans
body: In settings you have the option to hit vegan and Yummly will only search those recipes.  The only draw back is searching for modifications and veganized versions of traditional or vegetarian recipes is difficult.  I've sent feedback and hope that something can be worked out.

title: Can't even read the recipe without...
body: The app taking me back to the iTunes Store to purchase more advertised apps. Every single time I clicked on a dish to get more details it the app would automatically open the iTunes app to buy or download apps such as Uber and Lyft.  I just downloaded this app today and it's pointless every time I go back to the recipe it directs me to the App Store like 6 seconds later. Sadly this app isn't for me, going to be deleting it now. Wish I could have actually used this app.  I hope the creators also are made aware of this advertising issue so they can somehow correct it and people can actually read this recipe without interruptions.

title: The user experience is second to none
body: The only reason this app isn't getting 5 stars (yet - I'm sure the developers will continue improving) is because when I hit the "back" symbol to leave the recipe and go back to the "home feed," it refreshes and takes me back to the very top, causing me to lose my precious place in the stream of recipes. If this were fixed and I could return to the home screen, the app would get a solid 5 stars. Beautiful user experience, detailed nutritional info, and awesome categorization options.

title: Love this App!!
body: I have the hardest time trying to figure out what to have for dinner. I'm not much of a preparer. I look in the fridge, the freezer and pantry and think.... Nope, we don't have nothin... Even though they're mostly full. I just don't know how to throw things together. This app has helped me tremendously! If I'm looking for a side dish, I'll just type in easy side dish and scroll through till I find something I have and that looks easy enough. If you need any kind of recipe, just search it. That simple.

title: Yummly is amazing
body: I used to google all of the recipes I wanted when it was time to cook. Then I would have to start the process over if I wanted to make it again. This app lets you keep a virtual recipe box and I never have to worry about losing a recipe I like... And there are thousands of delicious new things to experiment with in the kitchen once you start using this app! I also love the filters that are available! I have found lots I dele opus healthy recipes with no sugar! :) 5 stars from me!

title: Awesome app I use it all the time!
body: I love Pinterest... however with Yummly there is virtually no searching for recipes!! Pretty much can go straight to them instead of searching and searching and searching like I did on Pinterest! Then the added plus of being able to make menus by days of the week that's how I use it, I love it! It makes your shopping list very easy. I have a grocery shopping list app that I don't even use anymore that I've used for over five years!

title: Why stop my music?
body: This is a great app and I love the concept of adding ingredients to my shopping list. However, when it comes time to prep and cook, I like to play music off my phone. Yet when I go to this app to look at instructions, it stops the audio from wherever I'm playing music.

title: Easy and tasty
body: I love this app because I can search for anything and can usually find multiple recipe options or I can browse and find new recipes. I like that I can save and organize my recipes so I can find them later. With so many iffy recipes out there, I like that when I click on a recipe it takes me to the original website where I can usually find reviews as well as see how many yummly likes there are for a recipe, so I don't waste my time on a complete dud.

title: Great recipes; frustrating app
body: I love all the recipes on Yummly and have made quite a few of them. When I use it from my PC, it's easy to download and print them out. However, when I'm not home and use the app from my phone, it becomes a chore to download the entire recipe's directions! I get so frustrated after the 3rd or 4th try, I just go to a different site, where the recipes are easy to download. Why do you have to go thru so many steps and why don't the icons reveal what they do? If it was easier, I'd rate it 5 stars as I cook a lot!!

title: Best app for exploring cooking new foods, with minor drawbacks
body: There are so many great options, for whatever skill level you are looking for cooking. Really lets you explore different foods and cuisines.

title: Easy peasy
body: I have always had a hard time cooking meals because I have a hard time organizing ingredients and following directions. With Yummly, I'm able to make grocery list quickly. It seems as though there are so few ingredients in the recipes I'm looking at and they're super simple. I'm encouraged to try new things and not stuck in the rut of the same recipes over and over again. This is the first recipe app that I've ever used, and I'm not gonna try anything else!

title: Let me log in please
body: This is a beautiful app, and i was so excited to download it...Now, I can see how it would be frustrating if you don't have an account to log in with and can't use all the features. But I think it's slightly more irritating when you do have an account but they won't let you access it. Anytime I click in the login, it just loads forever (w/ the little steaming pot; I'm beginning to hate that pot). I haven't found anything to fix this prob, and not being able to at least save recipes makes this app pointless for me. Please just let me save recipes.

title: Amazing app
body: I love and use this app daily. Very useful but one thing I couldn't understand while reading some of these ratings is everyone loves this app (which they should) except for a few but their reasoning is they don't want to sign on Google.. I say for those complaining about that should go back to the olden days where you look up recipes in books and stay off the online recipes if you want to complain about something so stupid.. This app is amazing

title: Tasty app, but it could be DELISH.
body: I like this app a lot, but there are a few things that could be improved:

title: Needs More Features
body: The app looks pretty with nice pics of recipes and they are displayed in an informative way. But the user is presented a random list of recipes sandwiches, drinks, desserts all come up at the same time. You cannot view by category if you want a breakfast you have to hope something appear in the list. You can search for ‚Äòdinner‚Äô but it there should be categories to make it easy to find what you want. Also, most of the recipes did NOT have a calorie count. What‚Äôs the point of integrating with Healthkit if you cannot count calories.

title: Simply the best!!!
body: Yummly is the digital recipe scrapbook or 3x5 card file we have all been waiting for.....every recipe you have dreamed or searched for, and searchable by any ingredient, taste, or calorie count you want.

title: It's better to write down your own recipes
body: I used this app last summer when I visited my grandmothers from both sides of my family. They taught me their homemade recipes of some of my favorite dishes! I was excited to find Yummly because I was able to save my grandmothers recipes, including how to cook them (temperatures etc). The whole process was really easy. I use iCloud to back up my phone so when I had to buy a new phone, I wasn't worried about loosing all of my recipes or any other content for that matter. WELLLLLL come to find out, after logging back into Yummly EVERY SINGLE ONE of my grandmothers recipes was DELETED!! So I no longer use Yummly for anything. Writing down my recipes is way more reliable than an app!!

title: Great for Paleo
body: Finds lots of great recipes for my wife and I.  Love that we can mix and match multiple ideas from many recipes we've saved to find the best one for us to keep going back to easily. It's been a life saver when looking to fill that craving with a healthy Paleo alternative simply and easily and organized. Sometimes freezes occasionally when looking at the web sites directions page, but once it clears it seems to be ok again.  Maybe a minor glitch but still way worth the occasional hiccup.

title: Will LOVE this app when......
body: This app is able to pull from an enormous number of Internet recipes. However, when I pick one to check out, and then try to navigate back to the main feed by hitting the back arrow button, it drops/closes and I have to restart the app all over again if I want to keep looking!!! Annoying, especially when I'm scanning a lot of recipes.

title: The best thing since sliced bread!
body: Yummly is by far the best recipe app I have used! Very user friendly and easy to navigate. I love that I can save recipes to a collection for future use and to stay organized. The app also helps recommend recipe and refine searches based on my dietary restrictions and personal preferences. The best part is the shopping list feature. I always add the ingredients I want to buy for a specific recipe and check them off in the app when I'm in the store. Very helpful!!

title: Great but missing a few features
body: I use this app almost every time I cook and I love it! I do suggest the option to save whole categories of "We think you may like." A lot of times it's too many to go through in one sitting, but I like some of them. Also, having the option of not having the lighting on your phone time out while looking at recipes would be a useful addition. If I don't do it on my general settings, I'm forced to unlock my phone to finish reading the recipe with wet, salmonella covered fingers üòï

title: Great app, probably one of the best recipe apps, but...
body: This is a great app, probably one of the best recipe apps around, but... NO iPAD version really? It would seem an app more suited for the iPad, than iPhone, since most people would be cooking in a kitchen, where a book sized device, similar to the size of a cooking book would be used and not a 4" monitor!

title: The best cooking app everüëçüëçüëçüëçüëç
body: Unlike,when I was using internet for searching recipes,now I can find exactly what I'm looking for. Plus,I can use tablet while cooking,because the screen does not shut off with this app,which always happen when I'm using internet(I used to print recipes out). Plus it lets you organize your favorites and shopping list real nice.

title: A foodie's secret source
body: If you want to take your obsession for seriously good food to the next level, this is the app for you. Yummly gathers recipes from RELIABLE recipe resources on the web that are tried and true. While a great tool for foodies, it's designed so well that even a person new to cooking could use it. Every recipe I've made from Yummly has been a hit and frequently I've had people ask me for recipes I've gotten from Yummly!  You won't be disappointed as you YUM away!

title: Must have!!!
body: This app is only available on apple app store and I feel sorry for other users! This is so far the best recipe app. We have tried dozens and dozens of recipes from this and all of them were great! It has options for almost all kinds of cuisines. All recipes are free. And mow new feature allows you to make a groceries list or add ingredients from the recipe to the list directly. All in all awesome app! Whether you are an armature/enthusiast/expert at home cooking, this app is a must!

title: Great!!
body: I absolutely love this app!! The food choices are amazing and the fact I can make u "yums" list is great! Every so often after clicking on a recipe to read it and try to go back to the recipe list the scroll option jams and stalls for a minute and I have to wait for it to fix itself. And when I picked vegan a couple of times I still got one or two meat recipes in my list. It doesn't happen every time but it did a few times. But outside of those two lil issues, I love everything about this app.

title: Easy to use
body: This app is perfect!  I hate to cook, but this app makes it easy. The app allows the ingredients to be added to a list (all at one time), and when you're at the market, you can tick off the items you already have. Each recipe also includes the time to prepare and cook. Absolutely, a must have for beginners and cooking enthusiasts alike. I'd be remiss if I didn't mention how amazingly reliable the recipes are. I receive so many compliments when I prepare a Yummly recipe.

title: Good and a bit annoying
body: Love Yummly.  Astonishing number of recipes, very intuitive interface, and scary smart about figuring out what I like.  You should download it. 5 stars for this.

title: Lost potential
body: I really do love Yummly, but it's deeply flawed. You can't save your own recipes or create meal plans- I'm constantly switching between this and my notebook app. The search engine is also very irritating. You can search by ingredient, but not by things like "sides" or "light lunch" or "Mediterranean;" you'll only get hits on things that happen to have put these in their recipe title or ingredient list, not necessarily the type of food you're looking for, so half the time it's just easier to google ideas to cook. I like it, but it's lacking and very backward from what technology is capable of.

title: Must Have
body: Must have recipe app!  Adjusts to whatever skill level from novice to advanced or chef. You can enter your diet and special needs. The filters in the settings can be set to search by ingredients, cooking time, in settings you can adjust for the number of guests, and more. It displays nutritional information and tips in the directions. I truly think it is the best cooking app out there. That is my opinion and I am 56 yrs old and have been cooking since I was 15 yrs old.

title: Bravo Yummly
body: Greatest food app of all time. Excellent layout, easy to use, great recipes, easy to save into your own categories or preset categories. Easy to search by category or specific ingredient. Love how it caters to your exact life style. The kinds of foods you eat, what goes in them, what kind of food you like to eat, diets and allergies. I will never need another cook book again. By far the most perfect app ever invented. I can't even think of how to make it any better. Love love love

title: Only 2 problems
body: This app is incredible and amazing. Tons of wonderful delicious recipes at my fingertips, a search option, clear easy directions and smart find after you start using it. The only real problem is that if you don't have wifi you can't access or use the recipes when your shopping to see what you need to buy. The other problem is looking at all the delicious food will make you hungry...

title: A simple, useful, and helpful app!
body: This is a great app for anyone looking to change up their meals. There are tons of super simple recipes and it's easy to just click and get all the ingredients you'd need.

title: Great tool, could be better!
body: First off, this app is amazing for discovering new recipes from all over the web. I love how easy it is to create shopping lists from recipes on other sites. The biggest thing missing from the Yummly app is a true weekly meal planning feature. As it is set up right now, you can only file recipes into categories. It would be great if you could create the shopping list for an entire week's worth of meals, and assign each meal to a different day. Having this feature would  be key for my use, and take the app from 3 to 5 stars!

title: Delicious App
body: I can honestly tell you that I have tried many of the recipes I put in my collections and have only been disappointed a couple of times. I use it almost daily. I love the grocery list feature. I make my menus from it. We have stopped eating out as much because the food I prepare from this app is so amazing!!! I am gluten free and it is easy to find recipes to fit my needs. I can't say enough about it. GET THIS APP and use it! Your tummy will thank you.

title: Absolutely the BEST!!!
body: I have soooo many cookbook apps, many of them I paid for. I use a few but I consistently come back to yummily, because it really is the BEST!

title: No sort ability, interface is clunky
body: Am I the only person who wants my food to taste good?  Once I've found a group of recipes I want to be able to sort them by rating. Not going to waste my time making a dish that no one likes. With this app?  No sorting. Stupid. The rest of the interface is clunky and counterintuitive. I'm glad that your designers found out how to use the fancy slide features, and the accordion features, but I don't care how slick the app looks, I want to be able to find a recipe, see what's in it, and how to make it. All that other crap is secondary.  Deleting from my phone as soon as I post this review. Come back when you're app is a little more mature, Yummly.

title: Love it!!
body: Love everything about this app and would highly recommend!! My only problem so far is searching for specific blogs- sometimes I can find certain ones, but cannot get to others, however sometimes if I search for the specific recipe name I can get to some of their recipes, but again, not consistent . I just have several recipes from my favorite blogs that I would love to get uploaded but can't figure out how.

title: A+
body: This app is perfect, especially if you're dieting. It's still great even if you're not on a meal plan, because there are loads of great recipes. You can set your preferences to however you like, to fit the needs of your current diet. If you see a recipe you like, you can add the ingredients to your grocery list by simply the click of a button. This app is so easy to use that you'd be missing out if you didn't download it immediately!

title: Excellent App!!!!
body: I've been using Yummly for a few years now and I have to say it ceases to amaze me. It is a very well thought out and organized application the recipes that are complied in the database are extremely delicious and it allows my family and I to try new variations on old recipes easily. It had been extremely useful when our basement got remodeled and I wasn't able to have access to my library of  cookbooks for the holidays.

title: Better Than Pinterest
body: I was using Pinterest for my meals for the family but it drove me crazy when you would have open another window, and if you phone blacks out, when you re-open it would lose out all the Pinterest recipes and you would have to re-find again.  Yummly makes it easy to find new recipes by looking for things you like and when you have it open, it stays open!! Great app!!

title: A feast for the eyes and palate! Great aesthetics! Overall pleasure for the senses!
body: This is a great app for foodies and techies. Not only are the recipes delicious, they are efficiently organized and well presented with mouth-watering photos. I like the color tones and hues as well as the fonts and types used by the app creators too. It enhances the recipe browsing experience. Everything is simple and neat...as with cooking, you don't need to complicate things, just as a few fresh ingredients treated with passion and care create an outstanding meal so too a great recipe app! Food lovers and cooks will love this app too!

title: I've actually made stuff from this app
body: I've tried BigOven and whatnot but none of them are fun to use. This app however has awesome pics and dishes out some good dishes I would consider trying. How many dishes have I actually done well 1 but that's a higher rating than my experience with any other app. Instructions are easy to read so they don't scare me off. Thank you! It's always been a dream of mine to cook more of my meals and now I found my motive to do so a.k.a Yummly

title: Lovin Yum!
body: I love this app! I can easily lose track of time at night just searching through all the delicious looking recipes. I'm always looking for something new and this gives simple recipes from all categories. I enjoy it has the separate tabs for ingredients , nutrition, and directions. All the ads under the directions can be a bit discouraging , resulting in the 4 not 5 stars, but all in all the app is wonderful and makes the " never ending recipe search task"  for all us cooks a lot more pleasurable !!!

title: Amazingly easy and convenient
body: Love love this app! It gives you easy recipes, easy to follow instructions, normal ingredients... lol some other apps give you recipes with out of this world ingredients.

title: Easy and Convenient
body: Easy to use and has a lot of recipes to choose from. I like the shopping list feature because it's easy to just select an ingredient that I don't have without having to go to another app or writing it down. I've seen a few recipes online that aren't on the app and it needs a better personalization process since there are things people can dislike and like in one category. Other than that this is a definitely an app worth downloading.

title: Pretty good
body: Yummly as it says in my title is pretty good. Not as comprehensive as a regular old cookbook. It does have a mass amount of recipes to choose from. Sometimes it may have too many recipes of just one item, but you can get a good over view of what might be a popular recipe or food craze. I will say this, Its helped me out in a few tight spots. Only negative, it can crash unexpectedly sometimes and even if your connection is good sometimes it can't search, or the thing your looking up can't be found.

title: Great idea and design, needs improvement
body: I love the look of this app and all the variety of recipes; however, I don't like that it takes me to an external site. I want to be able to print the recipes straight from my phone and for me to be able to select the ingredients and have them be compatible with my shopping list I already have on my phone so I can just export it. Also, I don't like they when I'm scrolling, it shows recipes I've already selected because I accidentally unselect them when I am trying to select them again

title: Yummly
body: Amazing and simple.

title: Review
body: I enjoy using Yummly and have made it the backbone of my menu planning. It's groupings and shopping list save me a lot of time. I am thrilled about the recently added feature allowing people to review menus.

title: Useful app
body: Great resource for searching for recipes while making up a weekly menu. I like the filter options. I don't like that it still puts filtered items in the recipes when searching, but there are a lot less to filter through.

title: Beautiful App!!
body: This will change how often I cook. It's so easy to use and it seems to get to know me as I "yum" more recipes. The pictures make me drool, super inspiring. The recipes even have nutrition info. Also love the shopping list so it makes it super easy to discover and then execute the dishes. I am also able to put my recipes into collections so I can prep for an upcoming dinner party, put desserts ideas in one place. It really is limitless. Yummly has gone above and beyond.

title: New Hobby thanks to Yummly!
body: I can't say enough great things about this app. Yummly has changed my family's eating. I know it sounds like a lot of credit but I have fallen in love with cooking after finding such great recipes here. The recipe sources Yummly pulls from are so much more interesting than the traditional recipe sites. My new hobby has led our family to so many exciting new meals and a healthier overall lifestyle thanks to the handy nutritional info! Thank you to the Yummly team!

title: I use it every day
body: Fantastic for novice or more advanced cooks. I use it for ideas and inspiration. It's especially great when you need ideas for new ingredients or combinations you're curious about. Features like the in app shopping list and yum list (favorites) are very handy. You can also customize suggestion to your particular dietary needs and see calories in each recipe. Interface is simple and easy. If you love to cook you'll love this app.

title: Great for new ideas and fresh takes on old favorites
body: I love this. Really easy to use and search. Search by ingredient or for something you always wanted to try. Plus I love the shopping list option so I can make sure I get everything I need plus add stuff I want separately. I like that it adds common ingredients together, but still separates by recipe. I really like this app and would encourage anyone who wants to cook often to get it.

title: Great recipe app!
body: I was getting tired of making the same old meals ( and eating them). This app has so many great recipes from very simple to very complex. I can find recipes for something simple on days when I barely have time for dinner to gourmet when I feel like making the extra effort. So when I'm in the mood I can find something new. Easy bookmarking for recipes I find and like, easy shopping lists. I absolutely love this app!

title: Pretty handy app, I have to say.
body: This app is awesome. Instead of having to have 3 different recipe apps along with a bajillion bookmarks under a recipe tab, I can have them all in one place. On top of the fact that the app has a separate tabs for ingredients and preparations which makes it hella easy to make a recipe without having to constantly scroll up and down the page like you would when using a browser.

title: Great recipes for anyone!
body: This app isn't like any other, I have tried many other recipe apps but this one did not failed me. I am now eating healthy, learning new ways to cook, and overall living in a healthier lifestyle! In this app you will find tons of delicious recipes, you can estimate the calories you want on a meal and the bonus part is that you can get your favorite food list deliver right to your door!  Would recommend to friends!

title: Game changer
body: I've been using Yummly for about 3 years and it has rekindled my enthusiasm for cooking for my family. I have three teens and I had kind of gotten tired of the daily grind of cooking, but yummly inspires me with beautiful pictures, and ideas. Do yourself and those you cook for a huge favor and get yummly. It's my automatic source for ideas and so much easier than Pinterest. No more getting lost in a maze. Yummly inspires you yet is very efficient. Just say yes !!

title: Hard to use
body: Well, I love the concept. It's easy to find recipes and save them into My Yums, very convenient! However, when you touch Directions, most always you get the originator's web page which is almost impossible to navigate because it is not formatted for a phone screen: text on top of itself, lots of ads piled in on top of things also. It's such a hassle. Couldn't you please format the directions within Yummly to

title: Convenient
body: I love this app. I've been using it for about a year. It is super convenient to have quick access to all of the recipes on the web, as well as recommendations just for me.

title: Really nice
body: This app is really great. There are only two things that I would change:

title: Best Food App on the IPhone
body: I used a lot if website to cook but this is by far the easiest way to find new dishes that you like. Recently, I decided to cook clean and have been having trouble eating food without getting bored but this app makes it far easier to find new recipes which I have never thought of before. Whether it is to find meals for the perfect meal plan or cooking for a family gathering, this app is well worth it.

title: App itself is great
body: I use this app frequently and with great success in finding recipes. The predictive algorithm seems to have improved as well so that I often find I am interested in the suggested recipes. The structure of the recipes themselves can be cumbersome. Many I have used are within someone's blog post about their cooking experience which makes it hard to find the directions in the story. Over all, very useable.

title: Cooking Novice - Great App
body: I'm newly married and was terrified to cook because it is something I was just never interested in. This lovely app gathers extremely quick, easy and delicious recipes together with ease. I love the shopping list feature. I'm actually enjoying cooking now and my husband has had no complaints. The only thing I wish there was a better search feature to search food by ingredients or cultural type.

title: Excessive ads spoil this app
body: I'm sure all the described features are lovely. Unfortunately I'll never know. The constant delivery of ad after ad, both interspersed within the recipes and popping up and hiding the recipes so that I have to stop every 10 seconds and find the little x to dismiss the ad, truly spoiled my first recipe search. Uninstalled within 5 minutes. Yes I looked in settings and found no way to reduce ad frequency or pay to turn them off. If the app were useful, I'd pay once to turn off ads. But I'll never know because my time is more valuable than putting up with constantly obscured content. If I could give zero stars, I would.

title: Best recipe app
body: I've used individual apps before but this app it is by far the best. Throw away the other ones. Yum Lee gets there recipes from all the other recipe sites, gives you beautiful pictures, make suggestions based on your preferences and diets. I have recommended this app to all my family members. Create in the grocery list, then get the directions. Save them as your favorites and pull them up at the grocery store.

title: Great but missing features
body: This app has great recipes, but REALLY needs to add a search filter for diabetic dietary restrictions, or increase the allergens section to include low sugar, low calorie sections. It is hard when dieting when you can't turn off all of the amazing sweets that come up.  Also would be nice if there was a thumbs down so recipes that you don't like could be deselected so it doesn't keep coming up in searches. (Example I like seafood, but not raw seafood). While you can list foods you don't like, you can't do the same for specific recipes.

title: Still LUVin' It
body: If it isn't already, Yummly should be in the Top 5 of all recipes apps ever created! It is so easy to navigate, amazingly helpful and the Yummly crew are a caring and funny lot!

title: Very good!
body: I really like this app, it's good for browsing and filtering based on dietary restrictions. The recipes I've tried have been good too!  I really like the diversity you can find. My only frustrating is not being able to sort search results by how many other people have tried it, it's a pain to have the popular ones along with the obscure ones at the top of the search bar. Would recommend!  But excited to see if the developers have a good update

title: Perfect recipe app
body: I got his because some other apps that have recipes are just so cluttered. I enjoy that this is an app specifically for recipes. It has dietary preferences and allergies that you only have to fill out once and are easy to change. It has a great variety of foods and is easy to organize. I had a concern about a recipe and the app support got back to me the same day and helped me through my confusion. Really well built app!

title: wish I could use all the functions
body: I was very excited about this app until I realized that you can't use all the functions unless you connect it with a social media site.  I don't need everyone to see what recipe I am looking at or what I am shopping for.  maybe I will give it another chance after awhile to see if they have changed.  sorry just not for me.  I am not one of those people that "check in" everywhere they go.  I like social media sites but I also like my privacy and at the rate this world is going I don't know how much longer we will have any privacy.

title: Great way to find recipes!
body: I love this app! I have found tons of great recipes! I like being able to classify by type of meal especially. Also, the app takes you very easily to the recipe's we page, much easier than Pinterest does. And I like how you can get the list of ingredients separately without Even going to the web page. This makes it easier to determine if the recipe is what you are looking for.

title: Looks like a great app but the sign in is not for me
body: This app looks great but unfortunately I'll never know. You must sign in using either google+ or Facebook. I REFUSE to get a google+ account and I personally can't stand things that MUST go through Facebook. I understand Facebook gets your product out there and gets you exposure, but there's got to be a better way. You can view recipes without the login but you cannot like them/save them, use the grocery list or get recommendations customized to your likes...which is the main "draw" to the app. Thanks guys...but you've just got to change the login methods to include a login by email or something.

title: A Paradise For Healthy Eating
body: This app has made it ridiculously easy for my brother and I to eat the healthiest, tastiest, most diet oriented meals/drinks/smoothies we have ever had in our lives. Best part about it? It sticks to your personalized diet. Oh, and it recommends new things to you within your diet. Oh, and it's free. For now. 100% recommend for anyone that is on any diet, vegetarian, vegan, etc., or just simply wants to discover new foods and how to make them at home. Great job developers.

title: Beautiful, but needs key fix
body: This app retrieves great recipes quickly and makes for saving them seamless, except your saved recipes don't show up. I have to delete the app and reload it to retrieve my saved recipe. I figured they would have fixed this after all the reviews stating the problem. I no longer use it, but do check to see if issue is fixed. For now I'm using the New York Times Cooking app.

title: Great recipes
body: I really like this app.  As another reviewer stated, if your phone locks, you have to navigate through several steps to get back to your recipe.  Links in the directions tab won't open so you have to try search for the secondary recipe manually. Other than that the app is great and recipes look delicious.  I also love how the app asks for your skill level in cooking so you're not presented with overly complicated recipes.

title: Eating "clean" or vegetarian....My Go To For What's For Dinner
body: Eating "clean" or vegetarian....good decision but being so new to this lifestyle it can be a challenge figuring out what's for dinner. Yummly is my go to app - it's easy to use, good source for tasty recipes within my budget and skill set.

title: Want to Love, but may Leave :(
body: I love love love this app, but that being said there are several lacking features that should be included.

title: Great app
body: Super useful for finding a variety of recipes from all over the internet.  Yummly also has advanced search features which helps you find the specific food you're looking for.  One issue is that when I search for foods based on nutritional value, the search doesn't properly filter the results.  For example, if I'm looking for a food with less than 10 grams of fat per serving it will still show foods with higher amounts of fat.

title: Made it fun
body: I'm a total novice when it comes to cooking. I'm male and married. My wife has been cooking for our family for years. I recently found that, with the proper instructions I too can cook on more than the grill. I'm not sure if I'm any good due to the fact my wife says the best part of my meals are that she didn't have to cook them lol. So now I'm a hunter, fisherman, sports loving Harley riding COOK! I dare you to call this Redneck a sissy! But you are invited for a heaping mans meal.

title: Could be good.. But isn't
body: I really wanted to like this but after the countless pop ups, the app constantly freezing and glitching, I'm finding something else. Every time you open or switch back it asks you for your location which gets really annoying, fast if you don't want to give up your info to their advertisers. I'm using an iPhone 6+ and it is still leggy, so I know it's not my phone that's running slow.  I really like the idea of the shopping list but it only works with certain recipes. Sigh

title: Pop-ups and Ads from HELL
body: The app is a testament of how to ruin a good product in the name of profits. Design is beautiful, the rest is basically useless leaving you spending more time trying to close pop-ups, or minimizing the 20,000 ads that cover most of the page. The Apple Watch app is useless, where the most obvious choice was to display the steps of a recipe instead of trying to be miniature version of the full app. It seems Yummly needs to go back to the drawing board and focus on getting back to its roots: providing a beautiful platform that is as user friendly as it is helpful.

title: Wonderful App!
body: I am ecstatic that I found this app when searching for recipes in the App Store. It's free and has amazing recipes and professional like photos of the meals. I've told all my friends and family about it. They love it! There's even a section to put your diet and your cuisine type. I love how you can save a recipe and even put the ingredients into a shopping list! Pure genius! Thank you sooooo much for making this app!

title: My Go To
body: I appreciate the time and effort it takes to put an app like this together.  I like that it provides the sites information so that I can view other recipes.  It's my go to for something yummy and different.

title: I love it
body: This app is amazing! It's perfect for those who want to find an exact recipe quick and easy. I love how it finds recipes that are recommended for you. My one complaint though is that the instructions to make a recipe are different depending on the recipe and there are so many ads and it makes it hard to read the instructions but besides that the app is awesome and I would recommend it to anyone who loves to cook

title: Really Great Recipes
body: I do use Yummly frequently. I enjoy categories so I can easily find something I want to make or remake again.

title: Needs improvement
body: The worst time I've had with the app, is when I'm using a recipe and it just decides to refresh the page, moving back up to the top.  Incredibly frustrating when you're actively using it.

title: Great Recipe App!
body: I just love Yummly because everything I've made using their recipes has come out delicious!  I love the vibrant pics, gives you an idea of how the food should look, but most of all I like that you get a different take on let's say chicken breasts... with so many different ways to prepare them, you don't get bored! You Yum what you love & have it for next time time or simply try a new recipe!  Yummly is absolutely Yummy!

title: Easy and convenient
body: Yummly, both website and app, is so easy to use. I love their design and the fact that they have images for each recipe, along with cook time and ingredient amount. The large variety of recipes allows for trials to find the perfect recipe for you, especially the "nutrition label" they have at the bottom of the recipe. It is an overall great app for food, drinks, and kitchen gadget recommendations.

title: Wide variety
body: This is a good app to look up recipes by ingredients you have on hand. I wish all the recipes would include an easily printable version though. So many are blogs with all kinds of prose interspersed with pictures and I find it hard to scroll through all that while actually cooking. The ads can be annoying too. That said, I have discovered new dishes that I love and I like the fact that you can save Yums in categories such as dinner/sides/desserts, etc.

title: Great app
body: I use this app almost everyday. It's amazing how man recipes are out there that I could have never imagined. I am not one for cooking but when I do want to try something different, I got straight to yumm.  I love the fact that it has a shopping list for all of the ingredients needed to make that special dish. I'm so glad people come up with these wonderful ideas and some of these recipes are just flawless.

title: Good app. One small issue.
body: Over all, Yummly is a good app. Search results are usually relevant and I've found some new favorite recipes with its use. I would prefer, however, that all recipes opened in the device web browser. If the screen locks while you're in the middle of following a recipe it goes all the way back up to the top when you unlock. This can be annoying to have to scroll all the way back down to where you left off if you were near the end. overall, good. I enjoy the concept.

title: Great App for your inner chef
body: I love this App. The App refreshes new menu options with inspired dishes you can store to individual lists or simply your favorites. You can also search for menu items too. Each dish you like comes from assorted cooking sites and come with directions to create your new found masterpiece and shopping list add-on options as well to make shopping for your new dishes ingredients a breeze.

title: Almost everything
body: I enjoy so much about this app. It's almost like playing a game just scrolling through the recipes and collecting the ones I like. Simply doing that is a great way to unwind for a couple of minutes.

title: Best recipe app I've found but.....
body: This is the biggest variety and most extensive list of recipes I've found so far! My only complaint is that when I click on the directions, it redirects me to the apps page to try to get me to download an app that isn't even related! One recipe wouldn't even let me see the directions because it redirected me every time! Very frustrating. I tried about ten times and never got to see the directions so I gave up.

title: Yummly review
body: This app is great!!! I started using it on my computer and then realized they had an app for it.. The app works well for mad when I'm trying to plan a last minute dinner, or I'm in the grocery store trying to come up with something quick... I also love this app because it helps create a grocery list for all the the items that I will need to make each dish...

title: Love!
body: Love this app, has a ton of recipes to choose from! It's nice because they have a shopping list option so you can pick and choose which ingredients you need for your recipes. Once you go to the grocery store you can pull up what you need from this app. I've started cooking more recently and am not a pro but I've been able to find some yummy recipes that are easy to make!

title: Love this app
body: This is a great app. I love the great recipes. They hit a lot of smaller sites with great recipes  I could never find all these recipes in my own. Shopping list feature is very helpful. Also it brings up recipes similar to others you like. Very intuitive. I love that you can ask for recipes matching your diet requirements or to avoid food allergies.  Wish it would expand this feature to include diabetic diets.

title: Good App - Basic to Gourmet
body: I like this app because you can find anything from "how to hardboil eggs" to Pale to Vegan. You will have to look at the recipes and directions but the app makes this simple. I really like that it gathers all those food blogs and recipe sites into results so I don't have to go to individual sites but can look for a recipe at any pf them. Like the "Yum" feature so I can have my own electronic recipe files.

title: Beautiful photos; amazing resource
body: Aside from the amazingly beautiful photos, I really appreciate that I can sort, pick and choose recipes easily, and save them. The variety is nice too - easy recipes with few ingredients as well as multi-ingredient, complex recipes can be found.

title: Looks at a lot of sites
body: Searches recipes from all over the web for you. Very easy to use and has a pleasant interface. Let's you save your favorite recipes and categorize them, also to create your own categories. Breaks recipes into ingredients and instructions so you can quickly review what you need without having to load entire directions page.

title: My go to for recipes
body: Absolutely love this app!  It has become my new recipe book. I haven't found anything I don't like about it. Use it on my phone and iPad. Wish I could get it on my Kindle. When I'm in grocery , I can quickly look up items needed for fav recipe. I've been using it for a year and been meaning to write this review. Finding some gluten free options too which are convenient.

title: LOVE THIS APP
body: This is a great app. Tons of recipes, very user friendly, and has great picture quality. Only thing I would change is how you view the actual recipe. It goes to the direct site which can sometimes be slow. It would be nice if it listed out the directions like the ingredients section but gave the link if the user wanted to access the site it originally came from.

title: Always my favorite app!!!
body: Tremendously beautiful and tremendously useful!  Check out the super fun way they figure out recipes you might be interested in.  They have ideas from everywhere...that you can add to you shopping list in a sec.  My sister lives in Nyc and does all grocery stuff through Yummly + InstaCart - when are you getting to jersey??  Off to cook something yummly...no tree nuts + pescatarian + kid-friendly + quick...bam!!

title: Good App - lots of variety
body: I love the way you get to personalize it so it recommends recipes you're more likely to try. Only complaint would be that whenever I "yum"/save a recipe, it won't show up in my saved recipes until I log out of my account and then log back in. So if I save a recipe for later today, I'd have trouble finding it. I'd have to log out/log in to refresh it. Other than that, I like it and will continue using it regularly.

title: Good App
body: I just recently started using this app. I've found some great recipes on it! I like that you can save favorites for later use and also the shopping list feature. The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5, is because I cannot seem to find recipes for small crockpots or small slow cookers. I have a 1.5 quart crockpot. So the recipes I've found, I have to try and reduce the quantities specified in the recipe, which doesn't work to good sometimes.

title: Easy to navigate, super convenient.
body: I have nothing but great experiences with Yummly. The shopping list feature is easy to use, and categorizes items for an efficient grocery store trip. Searching for the right recipe is simple with a variety of filters to choose from, including dietary preferences and cooking time. Seriously, it's the only app I'll ever need in the kitchen!

title: Great app
body: I love this app and use it when ever I want to learn something new to cook... The only problem I have with it is that you can't save the videos of the recipes like you can save the other recipes. I seriously hope they change this so that you can add the videos to favorites as well, but other than that jst a test app to have. It's your own personal cook book but digital‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Personalized recipe results
body: This app is a very useful tool that learns and predicts what recipes are right for you and gives you personalized suggestions. This is especially helpful considering they have something like two million recipes from almost every food site and blogger on the web. The beautiful pictures make it easy to choose which recipe you want to try.

title: Yummly is amazing!
body: This app is exactly what I hoped I would find. Even after filtering by many stringent dietary allergies and preferences, there is a very large range of recipes that tell you exactly how to make your dish, how long it will take, and the nutritional value. Loved it ever since I downloaded Yummly. Strives me to eat healthy and cook delicious without spending hours in the kitchen. Thank you for making my life easier. Excellent job!

title: Comprehensive and user-friendly!
body: Used this app to plan my meals over the weekend and it really helps to have a nonstop feed of recipe options with glossy photos from different sites. I have added a ton of new recipes to my collections, it's so addicting to browse all these recipes! Best part is the shopping list- you can text grocery lists to people and divide and conquer while you're shopping!

title: One improvement away from perfect..
body: I would give this five stars BUT I wish it had categories!!! Like where we could click on a category [breakfast, lunch, dinner, appetizer, dessert, etc.] and it can bring up foods in there.

title: Perfect! Couldn't ask for more
body: This app has wonderful recipes, with a clean, picture based interface. A must have for any aspiring cook or anyone looking to try something new now and then.

title: BEAUTIFUL food app!!
body: I've had this app for a week and I cannot say enough about it. Beautiful pictures, easy to use, and layout is great! I was on this app for an hour going thru all the yummy recipes and saving my favorites to try and cook for my family. Luv how by each picture they have the calories, ingredients, and cook time. You have to get this app!!! It inspired me to cook more. (Which is a hard thing to do) haha :)

title: Potential
body: I think the app has a lot of potential just that it hasn't reached the point where I'd stop using Pinterest for recipes. I tried using the booklet to add online recipes but I dislike that I can't add a photo with it. I also think it be cool to add favorite tastes and to be able to add/change a profile photo. The library of recipes will grow once adding online recipes becomes easier and with photos. Making it the ideal app for recipes.

title: High Blood Pressure!
body: I found this app while looking for recipes to better suit my partner who recently found out he has high blood pressure. It worked so well for us and made it very easy to find tasty meals with significantly less sodium. I imagine it would work just as well for someone with a food allergy or specific eat restrictions. I honestly cannot believe the app is free. I would pay for this app it's great.

title: Love the app annoyed when it returns you to the beginning of the recipe
body: I use this app all the time. It is my go-to for recipes. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because when my phone goes to sleep and I wake it back up, the app sends you back to the beginning of the recipe or blog. This gets annoying when you're trying to find the next step of a recipe and you have to scroll through a whole blog to find it.

title: PheNOMenal!
body: I absolutely love this app. I have significant restrictions on my diet, so the allergy and diet filters are wonderful for quickly finding exactly what you want or just browsing for new ideas and inspiration. I like the snapshot info they provide with each recipe before opening it up all the way up. Whether you're looking for indulgent, rich comfort food or low-cal, low-fat ways to experiment with flavor, Yummly delivers.

title: Great replacement for Ziplist
body: I was very very disappointed when the Ziplist platform was deactivated and not happy with their recommended replacement, Epicurious. I'm really happy with yummly and think with a few tweaks it could be five stars - better grocery list categories, and a way to save weekly menus would be great. I think the layout is pretty and I love that I can save recipes under multiple categories to make searching so easy. I use this app almost daily.

title: Best thing ever
body: I love food and I love trying new things. Being able to browse through hundreds of thousands of options is greaat! There is nothing you cannot find a recipe to!! Also there are some great suggestions of recipes you should try and I have found many new favorites as well as upgrades from some dishes I have made in the past! Definitely a great app!!

title: An Invaluable Resource
body: Whether I am searching for a specific recipe or looking to be inspired, Yummly is my go-to app for all my foodie needs. The collections ensure I never lose track of a recipe and the shopping lists help tremendously in a pinch at the market. It's also great for picky eaters or those who may not be able to eat certain ingredients. This is by far the best recipe app out there- I would be a complete mess without it!

title: Suggestion for this lovely app
body: First of all , i wanna say that this is probably the best recipe app out there. It has (most) of the stuff you need  to adjust it to what you really want. Awesome app!!!

title: I use this app all of the time!
body: I love this app! Weather your searching for a recipe or just browsing, you will always find something you can make. I love how it's very easy to use and saves recipes you like by adding them to your yums. You can customize this app to send your liked recipes into the category of your choosing. This is my go to app when I want to bake something great.

title: Perfect for vegans
body: I recently made the lifestyle choice to become vegan. This app has made finding recipes so much easier. I'm glad this app pulls from all over the web to provide recipes, I've never felt limited. Plus the built in ingredients list with each recipe makes it so easy to compile a shopping list. I've used this app everyday since downloading it. Thank you so much!

title: Love it
body: This app is great! I have found so many amazing recipes, most of which seem almost hand crafted for me. This app does a great job building your profile and only showing you what you're interested in. Anyone that lives to cook and try new things should check this out. Anyone that wants good recipe ideas, even if you're a beginner, should check this out as well.

title: Pretty But Unreliable
body: I must start off my review by complimenting the look of the apps interface. Visually, it's enticing but after those bells and whistles subside, all you're left with is a tune of frustration. More times than not, when I have attempted to view the actual recipes in the app, I encounter the message "Directions not available for this recipe." It's great that there's a recipe for Moroccan style tabouleh but if I can't see it, then it's useless. With some bug fixes, this could be a superb app and I might be able to try that tabouleh without the help of Google next time.

title: Great app with several flaws
body: I love this app, but it does have bugs that have been around for quite some time.

title: Go-to App
body: This app gives you plenty of options for what you're craving with associated blogs (if you're in to that), shopping list and easy to follow recipes ( even video assist). I prefer it not loose my place when I'm in the middle of following a recipe - but I'm sure they will fix that soon since many are commenting on that glitch. For me it's about the photos and tips and this app gives you ideas for the daily question: what's for dinner!

title: Best recipe app
body: I love this app. I am constantly trying to come up with creative new things to do in the kitchen, and this app is a great source of inspiration and recipes. I love the way it is set up and the easy of maneuverability. The pictures are clear and striking... In fact, as I sit there, sometimes for an hour or more, browsing recipes and scrolling around the site my wife teases me that I am surfing "food porn".

title: Love it
body: Yummly isn't your normal recipe app. It has links to an insane number of food web sites and blogs. Sometimes the ingredients show in the app aren't exactly the amounts in the recipe it links to buy that is rare. I like the ability to organize the recipes into categories and tha ability to make up my own categories. Plus putting the ingredients into one shopping list is sweet.

title: One of the best food apps but needs improvements
body: This is one of the best food apps out there and they have a lot of good content.  But as with all apps there are some things that would make this app even better. There needs to more ways to share to other people besides email and text. Their should also be a way to share to people using social networks such as Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, etc. I will give it a five when they finally allow more sharing options

title: I am cooking now!
body: Love this app. It has such a great range of recipes. Even easy to find ideas for a restricted diet.  Its' shopping list feature is wonderful, as the main reason I haven't tried a lot of new recipes in the past is because I always forget to buy one or two of the ingredients... This makes it easy, even with two little kids in the shopping cart!

title: I wish another way to sign in
body: I love all the options about this app except for the fact you HAVE to sign in with Facebook or email. I don't like it when the developers make it so your contacts or advertisement via Facebook  is the only way to sign in. It's a complete turn-off for me. But, other than that, it looks like it's well thought out. Please change so I can actually use it for my family. Thank you!:-)

title: Really enjoy!
body: I have really enjoyed using this app. The ease of use and wide variety of recipes make this an app that I use fairly often. The only drawback that I have noticed is that my home page tends to keep popping up the same exact recipes time after time even after I continue to add more recipes. It would be nice to be able to refresh my feed and new recipes pop up each time. Other than that, I love this app.

title: This is the one
body: This is the one everyone has been looking and hoping for. One Place to research recipes from many, many sites -- and the One Place to store them all in, yes, One Place. Unlike many others, this app is highly searchable, recipes can be edited and modified, it's scalable, and nutrition information is included! Nothing else comes close to this -- this is the One app to use.

title: LOVE THIS APP!!
